Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: sqze2
Reviews.Content: Spent a night in New Orleans at this wonderful French Quarter hotel. It is located on the edge of the French Quarter near the Marigny. We had a large suite with a comfy bed. While it is an older hotel we found it to be extremely clean and well kept. Nice bar and pool area. Front desk staff was very friendly and helpful. Gated parking for $20 was great for FQ. Definitely will stay again

Reviews.Title: “This our hotel of choice in NOLA”
Reviews.Author: Roq0114
Reviews.Content: This is the 4th hotel that we have tried and far best. Enough to keep this as our #1choice. We stayed in #306 and had a balcony view to Barracks Street. 2 blocks from french market but far enough away from noises of French quarter. Helpful and pleasant staff- regardless of position.

Reviews.Title: “I know what it means to miss New orleans”
Reviews.Author: james s
Reviews.Content: If I could keep it a secret... keep the place all to myself I would, but of course that would not be fair to this wonderful hotel. My wife and I had reservations for a romantic getaway this past weekend ,which turned out to be just after the departure of Hurricane Issac ,and when we arrived a large part of the city was still without power (the French Quarter however still had electricity).It was a little spooky making our way through some of the darkened streets on the edge of the Quarter but when we got to the hotel it was like coming home. Our room was a king suite ( but was priced well below what such an accomodation would cost elsewhere). It is a quite old property and has the patina and subtle odors that such places have but is clean and lovingly maintained and staffed by folks who obviously have a great deal of loyalty and some serious longevity as to their times of employment there. Everything worked in our room and it was clean and comfortable. The bed was excellent though I could have perhaps wished for a little softer pillow but that is honestly the ONLY thing I could criticize. I slept 'like a brass idol' to quote Mark Twain. I have stayed in many newer places but never in any place that grew on me in such a way. It is on the edge of the Quarter near Esplanade Ave. and only two blocks from the best - the real - music scene in the area ; Frenchmans St. It is very close to Jackson's Square and Cafe Dumond as well as many other small excellent restaurants that the great and knowlegable staff directed us to. It is far enough from the wildness of Bourbon Street that if you are a bit older and like your visit to be on the quieter side this is the place for you. Of course all the other stuff the French Quarter is famous for is not too far to be sure ,but after a day of running the Quarter or a night of incredible music, to return to this cool quiet cocoon of rest was a beautful thing indeed. So to sum it up: if you are someone who needs the very newest and shiniest modern accomodations look elsewhere, but if , like us , you have a sense of and a love for this one of a kind city this place is quintessential New Orleans. If I could give them ten stars I would. We will NEVER stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Authentic French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Deborah R
Reviews.Content: The common areas of this hotel are authentic French Quarter and big on charm--how long since a hotel ask you to leave your key at the desk when you go out? An easy walk to Bourbon Street, galleries and other attractions. We did not eat at the hotel but the bar was fun. A great pool was a surprise. Our room was well appointed but the bath left a lot to be desired (mildewed grout)--at least in our room. We were there just before Isaac arrived, and although the staff couldn't have been nicer about it, they told us they were closing the hotel that day (Monday, 8/27/2012), even though we had another night booked. Thankfully, our company's travel department got us out on the last flight--otherwise I don't know where we would have "sheltered in place." We were there in advance of a buesiness neeting that was canceled due to Isaac--the takeaway, don't visit NOLA during hurricane season.

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of the french quarter”
Reviews.Author: Romangirl79
Reviews.Content: This hotel is wonderfully located in the heart of the french quarter, very close to the historic buildings and the french market. The room is big and clean, with air conditioned and Tv. The furniture is "old style", but there's also a safe in the room. There's a pool I didn't use because it was raining, and a soda machine, quite pricy, which had only coke and sprite, no water. You can leave also your values in the safe that is at the reception. I think it's a good option to visit Nola, no frills hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning Hotel in the perfect spot of French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Frank S
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is extraordinary. Very calm part of NO, no noise in the night, but still just a foot walk to the rushy Bourbon Street. The staff is very friendly and supportive. The outside pool is great, especially with the tough humid climate.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but not outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Dandelion_IRL
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well appointed, as it is in a walking distance to nice music venues, breakfast spots and a few restaurants. The room was spacious and clean, the bathroom - just average. What bothered me about the room is the musty smell that seemed to emanate from the air conditioning. Thankfully, I did not spend too much time inside the room, but I think this is something that the hotel administration should investigate and fix the problem, if possible.

Reviews.Title: “Very good deal !”
Reviews.Author: Alice W
Reviews.Content: If you are looking to experience Nola, this is the spot. Nobody's perfect, but this hotel met all of our needs. We stayed two nights. Great if your going to the French market. You can literally walk out of the back and see the French Market and the trolley stop. It is 2 blocks off of Bourbon St, but you are at the opposite end of the action. This is a good thing and a bad thing. Makes for quiet sleeping, but if you have partaken of the festivities it's a little walk back to the hotel. The staff was super friendly. They lent me an umbrella because it was raining when we checked in. The saltwater pool is an added plus. We stayed on the 3rd floor facing the front. Nice size with two double beds. The hotel is old, but well maintained. Ac worked fine. The ice machine is on the first floor, but just get some on your way up. If I had to list any cons they would be this: little musty smelling probably due the age. I would pull up all of the carpet. Walls are kind of thin, food service should last longer..only until 2 pm, food good, but a little pricey. Remember there are always " hidden" costs. I anticipated spending $300 for the 2 nights with tax, but after adding extra person fees and parking it was $ 367.44. Would I stay there again? Most definitely!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: mziggy
Reviews.Content: This isn't your Hyatt or Hilton, but it is a nice quaint and quiet hotel w/ some extras, including a pool and private courtyard in the French Quarter. Definitly w/in walking distance for all things in the French Quarter. The staff was very friendly and helpfull. The hotel was well maintained and quiet with comfortable beds and equiped rooms.

Reviews.Title: “check the rates first to prevent surprise”
Reviews.Author: Iris_reviews
Reviews.Content: Does 'friendly' means that there are still some advantages to the place, despite its shorcomings? I have chosen the hotel following some great reveiews, and I can tell that all in all I have found the reviews quite adequate. Indeed, the staff are friendly, I mean, if they are not too tired. Each person has its own criteria upon judging a hotel, and I would like to add here my own. For me personally it is very important that the room will have curtains to prevent any light in the morning, or else I tend to get up too early. It is also very important to have no noise, none from the adjacent rooms. Le Richelieu definitely meets these criteria, and it has wonderful beds, not too soft - as is the case with hotels that are somewhat dated. To anyone considering the hotel I would advise to carefully check those hidden costs, like the cost of parking. We have been very disappointed to find out that what has been sent to us as 'rate per day' did not in fact include 30 dollars for the children. The hotel confirmed a reservation for 4 people but only in the small letters was it mentioned that there is extra cost if there are more than 2 people in the room. Add 20 dollars per day for parking and you will find that the cost of staying at Richelieu is much higher than is appropriate for this kind of hotel. And, yes, we have during the visit entered other hotels and equired about the rates, and definitely have the impression that ours was all in all a bit too expensive by comparison.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing fancy”
Reviews.Author: JimP68
Reviews.Content: First time here, the staff are very friendly and check-in was hassle free. The room is dated, but the atmosphere made up for that, spoke to another guest and they are repeat customers. Repeat customers are a sign of good service and a great reason to stay. We are a only a ten min walk to Jackson square and one block from shops and bars. It's not a fancy place but great value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Location Perfect”
Reviews.Author: melannneo
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel could not be better. Located two blocks from the French Market, you can pick up something cheap for breakfast. It is located toward the end of the French Quarter so it is quiet and good for sleeping. Nice salt water pool. The rooms are kind of run down, it could use a make over. The staff could not ohave been nicer. This hotel is within walking distance of practically everyting, Frenchmen's Street for live music, St. Louis Cathedral and Jackson Square, Bourbon Street, the US Mint, the Algiers ferry. We took a bus to The Garden District and Magazine Street. Would recommend a cab to and from the airport, but otherwise find a cheaper way to get around. Cabs can be expensive when traveling from one district to another. I would stay at Le Richelieu again if I could not find a better place close to this location.

Reviews.Title: “Best location - between Frenchmen St and Bourbon St.”
Reviews.Author: dillygrl
Reviews.Content: Rooms are comfortable. Beds are clean. Service is top notch. It's located a little off the main part of the quarter which was great for us. A lot quieter at the end of your night. It's two blocks from Frenchmen st where the really good local music is. Would really recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “dated but sweet people”
Reviews.Author: c21guy
Reviews.Content: Well our room was kind of funky smelling and the tub didnt drain propertly and was like 1970 - but ut was a reasonably priced clean room and you could tell the people were trying hard with limited resources. liked the bar and pool - services are limited but the food was good and so were the drinks - hospitality excellent - just a little worn out - close to lots of great resturants and the french market -

Reviews.Title: “Quaint Nola Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cjqueen
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at Le Richelieu this past weekend. I booked the Satchmo Package deal and was pleasantly surprised to see we had a shared balcony upon check in. We were so close to the festival we could sit out on the balcony and hear the music. This was an added bonus to the nice room. The hotel is old world Nola. The furnishings were nice and everything was clean. It was nice to have a refrigerator also as this is not common in Nola hotels. I loved that the hotel has its own private parking lot and you have access to your car unlike most hotels. In addition, the parking rate is much lower than most places and with the Satchmo deal I only paid $10 night. The courtyard is nice with a small salt water pool. We also enjoyed a drink at the bar as well as breakfast in the sun room overlooking the swimming pool. I would not hesitate to stay at Le Richelieu again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: hausl
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well situated in the French Quarter. Close to Bourbon St but far enough away. As well as close to other landmarks. The room is very comfortable. Pool was also a nice feature. We didn't have a car so parking was not required.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect way to spend your honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: calli k
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to new Orleans for our honeymoon. We stayed at this hotel and reserved the summer package special: stay 3 nights get 1 free, $10 off parking, 2 free cocktails, 2 American breakfast. We had to switch our days and at first wasn't able to stay in the same room the whole time. When we arrived Pam said they had a treat for us in our room and were able to get us in the same room the whole time. when we went up to the room we realized they upgraded us for free into a very expensive suite. We were shocked and so appreciative. The service was so great from the maintenance man who helped us with our bags to our room, the front desk agents, the bartender and the restaurant staff. We felt so welcome and were so well taken care of. Plus the location was perfect. Its a little bit away from the craziness of bourbon and 1 block from decataur and walking dustance to everything, we bever had to drive! We will definitely stay there again and you should too!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly service, lots of New Orleans flavor.”
Reviews.Author: Katmoran5
Reviews.Content: If you need a huge room with lots of hotel amenities this isn't your place. BUT if you want a great walkable location with old New Orleans flavor, this small, but very clean, hotel is for you. (This is the kind of vanishing hotel where they still keep your room key in a cubby at the front desk.) It's an easy walk to the French Market, Bourbon St., the riverfront, museums, restaurants, yet has a neighborhood feel and is far enough away from the noisy hub-bub. If I were ever lucky enough to get back to New Orleans, I'd stay here again. Small courtyard restaurant overlooking a little pool with tropical greenery is pleasant and convenient, as is the small bar next to it.

Reviews.Title: “Our room was dated, but clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Megan_610
Reviews.Content: We reserved our room through one of those deals where the travel website tells you the area and how much and then you find out the hotel after you've paid, so I knew nothing about the hotel before that. We've been to New Orleans, but haven't stayed and I was a little concerned about possible noise in the French Quarter. It was a Sunday night, so not prime-time, but the location was quiet and while we could hear people in their rooms while in the hall, we didn't hear anything in the room. The decor was rather dated in our room, which had two doubles. The beds were fairly comfortable, which is more than I can say about many hotels I've stayed in, and it was very clean. Didn't use the pool, but it looked nice, if a bit small.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Yet Quiet FQ Location”
Reviews.Author: Tara K
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights for an anniversary trip. As with any urban boutique hotel, we expected older accommodations, slower elevators, etc. but the important things (cold A/C, clean and comfortable bedding and bathroom, refrigerator, attentive staff) were all in place. We were close both to the popular Marigny Frenchman Street music scene and more well known FQ destinations. Our room was on the 3rd floor and looked out over the courtyard---nice and quiet with a nice view of the FQ and cityscape. It was perfect for our getaway :)

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Marnie72
Reviews.Content: This was an older hotel but comfortable. Great lOcation in the French Quarter. The staff were really nice and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great find in Lower French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: bayoubelle
Reviews.Content: I have been going to New Orleans for fourty years and have stayed in many FQ hotels. I was looking for a hotel in the lower FQ with a pool. I am so delighted to have "discovered" Le Richelieu after all these years! The decor really captures that FQ ambience without those hefty prices. Our room was clean although dated but so what? Our bed was comfortable, the staff was very friendly, the pool was great for a summer stay in the FQ, we loved the quiet neighborhood around the hotel and loved the convenience of a bar and restaurant (breakfast and lunch) onsite. I would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Cozy hotel on the quiet side of town”
Reviews.Author: ssettless
Reviews.Content: This is a cute, cozy hotel on the far east side of the French Quarter. It is charmingly furnished with European designs. One of the nicest perks is the attached and secure parking lot behind the hotel. We parked our car there and left it there all weekend! Everything is within walking distance. It's far enough from bourbon street that it was very quiet at night. We were nervous about walking down some streets while returning late at night, but that is a citywide problem. The beds were comfortable and the room was clean. It even had a walk-in closet! Overall this was a very nice hotel and we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet side of the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: broadwayjen
Reviews.Content: Cute hotel, okay rooms, friendly staff. Perk is the parking lot for sure, you can come and go as you please unlike many others in the French Quarter where you have to wait for valet. LOTS to see/do/eat within walking hours. If we get another good rate like we did, we will stay again :)

Reviews.Title: “Tranquillity in the French Quarter.”
Reviews.Author: Bearded_Beast
Reviews.Content: This is not a modern business hotel. It still uses metal keys for the rooms and service is low key. But we didnâ€™t go to New Orleans for business, rather to enjoy the city and for that the Hotel is perfect. The small courtyard pool was ideal at the end of a long day walking the streets during July. The 24 hour coffee was also welcome on odd occasions. As a party of four we had two rooms, one with a single King Bed and the other with two Doubles. There were no concerns from anybody about the quality of the beds or bedding. Both rooms were well furnished and comfortable. On the Saturday night there was a small amount of corridor noise, but we were isolated from street noise, and in a party town it is great to know others are also having fun. The front desk staff were very helpful - ordering taxi to the airport and providing advice on how to get around. It was nice to sit at the Bar one wet afternoon and enjoy a refreshing beverage. Pluses â€“ very close to Frenchman Street and great music. A short walk from Bourbon street which can be either included or bypassed depending on your choice. Cafe Envie on Decatur st is a 2 min walk away and serves great coffee and breakfast. Minus â€“ Air conditioning was centrally set and although it was hot outside it was cold in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Elegance in the Heart of the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: mauibreeze9999
Reviews.Content: Le Richelieu in the French Quarter offers quiet elegance in the heart of the French Quarter. The bar is a welcoming oasis from the heat and noise. It has a cozy atomosphere that makes you want to stay longer than you intended. The staff are so friendly and helpful and answer questions of what to do for a long day trip or short. They have the knowledge of the city to answer your questions on museums, restaurants, or the sites that are just a short walk away. It is a unique experience from the hotel chains. Le Richelieu offers up different decor in each room. The courtyard has a small pool and beautiful landscaping and surprisingly quiet to be in the party atmosphere of the French Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Outdated but Charming”
Reviews.Author: Travis J
Reviews.Content: This hotel is outdated by more than a decade, but it was a what me and my fiance were looking for in the French Quarter. It was a little like going back in time and added to our New Orleans experience. Everything was in working order in our room, we did have to have the AC turned on in our room but, once it worked perfectly. The shower drained a little slow. Other than that we had a balcony with French Doors a refrigerator and a kitchen sink, the ceiling fan was quiet. We were on the quiet end of the quarter and that was nice. Only 3 blocks from Frenchman street and the French Market. In all we had no regrets and got to experience something different and historic.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet Hotel”
Reviews.Author: deckcat
Reviews.Content: Beautiful small hotel in the quite part of the French Quarter, yet close to French Market area, and Jazz clubs on Frenchman St. Traditional decor, friendly staff, lovely bar and pool area.Great breakfast available daily. Very personal and warm. Also a great value. Secured parking on site another advantage ...a rarity at NOLA hotels.

Reviews.Title: “ALWAYS A NICE STAY...”
Reviews.Author: laknight
Reviews.Content: We have been visiting NOLA for about 8 years and for the price and location we always return to the LeRichelieu. The staff has always been very polite and willing to help out in any way. The location is perfect. You are steps away from the French Market and also on your walk to the market, going down Barracks streetyou will pass a few wonderful places to eat such as Cafe Envive(love this little cafe), Louisiana Pizza Kitchen(the best pizza to call in at 9:30, from room a 10min walk) and for a wonderful Mexican Meal 10 min away from room across the street from the market, El Gato Negro(yummm!). The perfect location for food and shopping and not mention BOURBON street is 2 streets over... this hotel has it all. The rooms are always clean and well kept. All the rooms I have stayed in have been equipped with small refrigerator, which is nice to have since most hotels there do not.

Reviews.Title: “Nice historical hotel”
Reviews.Author: JustVisitingfromTX
Reviews.Content: Only had one night to stay, but stayed we did! Great location! An easy walk to Bourbon Street, Jackson Square, the French market shops and the most wonderful restaurants! Most of all, after an afternoon and evening out in the heat, we returned to a cool, clean and QUIET room! Yes, the room is a bit dated but this is a historical hotel so please keep that in mind. We did eat breakfast in the hotel cafe. Great coffee, wonderful biscuits, and yummy grits, all typical of New Orleans' flavour. Desk, security and other hotel employees were super friendly. Compared to my other stays, this is the best! Will definitely do again!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: PinchOnTheGo
Reviews.Content: This property does not live up to the reviews or pictures on it's website. It is well-worn, too worn for the price. Old with character is one thing but in need of new paint and carpet is another. They do not have a computer that customers can use to check their email. When we checked in the desk clerk asked the bartender to store our bags as our room was not ready. They had an interaction where the bartender was very rude and disrespectful right in front of us. I asked her if the boss knew how this guy behaved upon which she defended his bad behavior. That evening we went to the bar to have a drink. My friend went in while I used the restroom. She later told me that as she sat at the bar the bartender keep his back to her, not even acknowledging she was there. She asked him a few questions and he kept his back to her during the entire conversation. Then he finally turned and served her. Either the boss has not instructed in good customer service or this guy does his own thing when the boss isn't around. The bathrooms in the bar were being remodeled so staff and customers has to use a hotel room bathroom during the remodel. By coincidence I happened to follow another bartender on two different occasions after he used the bathroom. Both times he did not flush! And if he's not bothering to flush do you think he's bothering to wash his hands? The room had two large closets, one of which contained a refridgerator, sink, and kitchen cupboard. The property is in the French Quarter, one block away from the eastern border of the quarter, not central but acceptable location if you like to walk.

Reviews.Title: “very pleseant”
Reviews.Author: mfoto
Reviews.Content: stayed at lerich. in april for the french quarter festival. the hotel was very clean with new carpet in many areas including my room . thr room was a nice size with a huge walk in closet . the bed could have been a tad softer but other than that it was fine. the hotel location was perfect 4 me and my wife we were only a half block from the old mint and very close to jackson square. the hotel staff was very polite and helpful. the prices were reasonable and didnt charge an arm and leg 4 parking like most hotels. a big plus is the parking is connected to the hotel on property so u can self park. all in all a great place to stay and will definitely stay again soon

Reviews.Title: “Good Location Sub-Par Service”
Reviews.Author: WorldAtlasJGalt
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel one day before the annual New Orleans Jazz Festival. While our suite was a little out dated, it served as a good base for the weekend. Our first impression was positive as the front desk person who checked us in was outgoing and a little quirky. throughout our stay, however, the impression changed a bit as they were unable to fix a wireless reception problem in our room after promising that it would be fixed the same day it was reported. The bar/restaurant area was a little dark and service was consistently slow. We had breakfast at the hotel one day and while it was decent, it seemed a little over priced considering the great options that were just a couple blocks away. Overall, our experience in New Orleans was very positive and while I would stay at Le Richelieu again if they were to address the issues of inconsistent service, I will probably try somewhere else when I return to Jazz Fest next year.

Reviews.Title: “True Southern Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Solo_Travelholic
Reviews.Content: This is a really nice spot to stay at in the French Quarter. The location is great. Away from the loud noise of Frenchman and Bourbon but just a 10 minute walk to the entertainment. Who should stay here? Friends, solo travelers, couples and older families. It's not a great hotel for kids or teenage partiers because this is a quiet hotel. Also, the pool has no shallow end (shallow is 5 feet!) and no lifeguard, so young kids really can't swim here - which was a bonus for us adults!! We were loving it! Staff: All the people on staff are really nice. You have to leave the key at the front desk every time you go out (not that they chase after you). I thought it would be a big inconvenience but it actually worked really well, especially when my friend and I got separated. The maid was also so very sweet. When we slept in, she'd leave a bag of fresh towels and toiletries hanging on the door. We even left something in the room when we checked out and she rushed out and gave it back to us. They are very thorough with daily vacuuming and fresh towels everyday. Very clean place even if the tiles and paint are a bit old and worn. Pool: It's saltwater and makes your skin feel so great. It's very deep. I was on my tiptoes in the shallow end. Night swims are awesome because the pool is lit up at night. The staff won't mind as long as you are quiet. The courtyard is beautiful, with a little banana tree and a resident Monarch butterfly. Food: Didn't eat here because it was too pricey. Rooms: If you want a stylish new hotel then why did you book this? The pictures show it is old fashioned. I thought it was charming. There are some cracked tiles and things, but they had recently painted and we were blessed with an alarm clock with an ipod dock and a nice flat screen TV. The beds are very comfortable and soft. And the AC is quite cold! Complaints: very few. The water doesnâ€™t drain when you're showering so you end up standing about a foot deep in water. I was told this was because NOLA is below sea level. Don't stay in an adjoining room (108) if you want quiet. You can clearly hear your neighbours through the wall, but most people here are quiet and respectful. We only had a problem 1 night. Book a room with a balcony if you want to go swimming, as the bathing suits didn't dry well inside. I'd recommend this place in a heartbeat! The staff is great - and the owner, although he is 89, still walks around and chats with guests. He's very sweet, although he repeats himself a lot. The people who stayed here also all were very friendly and welcoming. We chatted with lots of travelers from all over the States. It's a really nice spot for solo travelers because of the friendly, conversational vibe. It's easy to make friends here. For a unique and relaxing trip, this is a great spot. Iâ€™m still dreaming of that pool...

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: 11Limited
Reviews.Content: This hotel sits right in the French Quarter of N.O, with everything within walking distance. Very friendly, competent staff and nice decor. They blocked off a section for our motorcycles in their gated, secure parking lot which was also very nice of them to do for us. The faucet for the cold water in the shower broke, but they had it repaired within five minutes, great service! The room is decorated well, I'm on the second floor. There is a wrap around balcony which provides for great pictures, and a relaxing pool as well.

Reviews.Title: “New owners & mgmt ... nothing like the past”
Reviews.Author: soflabiztraveller
Reviews.Content: I booked on the hotel's very own website and received a confirmation. I even pre-paid for the lodging because it was a lower rate. When I arrived at the hotel, I tried to gain access into the parking area which is secure but there is an intercom. I pressed the button and a woman answered, asked my name, and said I did not have a reservation. I had my car parked on the sidewalk, running, and she asked me to spell my name again. I did. She again said I did not have a reservation. I told her that there was a mistake, asked if she would open the gate to the parking lot to let me in, and she said, "I'm not allowed to do that." I drove around a few blocks so I could park on the street (which, if you know anything about the French Quarter, is next to impossible most of the time). I went into the lobby, gave my name to the clerk, and she said that she did not have my reservation. No apology at all for the incident when I was trying to gain access at the parking lot using the "Check-In" buzzer and intercom. I told her that I booked online and prepaid and then she asked for my identification (like I was perhaps using another name???). She took my driver license into a back office and was gone for about 5 minutes. She came back out, without my license, and said nothing. Silence. No explanation. No empathy. When I asked if they had my reservation, she replied, "we're checking." Another five minutes passed and another woman came out of the back office with my driver license and said that they had my reservation and that it was pre-paid. Geez, I thought to myself, this is exactly what I just told the clerk 20 minutes ago when she said she "wasn't allowed" to let me in the parking area. I felt like I was the only person who thought that there was something wrong with this because there was no apology and no explanation given. Then I was told that the parking was $20 -- and really, one of the big reasons I stayed here was because, for the last 20 years that I've been staying at this hotel, PARKING HAS ALWAYS BEEN FREE. Ok, so now I'm being told that parking is $20/day but the woman from the back office told the clerk to comp my parking. At this point, I felt like the whole place had gone crazy so I just recapped my experience to the two women. Then I was told if I had given them the confirmation number on the email that I had received, they could have found my reservation better. OK - let's see ... I booked on the hotel's very own website, not Priceline or hotels.com, and now it's my fault that they couldn't find the reservation. I told them that this was a big inconvenience and it wasn't handled very well. In a very dismissive way, the woman from the back office said, "we've changed ownership and we're very sorry." It seemed insincere and half-hearted, especially since I had to practically drag this out of them. Then the clerk asked me for my credit card and I asked what she needed it for and she said that the remote that controlled the parking lot access gate that she gave me needed to be returned and if it wasn't, I would be charged $20. Then the clerk piped up and said, "Sir, it's customary to have a credit card on record." After the horrible manner that I was "greeted," I couldn't believe that this woman was talking down to me and telling me what was customary, especially since I had only asked a question -- I didn't refuse to give a credit card -- I was merely asking what it was going to be used for. Anyway, I got my remote and key and went to my room. It was around 2:30 pm or so and when I got upstairs, there were 2-3 housekeepers all sitting in the hallway. I guess it was close to quitting time. Wierd, but no big deal. I got into my room and, to my surprise, I had been upgraded to a suite which was nice but certainly an empty gesture considering the torture they had inflicted. Apparently renovations are underway which isn't mentioned anywhere that I could see. Electric saws during the day time and their workshop is the 8-foot wide breezeway from the parking lot to the hotel so you have to step around the workmen and the construction debris. Yes, the hotel needs some renovations but the staff needs a makeover. Honesty, hospitality, full disclosure, making sincere apologies -- all things they should learn. I usually stay at Marriott properties but have had a soft spot for this hotel and it was the exception for me. Not any more. I'm done with Le Richelieu -- but here's a warning to anybody who books: Be very careful about your reservation and avoid pre-paying. Print your reseration confirmation out in advance and present it when you arrive at the front desk. Otherwise you'll probably go through the same hell that I did.

Reviews.Title: “Great French Quarter Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kreebo
Reviews.Content: We booked a room at Le Richelieu on a recommendation from a friend that had stayed there several times. We were very happy with this hotel! It's in a great location in the French Quarter. Walking distance from lots of fun nightlife, but in a very quiet location. When we first arrived we had one room with a balcony over the parking lot. When the rest of our group arrived a day later, we were able to switch to rooms next to each other along the large balcony. This was perfect for our bachelorette party group! The pool/courtyard was wonderful! All of the staff were very nice/helpful. I would definitely recommend this hotel and would love to stay here again on my next NOLA trip!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Mathieu_11
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights with my wife, on a week-end. We had a room with a view... on a wall 3 feet away, over a small alley in the courtyard. I was not much surprised, that is what you get in exchange for discounted prices obtained through priceline and the like. That being said, room was comfortable, bed was very nice (and my wife is not easily sold on mattresses), bathroom was OK (sapcious, well equipped, well lit, with the usual very small bathtub typical of American hotels), and the cherry on the cake was the dressing, one small room devoted entirely to getting our suitcases and clothes out of the way... We did not try the breakfast, but it seemed OK. Situation is really great. Staff was awesomely nice and helpful. I only rate it 4 because I feel that it could be a little better for the price, but then the location just out of the most touristy pÃ¢rt while still being within walking distance of anything worth seeing in the French Quarter might be worth every one of your bucks, depending on what you are looking for...

Reviews.Title: “My darling Le Richelieu”
Reviews.Author: Bianca333
Reviews.Content: Had a great, great time in this hotel with my husband and our seven year old son. Good location, real close to Frenchmen St., and a walking distance from Jackson Square. The staff was nice, so as our room. I hope to come back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Accommodations”
Reviews.Author: Retiredandhappy2006
Reviews.Content: My husband had stayed at Le Richelieu in the 1980s and wanted to share a lovely experience with me. The lobby was charming with a key system that still requires actual keys and that the room key be turned in to the desk clerk when you leave the hotel and retrieved from the desk when you return. There is a nice bar area and a lovely, cool pool and courtyard that is a welcome respite from the intense New Orleans sun. The staff could not have been more helpful with providing information. Unfortunately, the room was depressing and worn. Everything except the flat screen TV was old, not in an antique charming way, just old, worn, dated, and dismal.Brown wood furniture, brown drapes,very old brown bedspread, and old carpet decorated our room. The bathroom was tiled in small old pink tiles with scuffed and smudged woodwork and a gouge taken out of the back of the bathroom door. My husband had to take the tank top off the toilet and jiggle something to stop the water from flowing each time it was flushed. He reported it to the front desk but it was not repaired. Lighting in the room and bathroom was inadequate. The hotel also smelled very strongly of bleach or a similar cleaning product. I know this would have affected my daughter with chemically-induced asthma. I am not sure how this might affect anyone else. I would have loved to give this historical hotel a much higher rating because it did have some very nice features but the quality of the room wouldn't allow it. .

Reviews.Title: “The perfect location”
Reviews.Author: FrikLange
Reviews.Content: Perfectly situated on the edge of all the happenings but within easy walking distance of all the sights and entertainment. just far enough away from the main buzz so that you can escape to the hotel for some old world charm and relax before you venture back to the wonderful madness of the French Quarter. Very good accommodation and excellent service at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay away from the madness”
Reviews.Author: vacationerBoston
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at Le Rich, and we won't stay anywhere else when in New Orleans. Is it a bit dated? Yes, Could it use softer towels and a stand alone hairdryer? Yes, However... we've never been more comfortable in a hotel. There's something about the staff, and comfort, along with the location. Our room was large with a separate kitchen area and full size fridge. It faced the pool, and had a small terrace. In past years we've stayed in the one bedroom suite (courtesy of upgrade), but this was just as nice. The beds are super comfortable, and they have flat screen TVs now. It is an excellent value. They serve an excellent breakfast in the Terrace Cafe, the brandy milk punch is delicious! This is a great location from which to explore the Marigny area, yet still close to the Quarter if that is your preference. Get new towels and lose the wall mounted hairdryer and my stars go to five! :) Consider this 4.5

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: kellygal
Reviews.Content: I hesitate to tell anyone about this place because I want to save it all for myself. After reading numberous reviews on tripadvisor, I booked this hotel for our first trip to New Orleans. I was nervous about what to expect as many hotels in touristy areas fail to impress but I was impressed with every aspect of this hotel. We booked a standard king size room through Expedia. When I tried to book online, the site said they were sold out but Expedia showed rooms available for $130 night in April. I called the hotel directly and they said if Expedia showed available rooms, then I should book through Expedia. I did this and had no problem at all. Parking is secure for $20/night. Some hotels were charging $40-$60/night for parking. The hotel is in an excellent location for anything one wants to do in the French Quarter. We walked everywhere and didn't feel wiped out from walking. The hotel/room made me truly feel like I was in New Orleans. Room was clean. Bed very comfy. Shower good. No breakfast but they did serve coffee free in the restaurant onsite. We ate breakfast there one morning. It was simple but very tasty. All the staff at this hotel was outstanding and friendly. If I go back to New Orleans, I would not stay anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing more to say”
Reviews.Author: TrapperDavey
Reviews.Content: It seems that all the other reviews are in line with my thoughts. What a wonderful place to go and stay - parking no problem - reception staff excellent and charming - rooms are great - decor is traditional. We shall return.

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent French Quarter Experienec”
Reviews.Author: OBX_Innkeeper
Reviews.Content: We were very fortunate to get a room here as the result of a cancellation. The room was amazing, the service world class. The location is close close to perfect, in the desirable SE corner of the quarter, a short walk to Frenchman Street and far enough from the drunkfest on Bourbon Street that you can avoid it entirely. The true differentiator is their staff. Most are very long term, with strong service commitments and great pride in their hotel. The owner Frank is charming. Pam, an assistant manager, would be an asset to any fine hotel. We were glad to have made her acquaintance, and will call her personally when we return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location with gorgeous french charm!”
Reviews.Author: Abernathy5
Reviews.Content: I absolutely adored this hotel. It's really truly a gem. You can easily walk anywhere from this hotel and when I'm in New Orleans except for areas near the 9th Ward. I would recommend driving to those areas if you need to go. The decor of the hotel is simply charming and yes, the room decor can seem a bit dated but if I wanted to stay someplace that reeks of modern taste, I would go there. However, if you just need the simple amenities and a place that's surrounded by beautiful wrought iron and has a decent pool, you've found your place. The front desk was wonderful and quite accomodating and the room was just fine for what I needed. I will always come back to this hotel whenever I'm staying in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Le Richelieu in the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Patricia T
Reviews.Content: This is an utterly charming hotel with class A service and a congenial and helpful staff. Stay here in New Orleans! It's off the beaten path enough to avoid drunken tourists on Bourbon Street, but easily within walking distance if you want to be one!

Reviews.Title: “great historical building in the french quarter”
Reviews.Author: Cathy N
Reviews.Content: I have visited New Orleans many times but have never stayed in any of the historical hotels in the French Quarter. It was great being within walking distance of everything and I thought the building was beautiful. If you want fancy fixtures you should probably stay in one of the highrises on Canal St. That is not what this place is about. Everything in our room worked fine. The parking is a great plus. This is a quiet side of the Quarter, which I personally like. We had a great time. I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: Kerbear2u
Reviews.Content: This is an amazing place to stay when visiting NOLA. The location can't be beat! you are 2 blocks away from everying including, trolly car, bourbon, frenchman st. the marken, coffee shop, restaurants, shopping etc. The owner Frank is a wonderful man with an amazing heart, his staff are like family to him he states and I can see why, they are like family and make everyone who walks through that beautiful door feel at home. We had a balcony room on the 3rd floor and it was wonderful, bed was comfortable, small fridge and everything we needed. The outdoor pool was fabulous and I won't stay anywhere else, it is close enough to catch the action for anything, but far enough to retreat and hang on the balcony for a couple cocktails while enjoying the sounds, smells and tastes NOLA has to offer. I would recommend without hesitation, not a fancy place or high class, but that isn't what NOLA is about anyway. Stay here, you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “so-so”
Reviews.Author: carney33
Reviews.Content: The place still has its charm but is overrated by some reviews. The desk and bar staff are not as friendly as some report. They appear to be bored and going through the motions. The room was OK. The bathroom was decent sized but badly in need of new fixtures. We had to call for service twice on the toilet and it still never worked right. The shower head was unadjustable and pounded water down on you. The A/C unit was ancient and unadjustable. The bed was OK, and there was a walk in closet and outer deck to the street. I had heard that there was no coffee maker in the room, but when we asked, they brought one up with coffee for each day for free. Otherwise you have to walk down to the bar area to pour your own free coffee and bring it back to room. Don't know why they dont just provide coffee makers in each room. Strange, quirky place to stay but a good quiet location near to most things on that side of the quarter. A bit more of a walk to the busier west side.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: bobker1
Reviews.Content: I almost don't want to share this info-since this place is such a great deal and great location and I want to be sure I gert the room I want when I return. We found the staff welcoming pleasant and very funny. Ladies talking to you you through the kitchen windows was one of my highlights as was chatting with the owner Frank who still stops to pick up items on the terrace. My other highlight was sitting out on our balcony after a long day havign a night cap or sipping a coffee as the sun was rising . We loved room 311. Our intention is to return to New Orleans every year and Le Richelieu is the only hotel we will ever stay in again. There is no better location. That said it is the staff that made our stay special. .We will thank them personally when we return. Frank you don't own a hotel you own our home away from home. Like other reviews state is you want the new stuff go somewhere else. But if your interest is New Orleans the music and real life in New Orleans this place is it We won't stay in another place-there is no need. There is a coffee shop and bar around the corner a deli and variety store a block up, The Market and street car two blocks south, Bourbon two blocks north. Frenchman two blocks east. Preservation Jazz Hall 1 block south. And all of this is in an amazing neighbourhood. Good luck to me finding the room I want now!!

Reviews.Title: “It's just right!”
Reviews.Author: loka1960
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here twice now and have had a great stay each time. This is not a high end hotel, but a small local older hotel. Slightly shabby, but very comfortable with a lot of character that fits perfectly if you want something that reflects the character of the French Quarter. The rooms need to be updated but are comfortable just the same. The front desk staff are very friendly and so is the owner. We love the location for the activities that we do in the Quarter and are really quite pleased with Le Richelieu. A couple of things on my wish list would be with a coffee maker in the rooms or at least a free coffee urn in the restaurant downstairs. Every morning I had to got to the corner coffeehouse to buy a large coffee to wake up with. A continental breakfast would be nice too. This hotel is at the far end of the French Quarter and has plenty of amenities in the area, but is not in a busy/noisy part of town.

Reviews.Title: “Charming but....”
Reviews.Author: sbmNewMexico
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed three nights at Le Richelieu in the French Quarter of New Orleans while attending the French Quarter Jazz Festival. We agree with the reviews that use the words "charming" and "quiet", and tt was an easy walk to anywhere in the French Quarter. The front desk staff is unfailingly cheerful, polite, and helpful. We liked the easy access to parking and the gated, secure parking area. However, it is not "charming" to have water up to your ankles in the shower because of slow drains. It is not "quaint" to have the cord for the coffee maker stretched across the sink to reach the only electrical outlet available. Our room was small, and the sink and refrigerator and a disconnected stove were built into what was obviously once a closet, so we had to slide the closet doors back and forth to make and pour coffee, then slide again to get cream out of the refrigerator. The lobby and hallways are clean but need updating. The bathroom definitely needs updating. And each night, we fought the bottom sheet coming off of the bed; thick mattresses need bigger sheets or better bed-making techniques. We had to unplug the in-room alarm clock to have an outlet to charge our laptop and cell phones.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best place to stay if you want to be close to the Superdome.”
Reviews.Author: DJLED
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during the NCAA 2012 Final Four, a total of 7 nights. We had no promblem getting to the Superdome, but we could not get a taxis back if our life depended on it (and after you have walked 20 min.in the pouring rain you feel like it did). You can ride the Streetcars part of the way, but the one that goes to the Frenchmarket closes between 9pm and 10pm. Well enough of that the hotel itself is old, but clean. We had a lower level room , which had a little musty smell when it rained. The room was just a regural small old hotel room. There was a mini refrigerator in the closet, it also had a I phone changer, a hair dryer, and a small flat screen tv in the room. I have to say that it was a little noisy escpecially in the morning. They are alway working on sometime outside and the walls are not as thich as otherwise stated by other reviews.(that includes the interior walls).They do have free coffee in the restrurant. You have to get it yourself. We did eat breakfast there 2 times it is ok, but nothing special. They close the restruant at 2pm, but the bar stays open until 12am I think. The swimming poool is very small and I only seen one family using it. This was our first trip to NOLA and I guess for the money this was a good place to stay. I do think if I go back I would look at other places, especially if I was going to a event at the Superdome.

Reviews.Title: “Charming”
Reviews.Author: Mary Ann B
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the King Suite. Roomy, clean, lots of storage and quiet. Dated? Yes but that is part of the charm! Staff is very friendly. The location is prime if you are more interested in the quiet side of NOLA. Frenchmen Street is just a couple blocks away as is the open air market and numerous places to eat. You cant go wrong with this place!

Reviews.Title: “quaint, quiet but close to everything”
Reviews.Author: lunaWisconsin
Reviews.Content: Very nice old place, nothing fancy but all the essentials. The front desk staff is friendly and helpful with tours and such .NIce walk to French Quarter, Bourbon St and Riverwalk shopping. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, atmosphere and service. What else do you need?”
Reviews.Author: CasualTraveler53
Reviews.Content: This lovely small hotel combines atmosphere of bed and breakfast with services of a hotel. Located in the quiet section of the French Quarter, I was within easy walking distance of delicious bakeries, great restaurants, art galleries and shopping. The rooms were decently priced and well furnished. My bathroom could have used an update, but it wasn't a big deal. I stayed four nights in a one bedroom suite and thought it was well worth it. A great way to stay comfortably in the French Quarter and avoid big hotel crowds and prices.

Reviews.Title: “It's age is showing.”
Reviews.Author: SheronJoB
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to Le Richelieu. For this trip we booked a suite. There was no balcony and the air conditioning in the sitting room did not work. The bathrooms are really showing their age as is the hotel in general. The lobby and bar areas are very nice however. Each morning that we ordered room service, it was a guess as whether it would be as ordered. One out of three was correct. We very much like the location and the protected parking; but we won't be returning. There is also the POSSIBILITY that this was where our M/C number was swiped. The card was used the evening we checked in and we had not used it any other place that day.

Reviews.Title: “Old world charm only goes so far”
Reviews.Author: The Brit II
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Le Richelieu. It's in a very convenient location-close to Cafe du Monde. The reception area/lobby is beautiful. The hotel corridors are well maintained. The rooms are worn out. They smell of tobacco and need some clean air to clear out the smell. The bathrooms are clean but need updating. The water would back up in the shower-they need to clear out the drains. Need a fitness area or should provide complimentary membership at the New Orleans Athletic Club (other hotels in the area provide the service).

Reviews.Title: “Really great location”
Reviews.Author: TravelerStCharles
Reviews.Content: We would go back to this hotel. The location in the French Quarter was perfect...we walked to everything. There was a $20 fee per day to keep your car in their gated lot...which was definitely worth it....parking is really hard to find around there. While the hotel is historic, our room was very nice and had a lot of character. Our room was very quiet. (4th floor) We had a view of the courtyard and the New Orleans skyline.The staff was great, and there was a really nice little courtyard with a pool...very relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Congo Fest weekend 2012”
Reviews.Author: omegaman76
Reviews.Content: I don't want to totally trash the whole hotel but from what i seen over there, it did not get my nod of approval. This has one thing going for it and that it is close to Decatur St. and that is all. Very old place and i know that because this is New Orleans but they need some today upgrades & fixing. I don't want to go on and on about it but for what they are charging, i could have did better staying uptown or in the CBD. I don't know if some of these reviews are from the owners or the employees but this hotel is not like what these reviews are saying.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: karendor
Reviews.Content: I was really looking forward to staying in a historic property in the French Quarter. Unfortunately, during my stay New Orleans was cold and Le Richelieu was not prepared, so the room was either freezing or overheated. But the worst part was housekeeping: our first morning they knocked at 9 am, we told them we would be out in a few minutes but when we came back *after noon* the room was still not made. Had to ask. And the next morning --when I was exhausted due to the room temp situation -- housekeeping woke us up at 9 am again! We were told the early knock was to take towels? So my lesson: ALWAYS put a DND sign on the door regardless of when you think you will wake up. The front desk staff was charming, the lounge-bar a little sad, and the hotel has a very nice location in the quiet part of the quarter, but we left a day early. For the price, you can do much better in the Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect and charming in everyway!”
Reviews.Author: boo2U
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a lot to offer if you are looking for a quiet, convenient walk to Bourbon Street, French Market and Frenchman Street. The hotel is warm and old world French and the staff is stellar, it was perfect for us. Our room was very nice, albeit the bathroom was not modern and a throwback to the 60â€™s but it was very clean, very big and lots of room to move around which is more than I can say about some of the more modern hotels where the bathroom is big enough for just one, this one, you could have two..maybe three people using the sink and counter space and still have someone taking a shower, it was that big. By the way, water pressure was perfect always had hot water, and there was a nice brand of bar soap, shampoo (no conditioner), lotion and shower cap, there was also a hair dyer. The room was old world and very welcoming, and we had a balcony which added to the charm of the room. The room was perfect for us, but if I had to complain, the bed is a little on the hard side, but not so much so that I couldnâ€™t sleep, however the linen was nice, not hard and scratchy but of decent quality, the pillows were a little flat but that was because I think they were goose down, but there were extras in the closet which by the way, also had ample space, two suitcase stands for the foot of the bed or wherever, an iron, ironing board and mini refrigerator to stash leftovers and drinks (no mini-bar). There were extra chairs and a flat screen and table. It was all we needed plus the curtains were heavy, so if we wanted to sleep in we could do so in darkness. Checking in was a delight, we were warmly met by Molly, she was very helpful and cheerful. We arrived early so Molly let us store our luggage, gave us a map, showed us how to get around and was just wonderful. You do also have old fashion keys, not cards, and have to hand them in and pick them up every time you leave and come back, it was never an issue, and if you have been to Paris, some of the hotels there have the same thing, so it just added to the old world French charm to me. I loved Molly, she would cheerfully greet us when we came and went and would ask about our day, she was great! We did have breakfast at the hotel and the meal was perfect, the coffee perfect, all was served by Billy who was really nice and attentive and there was also Darren who came by with coffee refills and to make sure we were a-ok. I had a ham and cheese omelet with a biscuit $9.00 and my boyfriend had crepes $6.50 both of us had coffee and I had a small orange juice, our total was $16.90 which I thought was very reasonable for an elegant hotel breakfast in the French Quarter, and breakfast is served until 2:00 p.m. so it beats running around looking for a late breakfast place, besides, the food and service are excellent. Iâ€™m telling you the hotel staff is stellar, they are always on hand to help in any way and our check-out was a breeze as well, Aryany was very nice and checked us out and again offered to store our luggage since we werenâ€™t leaving for the airport for still a few more hours. We didnâ€™t drive but I know there was a car lot somewhere behind the hotel, not sure of the price but there were always taxis out front if we needed one. I would definitely come back to this hotel, it was perfect for usâ€¦.no worries, and if you have an issue, Iâ€™m sure Molly or Aryany will take good care of you, book without concern.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: lucyanne1
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here may times and once again I was in mold room: 214. This room is special because it is a corner room on a shared balcony Andy's can see the French Market from there. The staff is considered extended family members. Say hi to Pam at the front desk when you arrive. Highly, highly recommend this quiet hotel at the end of thenFrench Quarter within walking distance of everything good (and bad).

Reviews.Title: “Great location close to it all”
Reviews.Author: Catleen C
Reviews.Content: Loved this place, real Nola feel and going back in May. Close to everything we love, Irene's , port of call, Molly's Frenchmen ... Not fancy just classy

Reviews.Title: “Wish I had found this hotel first!”
Reviews.Author: Cookiecare
Reviews.Content: My husband and I wanted to stay somewhere special on our last night in New Orleans so we asked the locals when we got there, I had found the ambassador hotel on the internet for price and location! BUT I wish I called this place it was comparable in price and excellent in every way! Very nice history, price and amenities and in the French Quarter!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but older”
Reviews.Author: mzmd
Reviews.Content: The staff was fabulous and the room was very clean and neat. It was old, however, and the HVAC system rattled. The ceiling fan was a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay, wonderful staff!”
Reviews.Author: Danni D
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Le Richelieu with friends in summer 2011. The hotel is located in a quiet residential street but is still ideally situated for exploring the French Quarter. The rooms are clean and cozy and the food is excellent - to bad they only serve breakfast and lunch. What is truly exceptional is the staff at the hotel, this is the kind of service I'd like to see everywhere! From sightseeing advice to helping with my laptop troubles they were always very genial and helpful. We had a really great time staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Best staff and best place”
Reviews.Author: L W
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for Halowe'en 2011. The staff were very friendly and helpful, and knew alot. They also took those extra steps; taking photos of us in costume, knowing our favourite candy and saving us some. : ) Pam and Becky always had welcome smiles and help you feel right at home. The lady on at night told us where to get a burger at 1am. (But the best burger in NOLA is at Port of Call) Accomodations very clean, comfortable and homey; which for a week plus visit is really nice to come back and feel like you are sitting in your living room. Great balcony. Very quiet; able to sleep perfectly and yet just walk up to Bourbon and hear Al Carlson sing and have beignes at CafÃ© du Monde. The breakfast in the restaurant is good too.

Reviews.Title: “Character and Service”
Reviews.Author: gwendy_bird
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for Mardis Gras 2012. The location is great - just in the french quarter, but a few streets away from the noisy ones (Bourbon and Royal), so it was quiet. It's an old place, so don't expect it to be immaculately decorated and perfect. The room and bathroom were fairly small but cosy. Facilities adequate. The best thing about this hotel is that it has a lovely swimming pool and bar/patio area with free coffee, and the staff are very welcoming and helpful. We had an enjoyable stay here.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely time at Mardi Gras!”
Reviews.Author: Jeffdee
Reviews.Content: Our visit was for Mardi Gras so the hotel was very busy with a lovely atmosphere. The staff were courteous and very friendly at all times and nothing was too much trouble for them. The hotel is a beautiful building and full of character. The public areas were sumptuously decorated and our room was spacious and very clean with an exceptionally large comfy bed. The bathroom was a little outdated for my taste but I'm sure others might like it! An excellent location - central for all the excitement of Mardi Gras, especially for Frenchman Street and the French Market, but nicely away from the madness. Having said that the hotel is not cheap and would have benefited from having breakfast included in the price.

Reviews.Title: “Far From The Maddening Crowds, In A Good Way”
Reviews.Author: birdsong352
Reviews.Content: At the "locals" end of the French Quarter, a stone's throw from the French Market, the music clubs of Frenchman Street, and excellent restaurants, Le Richelieu is also a few minutes walk to all the popular "must-see" sites such as Jackson Square, Canal Street, and the "mighty Mississippi." Thanks to the streetcar line and public bus system, a car is unnecessary, though the Richelieu provides safe, on-site parking for a reasonable fee. The hotel is very "old New Orleans" and decorated accordingly with beautiful antiques. If you need anything, just ask. The entire staff is there to help you find your way around safely and comfortably. The cozy bar offers lovely drinks, the cafe attracts many New Orleanians, especially for Sunday brunch. The salt-water pool is an oasis of tropical pleasure and as the charming, octogenarian owner says, the lack of chlorine prevents damage to "the ladies hair-does!" My room was clean, comfortable, and the little refrigerator was great for storing drinks and leftovers from the great restaurants. If you like a small, cozy, quaint-but-elegant hotel with a convenient, safe, quiet(ish) location (New Orleans is rarely sedate!), then stay at Le Richelieu and enjoy the best town in the USA.

Reviews.Title: “New Orleans February 2012”
Reviews.Author: NormajoTampaUSA
Reviews.Content: We found it ideally situated, easy to walk to the French Quarter and also to get on one of the Paddle Steamers for a trip down the 'muddy Mississippi. We didn't eat at the hotel preferring to stroll to the coffee bars and restaurants to try the local fare. It is an old hotel, only to be expected, but the staff were very helpful, we would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: pcbcla
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for two days in January and really enjoyed this hotel. We booked late so we ended up taking one of the corner rooms on the street so there was street noise at night (to be expected in a busy city!) but that was the only drawback. The staff was top-notch - we loved leaving the key at the front desk when we left so we didn't have to worry about losing it on our travels! We spent a couple of sunny hours one afternoon in the courtyard by the pool, having a few drinks and reading (mostly resting our feet!) and we enjoyed that. The wi-fi worked great in the room and I also saw someone using their laptop in the courtyard. The location is wonderful, especially if you like the music on Frenchman Street which we prefer over Bourbon Street. It was a short walk to everywhere we wanted to go so we will definately make this our hotel of choice for our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “A rare gem in the over-priced French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: albizzia49
Reviews.Content: My traveling buddy found this fine little hotel. Its location is excellent, just blocks from the French Market & the river. Very safe, clean, quiet and relaxed. Not recommended for the party crowd. Right across the street from the pompous, self-important, ridiculously expensive Soniat and much nicer all around. We frequently go to New Orleans as we live only 2 1/2 hrs away and will make this our hotel of choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, wonderful staff and location for first trip to New Orleans.”
Reviews.Author: Darksideemt
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed here on our way to Texas from Florida on 2-6-12. We literally decided this 2 hours prior to arrival and were referred here by a local B&B. We called to see if they had anything available and were helped very happily on the phone and at check in by Becky. We got in around 8pm and she gave us some directions on where to go to get some food near by. We found Mojitos Bar and Grill and got our first taste of French Quarter New Orleans. Best crab cakes ever, good music and atmosphere. The next morning we got up and walked around the French Quarter to do the touristy thing. As we were taking our stuff to the car we were acknowledged by every staff member we passed with a "Good Morning." This is not something I'm very use to and was very nice. For our first trip to New Orleans we were so happy that this is where we stayed and will gladly stay again in the future. I know everyone looks for a complaint so here is my only one: the bed was a little too firm for our liking but not to the point of not sleepable. Sorry but that is all I could come up with, everything else we loved about this hotel. If you want the nastalgic feel of classic New Orleans then this is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Will make a note not to stay here....”
Reviews.Author: lulupark
Reviews.Content: Just called to inquire about making a reservation for an upcoming event and the desk clerk I spoke with quickly told me that they were all sold out, although the website showed that the dates I was inquiring about were partially sold out, so I had a few questions. Before I could ask them, she had already hung up. Very rude....if the service is bad over the phone and I haven't even made a reservation, then I will make a note to skip this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel in a Beautiful partof town with a beautiful and AWESOME STAFF....in a word they are BEAUTIFUL!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ThePhillyTravelers
Reviews.Content: My beautiful wife and I found this Hotel through Bookings.com and I have to say that the majority of the reviews were on point. We chose this hotel for a little Pre-Valentines Day/Mardi Gras vacation (2/11/12-2/14/12). The moment we walked through the doors the security (doorman) was helpful and informative. The front desk ladies were super helpful and knowledgable of the area and the inprocessing was painless. The front desk scheduled all of our tours and had great reccomendations for some of our lunch and dinner plans througout our stay (all of which were great). Our room was warm and inviting though some of the in room amenities/furnishings were a little dated. This hotel/room was everything we needed and wanted. It's close enough (walking distance) to everything in the French Quarter you would want to do, but far enough away from the madness of Bourbon St that you can get a great quiet nights sleep.I will definatley stay here on our next visit to the Big Easy and will recommend this wonderful hotel to our friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, classic hotel, great staff! Will return.”
Reviews.Author: sphygmos
Reviews.Content: We had a great time during our stay at Le Richelieu Feb. 10-13, 2012. My fiancÃ© and I were there for the first weekend of Mardi Gras which coincided with his birthday. The hotel was very clean, and the staff were wonderful and helpful. We met some lovely folks at the hotel bar who were repeat customers and who gave us a GREAT recommendation for a restaurant (see my review of Melange). The hotel had a very classic, old-fashioned feel, a beautiful courtyard with saltwater pool, and it's in a nice quiet part of the Quarter. The only problem we had was that our room was rather cold one night, but it was the coldest day New Orleans had had this year, so it's to be expected. Normally it doesn't get that cold in NOLA. Will be returning, and will recommend to friends!

Reviews.Title: “Le Richelieu”
Reviews.Author: lucyanne1
Reviews.Content: This has repeatedly been my #1 hotel in New Orleans for several years. Location, location, location is only part of their charm. The hotel is located in the civilized, quiet end of the French Quarter. The rest of the charm is compliments of the staff and the facility. The hotel is lovely: quaint, clean, unique and not "cookie cutter." The staff is off the chart! They call you by name, have great suggestions, the best friendly bar staff I have EVER met and the breakfast/lunch menu is delicious. Even the housekeeping staff is friendly and calls you by name (Hi Tammy!). The front desk does the same (Hi Pam and Tamara). The owner, Frank, is on property daily and speaks with each guest like an old friend. There is no better place to stay in New Orleans than here!

Reviews.Title: “Great Safe Location, Helpful Staff, Room a bit dated”
Reviews.Author: NYWhitesox
Reviews.Content: My family (3 of us) stayed here recently for two nights prior to leaving on a cruise from New Orleans. Check in was a breeze and we had a room with a shared balcony/porch on the second floor. The room was clean and our real only complaint was the old air-conditioning unit that could not be turned off ....that wasn't the problem... the problem was that the unit had a thumping noise that never stopped. We liked the location of the room with the balcony so we didn't seek to move after we had unpacked everything. We were able to get up each morning and take a 5 minute stroll to Cafe DuMonde for beignet and chicory coffee. The location is really ideal for it is within a 10 to 15 minute walk to everything in the French Quarter. We'd probably stay again if I could get a good rate for the room due to the location alone.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back”
Reviews.Author: tbolt96
Reviews.Content: Located at the edge of the French Quarter and with its own parking lot, this is my favorite NOLA hotel. The rooms are getting a little dated (we had a broken floor lamp), but not enough to make me look elsewhere. Our room was clean and the desk clerks were very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great price and service”
Reviews.Author: kdear
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights for along weekend. The service was wonderful and helpful . The breakfast was fresh and a good price compare to other breakfast meal in the French Quarters. What was really nice was getting away from the noise of the other streets. My only complaint was are room was really cold on the 3rd night.

Reviews.Title: “Authentic New Orleans Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: maestrad'arte
Reviews.Content: My party had a very nice stay at Le Richelieu in August 2011. We found the hotel to be clean, comfortable and quiet. The hotel staff were polite and helpful. This hotel is conveniently located for visiting the French Quarter, the New Orleans Museum of Art (highly recommended!), the Mississippi River, Cafe du Monde, shopping and of course culinary establishments galore. Although the hotel offers 80 some rooms & suites, the facade is quaint with a long communal balcony. The tall windows and doors sport wooden shutters and the wooden balcony is edged with - what else? - a wrought iron balustrade. The centerpiece of the interior courtyard is a rectangular swimming pool that is surrounded by attractive landscaping and plenty of tables and chairs. The hotel's restaurant and bar has a glass wall opening onto the courtyard. Restaurant guests are served either inside or poolside according to their wishes. The restaurant servers are true professionals who are attentive to your needs. I noticed that locals frequent the restaurant for NOLA style business breakfasts. It is true that no one offered to carry our luggage to our room, but I wasn't expecting this given the hotel's affordable price. New Orleans was quite hot and humid during our stay, but the hotel's HVAC kept us comfortable. I appreciated having an iron and ironing board already in the closet. From what I observed, it appeared that room service was very active. The staff at the front desk were able to answer my questions, recommend local restaurants and attractions and help coordinate transportation. Overall, I would recommend Le Richelieu to anyone who does not require luxury, but seeks comfort, cleanliness and convenience.

Reviews.Title: “What a great value and wonderful surprise!”
Reviews.Author: JimboInTheHouse
Reviews.Content: I found Le Richelieu on the internet at a bargain basement "run of the house" price. I didn't even know what that meant, but I was told it was we had to take whatever was available. I neededa king size bed and I couldn't take a chance on getting something smaller because my wife and I were travelling with our little boy. So, the woman happily told me she would get me a king size bed at the same price.. on Christmas, no less! I had read varying reviews from about how charming the hotel was and how nice it was to how old and disappointing it was. I didn't know what to expect. Upon arrival, it was indeed an old hotel. One of the oldest in the city as a matter of fact. The floors in the hallways were uneven, the elevator ancient and smelled like axle grease. The wall paper in the elevator lobby was peeled off the wall as it was being repaired. I was a little nervous about it until we entered our room. It was fantastic. A wonderful surprise. We were booked in a suite! There was a full living room, a kitchen (the stove and oven were disabled for safety), a seperated bedroom with walk-in closet, a bathroom with a closet and a coat closet upon entry into the suite. We also had a private balcony. The room was very nicely decorated and we were elated! We paid much more for far inferior rooms on this trip. The staff was very nice. You do have to turn your key in to the front desk if you leave because they are real keys, not the key cards newer hotels have and they don't want you to lose them. Fair enough, since most people go to Borbon Street and do well to find their way back, let alone keep up with a key! The hotel is located close enough to anything in the French Quarter to walk to, about 2 blocks to the French Market and a nice walk up the river or to the Quarter and Bourbon Street. We walked all over without any problems. I highly recomment this gem! True, it's not a new, modern Hilton, but it is very nice for a change of pace. I loved being in the "charming" atmosphere and we will stay there without even considering anyplace else next time we travel to New Orleans!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel For The Price”
Reviews.Author: LSUFOOTBALL
Reviews.Content: Tamara, the manager will go the extra mile to help you out and you don't find that in other big city hotels. The location is perfect if you want Old New Orleans. The room was very comfortable and it had access to the wrap around balcony. Look,you can nick pic a place to death but this hotel has charm,style,a great location,comfortable clean rooms and a great staff. You will NOT find a better deal in New Orleans if you want to walk to all the places that matter.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Funky but Charming”
Reviews.Author: 40LVE
Reviews.Content: I wouldn't normally choose a hotel in the French Quarter, but Le Richelieu is on the far Eastern end of the Quarter and you have the feeling almost of being in its own village. There is not much street noise. We were fortunate to be in a suite, but it was by no means luxurious, the furniture was a little shopworn, but the bedroom was nicely furnished and the king size bed very comfortable. It is a little short on amenities, for example room service is only on weekends and limited to breakfast. It does have a bar off the lobby which is small but OK for a late-night drink. My one complaint is that the walls are paper thin. I actually had to walk two doors down to ask a party of women to keep their noise down--I could almost hear everthing they were saying replete with loud chortling. I can't speak to the parking as others have, because we did not rent a car and were mostly walking the Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Laura G
Reviews.Content: My friends and I have stayed at Le Richelieu every year when we go to Mardi Gras for the past 12 years, and it's become our special place.
