I find it's old world charm is very appealing as it "feels" like the French Quarters. The same helpful, friendly staff are there to greet us and help us with our needs year after year. It's located just far enough off of Bourbon St. so that you can escape the noisy crowd, plus it's definitely on the prettier, more charming, more residential side of the Quarters, which I prefer. I made the mistake once of staying on the Canal St. side of the Quarters, and found it to be less clean, noisy, and a little scary at times . . . I won't make that mistake again!! It's Le Richelieu for me!!

Reviews.Title: “Le Richelieu Stay - 12/26/11 - 12/30/11”
Reviews.Author: PammyKay
Reviews.Content: This was our 4th consecutive year at Le Richelieu for the Papa Noel Season. We have always been very happy with the accommodations and service. However this year, it was like they didn't care anymore. They no longer have an on duty parking lot attendant and installed an electric gate. Exiting the gate is no problem - the sensors work and the gates open. Entering is different. We always had to get out of the car and ask for permission to enter the lot. The man who is supposed to help with luggage was sleeping in a chair. The desk clerk did tell him, as we were checking in, that he had a personal call at the desk, so he got up and took the call, and then promptly sat back down and shut his eyes. No assistance was provided. During our 4 day stay, we are supposed to receive 2 sets of coupons for various things, such as free drinks at the bar, breakfast, and Cafe Du Monde. We only received one set and had to request additional sets. Had to pay for coffee in the a.m. Usually hotels offer free coffee, however, I noticed one person pay $1.50 for a styrofoam cup of coffee, another paid $2.00, and I was charged $3.00 for a cup. Our tub had to be plunged every day because it wouldn't drain and there were times our toilet would run constantly and wouldn't flush. Internet service was absent...completely! People were walking around the pool trying to pick up service on their laptops. There was none to be had. My husband talked to 3 different desk employees on 3 separate occasions to give them our experience in trying to sign on...no one seemed to care much. One man in the lobby was very upset about not having internet and vowed never to return. A lot of business people stay there, so I would assume many people were not too happy about the lack of internet. Will we return?...no! Actually, they lost me the night we checked in. When a hotel won't let us use the luggage cart because the man sleeping in the chair is supposed to help...well, I'm not sure what else to say about that. We will be looking for alternative hotels in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Le Richelieu ...a hidden gem.”
Reviews.Author: paulaga
Reviews.Content: My friend and I decided to go to New Orleans for New Years at the last minute and found this little hotel located in the French Quarter. It was a perfect location, close to the action but not so close that it was bothersome. Wonderful staff and rooms!

Reviews.Title: “Charming in an old, outdated way”
Reviews.Author: AmandaB8
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a suite over New Years. For New Orleans, the room was very reasonably priced for a very busy weekend in NOLA. I thought the old, outdated style of hotel was pretty cool. My fiance thought it was a little too outdated- like we were staying at our grandparents house. The room was huge with almost a full kitchen (no working stove but full fridge). We had a great view of the courtyard with pool and the New Orleans city skyline. There is a full bar but it closes pretty early (I think 9PM?). And the room service is pretty pathetic- they only offer breakfast which only includes a pastry and drink. The hotel is located in the Quarter but it's about 4 blocks from all of the "action" it's much more convenient to Frenchmen street. The parking is on site and is secure in a parking lot right outside of the hotel- that was nice as we get a little nervous giving our vehicle to valets sometimes.

Reviews.Title: “Good real Nola”
Reviews.Author: Catleen C
Reviews.Content: Thus is s great location. Quiet, old school, Nola , I loved it !

Reviews.Title: “Christmas at Le Richelieu”
Reviews.Author: Florie
Reviews.Content: We decided to spend our Christmas vacation in New Orleans this year. Of course, there was only one choice for our accommodations: a return to Le Richelieu. It was as beautifully and tastefully decorated for the holidays as we imagined that it would be, we were welcomed back like old friends by Pam, Dave, and the other helpful front desk staff and, as with our first visit, all of our needs were met, often anticipated before we asked. Dave brought us a tiny and very safe space heater for our room, as we experienced a few chilly nights, the housekeeping staff was helpful and unobtrusive, and the hotel even arranged with my husband for a special holiday gift to be delivered to me at the hotel. To those reviewers complaining that the walls had cracks and caulking needed a touch-up, please remember that this fine old hotel was a casualty of hurricane Katrina. As with much of the city, it survived with a few scars. The location is within perfect walking distance to the clubs on Frenchmen Street just minutes from the French Market. We would stroll the Market every morning after a great breakfast at the Magnolia Grill (where we quickly became 'family'). Cafe L'Envie is just down the block for a great cup of coffee and a snack or light meal. A very famous couple and their many children live almost directly behind the hotel on the next block. Tourists, please spend your dollars in this city. It is in the process of rebuilding and hasn't received much help from the government. Help these good people help themselves. You will be doing a good deed while having a spectacular vacation. A win-win situation.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, rooms could be much nicer”
Reviews.Author: PickyTraveller2011
Reviews.Content: This hotel had a GREAT location and the staff was VERY friendly and helpful. Rooms were AMAZINGLY clean, but not kept up well at all. The flooring under the carpet was very uneven and uncomfortable to walk on. There were so many scuff marks and cracks on the walls, and caulking needed touch up in many areas in the bathroom. No light outside our room due to burned out bulb. It was very cold and there was no heater in the room, and there were gaps in the windows to let more cold air in. Had to request a space heater so we were confined to the one warm room on our suite. Location canâ€™t be beat, but considering the price of the room and how poorly the room is maintained, I didnâ€™t consider it a good value. This hotel is decorated in a certain â€œstyle,â€� but that doesnâ€™t excuse the lack of maintenance. I wouldnâ€™t have cared if it were a few scuff marks here or there, but there were enough for me to notice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: marcjwm
Reviews.Content: Fantastic place to be in the Quarter - over on the quieter side near Frenchmen if you want to be a bit away from all of the noise/hectic life that is closer to Bourbon and Canal. A bit dated, but that's New Orleans for you - room was clean, bathroom was fine, so nothing to complain about. Definitely a great value for the price and great location.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Front Desk Clerks”
Reviews.Author: Prine041745
Reviews.Content: The front desk clerks are the best I have ever seen (all of them). The Hotel has easy parking, fast check-in and a great location. The pool is one of the best in the French Quarter. The Hotel is located on the edge of the quarter, but an easy walk to everything. The rooms are very clean with great beds, and a larger than average bathroom. I will be staying a Le Richelieu for all future trips to New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, very old, FANTASTIC location!”
Reviews.Author: TravelingTexan83
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fabulous. You can tell it's old (and a little creepy) but it was super clean. And the location was absolutely perfect. It's just 2 blocks south of Bourbon Street, so it's well within walking distance to all the action. But it was such a quiet little block of Chartres St that we felt very relaxed when we would call it a night. We will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “quaint hotel”
Reviews.Author: Theresa W
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Le Richelieu hotel this past summer and we loved it, the hotel staff was very gracious and helpful front desk clerk (her name escapes me) gave us a little history of the neighborhood and where we could find a good place to eat, such as the coffepot resturant and Endive which was on a episode of Treme both great places to eat might i add but oh back to the Hotel review lol room was kinda small but still nice and clean beds are very comfortable loved the pool area clean and the owner of the hotel walks around like a regular person and above all this hotel is in the same vicinity of brad and angelina's home...

Reviews.Title: “Nice old hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: ExistenceNow
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over the weekend for a quick vacation. Hotel is in a fantastic location. There are tons of small local type bars surrounding it, and if you want the chaos of Burbon Street, it's only a five minute walk. Room was a good size for having two beds. TV was tiny, but was at least flat screen. Room had french doors that led out to a HUGE (albeit shared) balcony. AC blew COLD constantly, but you could adjust the flow. I like a cold room though, so I was happy. Bathroom fixtures were old, but were clean and still worked well. Staff was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good service”
Reviews.Author: Yevie115
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great spot, just five minutes away from Frenchman St, the French Market, Esplanade, and the cable car that takes you to Canal St or the Warehouse District. Even though it is central, the street it is on is very quiet. The hotel rooms are average size, the double beds are ok for two people (queen size I think). There is a pool and a cafe in the hotel that you can sit at in the morning while having breakfast, which is nice. The staff was helpful and courteous. Overall, I have no complaints at all!

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: Sandy1036
Reviews.Content: We were in New Orleans for 4 days in October. We thought we would would go 1st class in the French Quarter for our stay. The suite that we stayed in was very expensive and had terrible ammenities. The kitchen was totally empty, we had to ask for a coffee maker and when we did, we were informed that we would have to buy coffee, filters, cream etc. The rooms were adequate, but not updated and the beds were uncomfortable and even the bedding was second rate. The best part of this hotel, was the convience to walk everywhere. Also, on an additional note, we were told there was WIFI, but it never worked for our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was good, besides the infection I got from a bed bug”
Reviews.Author: sirid
Reviews.Content: I'll start this off with the good things-the staff is nice (except we got scolded by a cleaning lady for not putting our do not disturb sign up), I thought the room was clean (more on that later), the bathroom was nice enough. It wasn't that close to the bars on Bourbon (their description is a bit misleading) but as long as you have a guy with you it's fine (I wouldn't feel comfortable making that walk by myself) however it is right next to the French Market and there are other bars and restaurants near it. The bad is mostly one thing. As I was sleeping I got bit by what I'm assuming is a BED BUG because there was literally no bugs to be seen in the room. This would normally not bother me except for that fact that I got an insane infection that I now have to take 5 pillls a day for the next 7 days for (I dealt with this stupid infection while in New Orleans for the next 2 days and went straight to urgent care when my plane landed at home). The friend I was with got bit twice in her bed too by mystery bugs. Honestly, for the price it's ok-I really wish it had been closer to Bourbon. If I hadn't gotten an infection, I would have given this place a 4 and stayed here again the next time I came to New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Big Easy, Old World Charm”
Reviews.Author: kiskatomcreek
Reviews.Content: The Richelieu has been a favorite of ours for many years, first because of its free parking and outdoor pool (when our children were small) and now because of its laid-back charm (the kids don't come anymore). Staff is friendly and helpful, rooms are comfortable with all the amenities. We walk everywhere. Some people might think it's a little worn-down but we appreciate the patina of this classic gem!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Quiet and Good Value in the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: luvmooney
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 3 nights at Le Richelieu several years ago. Aside from being a nice, somewhat modestly priced hotel, it has the decor and ambience of the french quarter and comes with free on-site parking which was a big plus. It is tucked away in a quiet corner of the quarter but still within reasonable walking distance of most major attractions. It has a small bar/dining area that looks out onto the courtyard pool which is very pretty, and a nice place for a quiet breakfast if you want to eat on-site before heading out for a day of sight-seeing. The rooms as well as the public areas were clean which is the most important factor. The hotel also happens to be haunted, which we didn't find out until checkout time when I asked the front desk clerk if the reason my bed was shaking (2 out 3 of the mornings) was due to any earthquakes in the area and her reply was "No. Half the hotel is haunted though but I didn't know the room you were staying in was one of them". This would have only made me more inclined to stay there though, had I know ahead of time. The bed shook for about 10 seconds at the same time each morning around dawn. I opened my eyes the second time and saw nothing there...Overall, it is a nice hotel for the price and I would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Dual experience in the Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Fijman
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Le Richelieu in the Quarter and loved all of the people working there - very friendly, helpful and genuine. The hotel has a great location in the Quarter and is close to so much. That's the good... All that said, I can't say that I'd ever go back or recommend it to anyone.... It's all very old and it's not the quaint kind.... The hotel needs updating and cleaning. The bathroom was dirty... no attention to detail - spider living in the corner of the ceiling and mirror obviously for a while and well fed.... Dirty floor, poor shower. The air can't be adjusted and just keeps going... dingy in the bar area.... Didn't hang around much and didn't want to. I've stayed in many other hotels in the area that are older and different that also have charm to them and you embrace the differences - this facility was different and you can't embrace "run down". I hope they really fix and clean it up in the near future. Could be a nice place. I also have to say that I can't believe the room rates based on what you get other than location... Disappointed

Reviews.Title: “A1 location”
Reviews.Author: hotshowbag
Reviews.Content: A great base for a stay in the french Q. Close to the French market , the trolley to the Riverwalk area , 1 minute walk to Frenchman st for great music and atmosphere , 5 minutes from the heart of Bourbon st but far enough from the noise and crowds . The hotel is old but you are in the French q. so what do some of these people who complain want , all the buildings are old . You can stay at the Marriott if you want new but you wont get all this place has to offer . Great Coffee shop one block down called Envie. Dont forget , if you are in your room for more than 6 hours you are not making the most of New Orleans. Some bathrooms need a little work .

Reviews.Title: “Needs updating. Lovely staff.”
Reviews.Author: i_can_be_picky
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in serious need of updates. The air conditioning system can't be controlled and we had to put a towel over the unit. The shower was the worst, absolutely no water pressure, a dribble. Perhaps other rooms are better. We had a balcony overlooking the pool, but no chairs for them and they couldn't provide any. However, the staff was very friendly. The first room we were sent to was very small and they did provide a bigger room. The location is perfect if you want to spend time on Frenchmen Street and out of the noise of the busier areas of the Quarter. If they update the rooms I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “We always stay here when in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: kharley
Reviews.Content: we are regulars at the Le Richelieu because of the great service, friendly and helpful staff and excellent location. we have been coming about 6 times a year for the last 4 years and always look forward knowing there will be no hassles or problems.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, romantic hotel, great location, friendly staff, quiet commodious room”
Reviews.Author: smachs
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 days, taking advantage of summer special rate. Located in French Quarter on Chartres Street. Close to Frenchman Street music scene (much better than wild Bourbon St.). It has own parking lot. We enjoyed coffee and breakfast at the Espresso cafe near the parking lot. We ate at Muriel's on Chartres next to Jackson Square--wonderful place. We stayed in room 404 which even had a walk in closet as well as high ceilings a pretty rooftop views. It was as I always imagined a hotel in Paris. The a/c worked well during record heat. Nice breakfast and lunch and bar available with view of the pool. We loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Only place we stay”
Reviews.Author: akw46845
Reviews.Content: We have been traveling to New Orleans yearly since we can't remember when and way back on our first or second trip we were lucky enough to try out Le Richelieu and we have been coming back there ever since. We have tried, sometimes by choice, sometimes by dictates of whatever meeting or convention we were attending, staying at other properties - they just don't compare. Yes; some of the rooms could use an update; and the decorating style is a tad out of date; but then again - the parking, even if not free anymore is easy and on-site; the pool is a god-send on a hot day, the bar even more so when it is raining; the front-desk staff knows everything there is to know about the city, the location is wonderfully quiet but close to everything that matters, the breakfasts are huge and really good, and honestly - in new orleans; who spends that much time in the room anyway?

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: GST521110
Reviews.Content: From the time we booked the room online, and contacted the hotel both online and by phone, the staff was helpful, polite, professional and quick with responses to inquiries. When we arrived, the staff was quick to provide any assistance needed. Being that my wife had informed them in prior conversations that we were there to celebrate both her birthday and our recent anniversary, we were greeted with wishes of Happy Birthday and Happy Anniversary. Then to our surprise, we were issued the key to the Paul McCartney suite. WOW, such a nice suite and a private balcony that spans the entire width of the hotels main entrance on Chartres Street. The lobby staff was wonderful, the bar/cafÃ© staff were outstanding and friendly, the housekeeping staff were very efficient and flexible to our schedule. The breakfast at the on-site cafe was fabulous. The staff at this hotel treats you as though you were family and makes you feel at home. Already planning a return trip for next year.

Reviews.Title: “Not for me..just ok”
Reviews.Author: carllou
Reviews.Content: The staff is super nice but the hotel room was a tad too shabby for me. I love old world charm but the room needs to be updated. First of all they need to rip the carpet out. The room smells like mold. I got upgraded but the kitchenette was old. The bathroom was old too. I guess it wasn't for me. The free WiFI did not work in the room. I had to check from the lobby. I probably won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “What a gem.”
Reviews.Author: TN_Rock-Hound
Reviews.Content: For our first trip to New Orleans, we had read many reviews on TripAdvisor and decided on Le Richelieu for our five night stay. We arrived by car and were very pleased with the accessibility of self parking. Robert, who definitely lives up to his wonderful reputation as an incredible desk clerk, checked us in. He remarked that we were getting a bargain and upon entering our two room suite we were speechless. Room 109 has high ceilings, a chandelier and dining table, flat screen televisions in both the living room and bedroom and includes little details like large french door windows with beautiful drapes and a celing fan in the bedroom. A large bathroom, a large walk in closet and a kitchen with fridge were all an indication this was previously used as an apartment. We had been upgraded to a suite at no extra charge. Being close to Frenchman Street was a real treat. And we walked to and from the hotel, day and night, with relatively no problems. Taxi's are very available too. There is a lot of history in the resedential neighborhood where Le Richelieu is located. Since we had a car, we did enjoy being able to drive to locations outside the French Quarter and never had a problem finding a parking space on returning. We did not use the pool and went out to have breakfast. There are a pair of elevators, but we never left the ground floor.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, friendly, and rustic French Quarter gem...”
Reviews.Author: Splnkr
Reviews.Content: We decided to try out the Le Richielieu for our 16th wedding anniversary trip to NOLA. Ordinarily, we stay at the Le Pavillon, (THE benchmark NOLA hotel in our opinion). But we decided to take a chance and try something different. Plus, we wanted something a bit closer to the Quarter, but still on the quiet side. Well, Le Richelieu definitely fit our bill. So many of the reviews made the hotel sound like a dark, dank, moldy hole in the wall. This could not be farther from true. Sure, it is an older facility--an old apartment building if I gather correctly--but it was far from dank. The only "stuffy" smell we encountered was in the elevator, which we only took once. After checking in with the very friendly hotel staff, we took to the second floor--room 220-- and opened the door into a literal apartment flat! Now, we had explained that this was our 16th wedding anniversary trip, and asked for a balcony room. They said something about upgrading us, and I guess this is what they meant. This room was huge! Nice living space with couch and two chairs, plus 27 inch LCD TV, kitchen with sink and fridge, huge walk in closet space, and nice bedroom with a second LCD TV. Though the couch was not very comfy, the bed was wonderful. Both rooms had crank-windows that opened out onto the pool courtyard, which was beautiful. Even when children were splashing in the pool, it was a quiet and serene room. The only grip I had was the Mockingbirds that started up at about oh-dark-thirty every morning! There was no offer of anyone to help us with our bags to and from, and parking is now $20 a night. Nevertheless, it was easy to get from the car to the room. My wife was a bit miffed that the toilet paper was empty after a room service, but we scrounged up a roll from a closet. Overall the rooms were very clean, and the furnishings nice. As the hotel is situated on the eastern end of Chartres Street, it is an easy walk even to Huck Fins way up Decatur, Desire on Bourbon, Frenchman Street Jazz, Felix's, or the River. And, as it is in the more quiet section of the Quarter, you will be scarcely aware of the fervor going on around you! The pool and associated bistro was fantastic as well. Our three night stay, including parking and all applicable taxes, set us back $416.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Albertatraveler
Reviews.Content: Only good things to say. We arrived around noon and room was ready. If you prefer upscale modern hotels, this is not for you. IIt is an older building with lots of character and friendly staff. We had a room with a king size bed. It was roomy with new tv and free internet. The air conditioning worked fine and was adjustable. The bathroom reminded us of one from the 50's. One day we had breakfast. The menu was limited and good. Crepes are what I would call pancakes.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint French Quarter Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TACCooke
Reviews.Content: At the edge of the French Quarter district but only 2 blocks from Bourbon Street and close to Frenchmen Street where you will find music and a great little Italian restaurant called Adolfo's. Clean room, reasonably priced breakfast and lunch available, lovely staff, quiet area. Also close to markets and several other good restaurants. Ask the staff as they will point you in the right direction. Shuttle and taxi prices to the airport basically the same. Would stay here again. Swimming pool in courtyard.

Reviews.Title: “Within walking distance to Frenchmen St.”
Reviews.Author: rruthardt
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Le Richelieu for the last 2 days of our NOLA stay. I am glad we did. First of all, it is within short walking distance of Frenchmen St....our favorite place to go to hear jazz and the Praline Connection (restaurant). They have free parking right in back of the hotel so you can park your car and roam the FQ. The rooms are well appointed. The bathrooms have plenty of closet room and great water pressure. We loved it! There is an in house bar and restaurant opened for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Visit to this French Quarter Gem”
Reviews.Author: Pomsr
Reviews.Content: This was my third visit to the Le Richelieu, and I would happily suggest this hotel to anyone who is looking for a pleasant stay in the French Quarter. The staff is very helpful and friendly, from the front desk to the guard in the parking lot and everyone in between. The rooms are great, considering you are not staying in a cookie cutter chain. This is an old hotel in an area of old hotels. It is not modern or pristine, but that is one reason I like it. It gives the real feel of the French Quarter, but it is also clean and relatively quiet. If you are looking for a "Holiday Inn" type room, do not stay in the French Quarter. But if you are looking for a pleasant, clean, relatively quiet hotel in a more sedate part of the Quarter, this is your place. Be forewarned, your tub drain might be slow or your air conditioner might be a tad noisy...but, again, this just comes with the territory, and the staff at this hotel will gladly send a pleasant maintenance man to attend to your problems. I really enjoy this hotel and will stay on my subsequent trips to the Quarter. P.S. If you are attending a Festival or event in or around the Old Mint or the French Market, this is absolutely the best location in the Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and Service”
Reviews.Author: Traveler3636
Reviews.Content: We were looking for an authentic New Orleans experience apart from the name brand hotels and the Le Richelieu fit the bill. The hotel is located near the French Market in a part of the French Quarter that is less traveled than the noisy confines of Bourbon Street. It is near outstanding restaurants and just a few blocks from the shops of Royal and the riverfront street car. We had a one room suite which looked to have been a converted apartment with a living/dining room, full bath, bedroom and kitchen. The kitchen has a refrigerator and sink but no microwave or even a coffeepot, the only real negative as far as I was concerned. There is a small pool and a cafe that serves breakfast but we never ate there. Be aware this is an old hotel. There are some signs of wear and it is a bit musty. If you want chrome and steel and chocolates on the pillow at night, go somewhere else. The staff is friendly but not intrusive. We found it to be quiet due to being off the beaten path and a little quirky (when you leave the hotel you are asked to leave your key, no swipe cards here, at the front desk and ask for it on your return). Free local newspapers were available each day and the hotel has secure on site parking for $20 a day. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “First and Last NOL Trip”
Reviews.Author: brissybarb
Reviews.Content: I have to make this clear. The staff were absolutely brilliant. I can't complain A++++++. The room they gave us was great. No Tea and Coffee making facilities but a kitchen bit strange! On check out asked for a wake up call to catch a bus to the airport didn't happen. Went to get my bill saw and entry that I didn't agree with and asked what it was for. They said they had to go and get receipts for the back office after a little "heavy breathing" They did so came back maybe 20 minutes later with 3 large manilla folders full of documents and said they had to search them to see what they were for. My bus had arrived and I had to leave. Paid the bill and am now trying to get them t refund the amount as we did not go to the restraurant twice. Only once. They require a more updated system. But the staff bar one one great. Had to turn of air conditioner way too noisey. For the price I would say average as it is quite expensive. We had other choices however all rooms were booked due to a large convention in NOL

Reviews.Title: “We've always loved New Orleans and now we love Le Richelieu too!”
Reviews.Author: BusinessTripBuddy
Reviews.Content: We will definitely stay here again! This hotel has it all; interesting history, friendly staff, cozy bar, great breakfast, awesome French Quarter location (close to Royal street, the French Market, etc.), and even a parking lot!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Experience”
Reviews.Author: WHernand
Reviews.Content: While this hotel is old it is also charming and exceptionallywell maintained. Beyond that, the staff is like 'family' from the owner, Frank, to bartenders Renne and Brian, to frontdesk Rebecca and Robert. Overall, a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “A Welcome Surprise”
Reviews.Author: Lona_8
Reviews.Content: When we first traveled to NOLA in the mid 90's, this hotel was considered to be in a "bad" section of town, and since we were with fairly young children, we opted to stay elsewhere. On this trip, we became disenchanted with our hotel and heard that Le Richelieu's area was much safer than before, so we moved, and we are very glad that we did. It is a charming hotel that is very clean and well run. The people who work there have been there for years and are like family to each other. They can steer you in the right direction for anything you want to do in NO, and they are extremely close to Frenchman's Street which is where some of the best night life occurs. We will go back!

Reviews.Title: “What a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: UKLynne44
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights . We paid a bit more than we usually do because it looked interesting and was in a good location for exploring the French Quarter. Of all the Hotels and B&Bs we stayed in on our 4 week trip to the Southern States of America, this was the most expensive and the most disappointing (apart from the location and the desk clerk, Robert). I know that old, historic properties can be a bit jaded but I just felt that the paintwork could do with a good clean. Our room was dark and dismal and the only one on our trip that didn't have tea and coffee making facilities. On top of everything, breakfast was extra and parking was $20 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Just as I Remembered”
Reviews.Author: nickpeg
Reviews.Content: A previous reviewer states that Le Richelieu and the city are slipping. I politely disagree. We stayed at this hotel approximately 15 years ago and it was just as I remembered. If you like chain hotels, marble bathrooms and lots of noise/people, this is not the place for you. If you like unique, comfortable and low key, Le Richelieu is ideal. Yes, it is not new but that is part of the charm. When you walk from the street into the lobby, you immediately feel as if you have entered a more relaxed time. Details: We got a great rate on a suite and it was so roomy, an actual apartment. Courtyard pool area is wonderful. Always areas of sun or shade and a great place to hang for a few hours of swimming, reading, napping, drinking, etc. The rooms are so quiet. We stayed 5 nights and I never heard any noise from the street or other guests. Staff were friendly. Location is great. 2 safely walkable block to the music clubs on Frenchman St. Half a block from a coffee house and 1-2 blocks from restaurants (Louisiana Pizza Kitchen, Italian Barrel, El Gato Negro). And, if you are in halfway decent shape, a comfortable walk through the Quarter to Jackson Square and Canal Street. A reviewer mentioned problems with regulating the cooling system. The vent levers on top do not work well; but, if you read the instructions in the guest book and adjust the knobs on the bottom you can easily adapt the temperature to your liking. As for the city itself; although we have been to New Orleans several times in the past, we had not been here since Katrina. The City has done an outstanding job at recovery. The Quarter, Central Business District and Garden District barely show signs of Katrina. The music, food, people and spirit of New Orleans are truly unique and wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Great room-incredible stay!”
Reviews.Author: MrsMcMonty
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent time at the Richelieu! Robert at the front desk was always very pleasant. And our room view was great! The location in the quiet part of the quarter was awesome! While the accommodations are a bit dated, it's got a cozy charm that you don't find at chain hotels. We had our entire wedding party for our destination wedding stay there and everyone loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Le Richelieu and NOLA- Both Slipping”
Reviews.Author: Larlin
Reviews.Content: This was our fourth trip to NO and our second to Le Richelieu. Our last trip was pre-Katrina, so we were curious to see if anything had changed. And it had, for the worse. I know this is supposed to be a review of the hotel, but the similarities between the hotel and the Quarter are striking. Both are in a state of decay. We last stayed at Le Richelieu some ten years ago and enjoed it very much. That's why we returned. Our chief complaint this time was the noisy air conditioning. It's an antiquated system using cold water and is adjusted by valves at the bottom of the unit. Ours was so noisy, we had to turn it off at night so we could sleep. When we complained to the front desk about it, they offered to send up the security guard to "help" . We declined. As has been reported, the parking fee is now $20.00 per day. There is a guard shack at the entrace to the lot, but I only saw a guard there once, and then only for a short period of time. Coffee is not avaiable, either in the room or lobby, and room service hours and menu have been greatly scaled back. The bar is not well stocked and there is no pool side service. Now to the Quarter itself. As I stated, we've been to NO before and have seen the seedier side of it. Bourbon Street is now a pig sty. It has gone from being somewhat decadent to being low life scum. The sidewalks on all the streets are nearly impassable and downright dangerous because of the gaping holes and missing or broken slates. I'm sure that ankles are twisted and legs broken almost every day. We've loved the city and all its flaws in the past. But in it's current condition, we will not return.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet charmer”
Reviews.Author: StuartandDenese
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful old quaint hotel a tad off the beaten path in the French Quarter. Visually pleasing and quiet. The bar, wait, and cleaning staff are all so pleasant and hospitable. The restaurant is cozy and the coffee is good. The rooms are lovely with french doors that open into a pleasing view and sounds of jazz waft in from nearby Jackson Square. The pool is small, but landscaped nicely with wrought iron patio furniture providing classy accents. The beds are yummy and comfy. The front desk is a challenge. They are not professional, pleasant, or helpful. They are saying, "no" before a question is complete. The internet connectivity is terrible when and if it works (which changes from floor to floor of the hotel). No business services, no printing, no faxing, no notary, no help with directions. Yuck. That having been said, if you are a casual tourist visiting for fun - overlook the front desk dips because this beautiful little quiet gem is worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Excellent location,in quiet section of the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: daVerCanada
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for wifes 60th birthday, had never been to New Orleans before, this is an excellent location for those with families or folks like us who want some quiet from Bourbon St at the end of the day. Very quiet for sleeping, nice courtyard with pool, breakfast was good and good value. Staff were quiet but very helpfull if asked about anything. We had a beautiful room overlooking the pool area. The amenities (for an older style hotel) were very adequate. Its a few blocks to Bourbon St but only a short distance from the River and the market. Frenchman St a couple of blocks behind the hotel was a hidden jewel of jazz clubs and great food. Loved it!!!! Would return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, wonderful staff, Awesome location at Great Price!”
Reviews.Author: edabensky
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a 6 day vacation, with friends in another room as well, and enjoyed everything about this hotel. The staff was very helpful from the moment we walked in. There was some cofussion about our reservation dates, but it was dealt with immediatly and with a smile! They also suggested some great places to eat and gave us a map with all the exact locations. I will say that some rooms are in need of new rugs but for the price and location you can deal! The resuraunt had wonderful coffee and great late night service! The pool was also a bonus just to sit with a drink and soak your feet after a long day in the quarter! Some people also mentioned the fact that you can, repeat can not have to drop you key at the front dest, this actually , we found to be very helpful. Please do not hesitate to stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Most perfect hotel stay EVER.”
Reviews.Author: Florie
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived at Le Richelieu we were welcomed like family. The hotel itself is quintessential New Orleans; absolutely elegant, yet showing just a bit of age, rather like a dowager, a bit past her prime, but trying all the harder to make up for a few wrinkles and gray hairs. Staff from the front desk to housekeeping were all friendly, helpful and efficient. Our room had a private balcony that opened onto Chartres Street. We slept soundly each night with the balcony doors open to the night and the occasional sounds of the Quarter. The hotel itself is located in a quiet section of the Quarter, an easy walk to just about anywhere one would want to go. Another plus is the free parking for guests. A highlight of our trip was a visit with Mr. Frank, the proud owner of the establishment. this courtly gentleman regaled us with stories of the celebrities who have stayed in his hotel, including Paul McCartney, whose family lived there for several months while Paul was recording with Wings in New Orleans. The walls of his office are covered with inscribed photos of happy customers posing with this lovely and gentle man. Breakfast and lunch are served on the premises, room service is available, the bar is open until midnight and one will not feel like a stranger. Many people find the bar to be their daily gathering place, and they all go out of their way to make a stranger feel included in their conversation. The pool area looked lovely, but it was just a tad too cool for us to take a dip--and New Orleans has too many other adventures awaiting the visitor. I could not recommend the Richelieu more highly. It is a microcosm of all that is best in the people and the ambiance of this beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, a bit dingy, and parking is now $20/night”
Reviews.Author: pcor077
Reviews.Content: Likes: - In a quiet part of FQ close to Royal St. and good shopping - Two blocks from Croissant D'Or, an awesome French patisserie and coffee/espresso restaurant - Our 4th floor room's casement window cranked opened for lots of fresh air and sun - Parklng lot is guarded 24 hrs/day - Funky, European pensione feel with lovely view of residential French Quarter - Ceiling fan - Full kitchenette (which we didn't use) - Quiet room - Comfortable bed Dislikes: - Staff is a tad Fellini-esque--lots of different folks, laissez-faire attitude toward guests - Dingy room, dingy bathroom with weak shower, nasty carpet - Old A/C heat units hard to control; no thermostat in room - Didn't even want to have coffee or juice in the pool-side hotel cafe--not appealing at all

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Chelsea23Nyc
Reviews.Content: It is conveniently located to French Market and Jackson Square; maybe a 20 minute walk to Canal. But it is also far enough away from the craziness that is bar scene. The room was a suite so was large. It was dark but clean. The bathoorm and kitchen were very dated. The staff was helpful. Two things would make it a five star - a coffee pot in the room; and better control of the AC/heating unit. The one in the living area was broken on high and it was very cold.

Reviews.Title: “Value & Location”
Reviews.Author: GinMcG
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location. Relatively quiet part of French Quarter and quick walk to the jazz clubs on Frenchmen Street. Parking on premises - no longer free, however, now $20 a day. Great staff- provided us with umbrellas on a rainy night, gave good advice about what to see and areas to avoid, and gave us an electric kettle for our use when we came in from a very cold night out. This is an old historic building, so expect somewhat dingy decor and dated bathrooms. If you want modern and shiny go downtown. We would definitely stay here again and will recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: marcathy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights, room was adequate although had a problem with regulating heat but the staff took care of it. This is a great value and a fabulous location, close to everything in the French Quarter but not too close. The staff was helpful and friendly. Overall a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for a weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: 123stitch
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Le Richelieu for a long weekend, picked the hotel based on past reviews and it did not disappoint: very friendly staff, very clean room and super comfortable beds. Great place to soak up the French Quarter atmosphere with its beautiful homes, shops, restaurants, and galleries. The walk to Jackson Square takes 8 min at a leisurely pace. Bourbon Street is only a short walk away as well. I believe parking is no longer free as of 2011, but we did not have a car so not an issue for us. A coffee maker in the room would have been nice but we went out for breakfast anyway. Cafe d'Or on Ursulines is lovely and the dinner at Irene's on St Philip was amazing. We had a wonderful time and can highly recommend staying at the Le Richelieu.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Tuttidirezioni
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at Le Richelieu on multiple trips to New Orleans. Front Desk staff is excellent, efficient, friendly, and have great recommendations for dining that you can trust. Location is great, on the edge of the Quarter, away from the craziness of Bourbon street, but close to a lot of good restaurants. You feel like you are staying in a neighborhood, not a tourist district. Bathrooms need some updating, but are clean. Rooms have a lot of character. Free Parking! Only negative thing to say is free wifi is weak, but you can get a good signal in the lobby. The hotel equivalent of the favorite neighborhood bar--a place you can feel comfortable in right away.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, free parking, poor wifi.”
Reviews.Author: Sessa2
Reviews.Content: Very nice older hotel in the far, quiet corner of the French Quarter. Rooms are large, but bathrooms even larger and there was a huge walk in closet that I couldnt see how you could ever make use of. The staff was nice and helpful. The hotel offers free parking, which is a huge plus. The wifi, however, never worked properly over a two day stay.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing, but They Made It Right”
Reviews.Author: MJTX15
Reviews.Content: This was my third stay at Le Richelieu in the French Quarter. The first was several years ago and my girlfriends and I found the decor to be up to date and the beds particularly comfortable. Apparently, not all the rooms are of the same quality. The next stay was with my husband and although the room was nice, the bed in that room was not comfortable at all. This time we returned to Le Richelieu primarily because of its free parking and its proximity to other things in the French Quarter. Upon arrival they sent us to a suite on the 4th floor with decor from the 70's, although it appeared clean, it smelled musty and was extremely warm. I could find no thermostat or any other way of regulating the temperature. I called the front desk and was told they would send someone up. We went out for dinner and when we returned the problem had not been corrected. Upon request, we were moved to another suite that was slightly more updated and had a private balcony. We were able to open the French doors for ventilation. The bathroom had an updated toilet, but all the other fixtures were very dated. The kitchen was clean, but seriously out-dated. Frig, but no microwave. Our stay was okay and the price was very reasonable, but if aesthetics are high on your list this is not the place for you. Also, complimentary WI-FI is advertised, but the signal was so weak I could not connect.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: DonJancauskas
Reviews.Content: Finding reasonable prices for anything in New Orleans takes some time and searching. I have been to New Orleans more than a dozen times and felt I was price gauged at every hotel. This hotel is the exception. It is in The French Quarter and within walking distance to every major event or restauraunt within the quarter. It is a well serviced and cared for early 1800's charming hotel building with balconies and even its own ghosts. It was the barracks for the Confederate soldiers during the civil war and also the execution site for a number of Union soldiers, who have been seen roaming around recently. It even offers free parking if you drive. Definetly a good comfortable place to stay and a good value for an expensive city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay in the Quarter”
Reviews.Author: jimandrobinIllinois
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three days the weekend before Christmas. The hotel served our purposes very well. It is within walking distance of just about everything in the French Quarter area, but is located just outside the more crowded locations like Bourbon Street and Jackson Square. The rooms were very clean and everyone of the staff at the front desk was extremely nice and helpful. We didn't have any trouble sleeping, so either there weren't any late night partyers, we were just plain tuckered out from exploring all day, or the walls are thick enough to muffle the noise. Either way the rooms and beds were comfortable and allowed a good nights sleep. All and all a good hotel if you want to be near the action but be able to seperate yourself from it as well. We would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Le Richelieu is Great--We'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: frequentraveler30
Reviews.Content: After numerous trips to New Orleans over the years, we were happy to discover Le Richelieu. We loved the location, it was easy to find and it is in a safe area with many shops and good restaurants within walking distance. The complimentary parking is a wonderful ammenity. Probably thje best feature of the hotel is its very good customer service. They are very friendly and go out of their way to please you. One particular front desk person, Robert Lowe was especially helpful and very interesting to talk about New Orleans and LeRichelieu history.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price and parking included!!!”
Reviews.Author: sunshinegirl34230
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay. The room was clean and spacious. The hotel is older and decorations reflect that. The front desk people were super nice and recommended a great place to eat. We were so happy that we were out of the noise of burbon street but still close to everything we wanted to do.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value off the Beaten Path”
Reviews.Author: SoakUpTheEnergy
Reviews.Content: When visiting New Orleans, we usually stay at the JW Marriott on Canal, but decided to try le Richelieu this time based on the great rate and the Trip Advisor reviews. When we got to our room, we were shocked to see we had a full suite--bed, bath, living/dining area, and kitchen. We couldn't believe what we got for the money! Yes, the furnishings are dated, but everything was very clean and the staff was pleasant and helpful. We said, "No wonder Trip Advisor loves this place!" One drawback: The location put us much farther off the beaten path than we prefer; it was a really long walk back to the hotel each night, and we are people who like to walk. On the plus side, however, the location was very quiet. The other thing we didn't like was there was a cold snap when we visited and the heat seemed to be centrally controlled by management and our room never felt comfortably warm enough. We called the desk a couple of times about this, and they assured us the heat was on. We did not have this issue with the air conditioner the first day, however, when it was still warm outside. We could control the thermostat directly in our room. Overall, I don't think we would stay at le Richelieu again due to the location, but the value was truly great and we do recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible value and location”
Reviews.Author: riccar79
Reviews.Content: We lucked out and got an incredible rate from bookit.com on a one-bedroom apt. at Le Richelieu. The mgmt extended the rate for two more days so we stayed a total of 4 days. Parking was included in the rate and the location is excellent. This was an incredible value-there was a restaurant on site for breakfast and lunch and a bar at night for your nightcap. The decor was very dated, and all the furniture antiques, but we did not want the cookie cutter hotel experience. The staff went out of their way to answer all our questions and help us with our requests. We would stay here again in a heartbeat. An incredible value with a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Always a great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Nawlins4LIFE
Reviews.Content: This was the second time my wife and I stayed at the Le Richelieu. Obviously we enjoyed it the first time enough to return a second time. The free parking in a secured parking lot is a great thing. All the staff we have encountered on both our trips have been great. From the bartender, to the room service staff, to the front desk employees everyone was very friendly. Our room was actually not ready when we arrived (no fault of the hotel since we arrived 2 hours prior to check-in) but we enjoyed a cold beverage in the bar. The bar is nice and cozy and is a hangout spot for some locals since the hotel is located on the edge of a residential part of NOLA. We enjoyed a few late night cocktails after retruning from Bourbon Street and could have easily had a fine time hanging out there for the whole night. The Louisiana Pizza Kitchen is right around the corner which is also a big plus since my wife and I really enjoy their food. It is definately quiet and the hotel is maybe in need of updating but my wife and I found that to be very romantic.

Reviews.Title: “Great free parking, but the hotel is a bit of a dump.”
Reviews.Author: ilonajane
Reviews.Content: True French Quarter ambience, but ancient smell, old bathrooms,old furniture. No morning coffee, no daily newspaper. The a/c system left us speechless. It was just too creaky to warrant more than 3 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location. We'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: erzeszut
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have visited New Orleans about 10 times. We've stayed in various hotels, in various neighborhoods -- out in the Garden District, in the Central Business District, on Canal Street, and in the heart of the French Quarter, a block off Bourbon. For this trip, our usual places were booked or crazy expensive, so we ended up at Le Richelieu. Loved that they had free parking, and right on-site. We loved this place. We'd never stayed on the French Market / Marigny end of the quarter before, though a lot of of our favorite spots are down in that direction. Le Richelieu is close enough to the craziness of the French Quarter without being too close. We had a simple, plain room on the top floor (#406). Two double beds, and not much of a view, but we didn't book a room with a view, so no complaints. The place was VERY quiet, the staff VERY friendly, and we wouldn't hesitate to stay there again. We might never stay anywhere else in New Orleans, in fact. Great restaurants within a 5 minute walk of LR include Louisiana Pizza Kitchen, Sukho Thai, and Cafe Envie. It took about 10 minutes to walk to Cafe du Monde / Jackson Square, and about 20 minutes to walk all the way to the Canal Street end of the French Quarter. The Riverfront streetcar stops about two blocks away from LR, and offers a quick and cheap ($1.25) route to Canal Street, Harrah's casino, and the convention center / riverwalk area.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location.”
Reviews.Author: apants
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel and will probably never stay anywhere else when visiting New Orleans. We drove, so we had to find a place with parking - not easy in the quarter! This amazing place has FREE parking in a guarded parking lot. You can't beat that! Also, it's located on the East side of the quarter - close to the marigny neighborhood (frenchman street!). This side of the quarter is my favorite. It's quiet, yet close to the action. You can't beat the staff and the courtyard has a nice pool that was very clean. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “For party people...who enjoy their beauty rest”
Reviews.Author: vermillion66
Reviews.Content: This quintessentially charming hotel met our needs and then some. Stayed over Halloween weekend and were actually able to get some sleep. I recommend room #318, a quiet suite at the end of a hall. Perfect! This suite has everything you'll need for a great time in NOLA. Full size fridge for bevvies, sofa and desk. Free Wifi worked great with password. Separate bedroom with king size bed and flatscreen. Ceiling fans in both rooms. Decent sized bathroom with linen closet. Like you live in New Orleans! Soo much space for a very comfortable stay. Pluses: large walk-in closet in bedroom, windows that open for fresh air, and of course FREE parking and free wifi Minuses: weird musty smell(like many places in the quarter) we bought a $3 candle..problem solved! Kind of an older crowd stays here. Ugly-ish decor. Cafe Envie for a nice coffee in the morning is just next door. French market 1 1/2 blocks, Pravda (a nice quiet bar with a pretty courtyard) 3 blocks,Stanley for breakfast/lunch/dinner 5 blocks at Jackson square I will stay here every time I visit New Orleans!

Reviews.Title: “Le Richelieu is real New Orleans comfort.”
Reviews.Author: pynation
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 4 nights. Loved everything about it. Comfortable rooms, clean bathrooms, etc. Everything you want. My wife is more of a critic than I am and she was very pleased. In fact, we are planning to go back to New Orleans in the Spring and plan on staying at the Le Richelieu. The staff is very friendly. We did not eat at their restaurant but heard good things about it, especially the breakfast. It's several blocks from the crazy part of Bourbon but close enough to walk throughout the French Quarter. A big bonus for New Orleans hotels, free parking. Also, a very nice courtyard and swimming pool. We can highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pluses and minuses balance out”
Reviews.Author: FoggyEthan
Reviews.Content: I'm very mixed on this place. It may be great for some, but it was just OK to me. A quicky on my negatives: * Musty odor. Might trigger some allergies. * Not too much information when I asked about night-time walking tours. * The bed has squeaky springs. * Internet service is absolutely awful. Marginally fast enough to visit web pages slowly. I wouldn't try to upload or stream anything. (For the geeks: speedtest.net says 0.27Mb/s, very few packets dropped) For the positive, the room is very nicely decorated. Not in a fancy or modern way. But the furnishings and decorations are all nicely done. The bathroom has plenty of space. I didn't try the lounge/food. One note about the location: it's about 20 minutes walk to Canal Street. If you expect to head up that way frequently, expect to walk. You can take the riverfront streetcar, but it won't be faster, especially since at Canal Street the river is a few blocks further away. And of course you have to wait for it. Also the Canal Street streetcar doesn't come down to the riverfront, so to connect you have to walk a few blocks.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet hotel & great if traveling with children”
Reviews.Author: jrsmith324
Reviews.Content: This hotel fit our needs well. We were traveling with an infant and didn't want a noisy hotel i the hustle and bustle of the French Quarter. This location was quiet but not far from restaurants, bars, shops, etc. The rooms were very basic but clean. The nicest feature was the free parking adjacent to the hotel. The pool area is nice, too. Staff was great and very friendly. Would recommend for anyone traveling with small children or anyone wanting something quiet yet not off the beaten path. One complaint: we could not get the wireless internet to work, despite being given the supposed username and password. Not a huge deal, but it would have been helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint and charming”
Reviews.Author: Deborah4967
Reviews.Content: Quaint and charming old-world elegance, slightly seedy around the edges, but atmospheric nonetheless, located at the QUIET east end of the French Quarter. Stayed here October 1-3 for a great rate and would return. The room seemed cramped, but the mirrored wall made it seem larger, and the huge walk-in closet also contained the mini-fridge and ironing board with tons' of hanging space. The bathroom is more modern than the room and has a very long tiled counter and mirror wall. The shower is clean and has a good showerhead and non-skid surface. Very easy walk to noisy center of French Quarter and all the hotels that overlook Bourbon Street where the bars never close. Lots of street music nearby, restaurants and shops. Charming center courtyard with patio and pool, and quiet bar on one side. Friendly staff and I never worried about leaving the key at the desk.

Reviews.Title: “Run down and disappointing!”
Reviews.Author: BigFish78
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Le Richelieu in New Orleans for a couple of nights in a weekend in early October. Everything else in the city was all booked up -- so after reading other reviews, thought that this should be an OK place to stay. First impressions - we arrived late on a Saturday evening and the hotel looked historical and charming from the outside, nestled along the far edge of the French Quarter. The lobby was nice, and the check-in went quickly and smooth. I was surprised that the room key, was in fact, an actual key. I wasn't told during check-in, but later found out, that you were supposed to hand the key in at the desk before heading out each day. Obviously this raises some questions with security...and in fact, out of several times handing in the key and getting it back, only once was my name checked against the room records. So it seemed it could have been very easy for anyone to claim my key. Nothing was stolen, but still, it left an uneasy feeling. Aside from the exterior charm and the decent lobby, this hotel is just straight up run-down. The hall floors were just showing their age, looking dirty, and the furniture in the halls was just dinged up and beaten up and again, just showing its age. Not exaclty a charming look on the inside! The common areas need some TLC. Our room was in a word - awful. Updating would go a long way to making the furnishings nicer, although there was a nice newer TV in the room. The carpet was just kind of damp and the room smelled musty and perhaps a bit like mold. The bedspread was dirty and old looking, and although there were no bugs present it wouldn't have been a surprise if there were some. The bathroom, while showing a little bit of updating with newer looking tile, also featured a door that wouldn't stay open without help from a trashcan. Just like the rest of the room, the shower wasn't a place you wanted your bare feet to meet the floor. The positives of this hotel are its location in a quieter part of the Quarter and of course the free parking. The parking lot attendant was friendly and this was a nice feature. Aside from the location and the parking - I would reccomend looking elsewhere for accomodations unless there's nothing else available. Its just rundown and has obviously seen better days.

Reviews.Title: “Great ambience and location”
Reviews.Author: atsm
Reviews.Content: Great room opened onto a common balcony, comfortable bed and clean bathroom. A little old fashioned but I think this is part of the charm and style of New Orleans. Room had both fan and a/c. Some staff were really great and helpful, others less so. They were helpful with tour suggestions and bookings. Hotel is located close to Decatur St and its many great eating places - good value and quality. It is near Faubourg Marigny, so close to Frenchmen St and great jazz bars including dba and Snug Harbour and the Ellis Marsalis trio. Far enough from Bourbon St to be quiet but still close enough to easily walk there. Also it is close enough to walk over to do the Treme walking tour.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, clean, friendly place to stay in French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Marcia4363
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff, clean hotel. Could use some updating. Could not regulate the air conditioning--either off or cold! At the far end of the French Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Le Richelieu Great jump off point for New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: BarryBarnstable
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at Le Richelieu for 2 nights whilst visiting New Orleans. Location : The hotel is in a residential street within the French Quarter, just a few blocks from Jackson square. It's on the outer section of the French Quarter which some may worry is not as safe as the rest of the tourist section but I promise we didn't have any problems nor feel unsafe throughout our time even walking back to the hotel in the evening with a young baby in tow. It's an ideal spot to venture along the amazing streets with Decatur Street being one block away and an ideal starting point. Rooms : Although a small room it was clean and comfortable if a little basic. The price was very reasonable, especially compared to other NOLA hotels and was a major consideration after location for choosing Le Richelieu, providing us with tv, iron, fridge, wifi, air-con and parking (essential for us on our road trip). You don't go to New Orleans to spend much time in the room but ours was pretty good. Staff: Reception staff were very friendly and gave us good advice on places to go, taking the trouble to mark famous spots on one of their maps. Additional : The on site parking was very useful and with no extra fee made the hotel a bargain. We didn't try out the pool but it was a great extra and we did sit around it with a few drinks from the bar during the evening. I would recommend staying in this hotel mainly for the location but also for the quality / price.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff in quiet part of historic French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: BigJon55
Reviews.Content: Hotel rooms are a little dated but cleanliness and attentiveness of staff overshadow any concerns. You will feel welcome like a home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “New Orleans is a Way of Life”
Reviews.Author: Traveler_at_Heart_09
Reviews.Content: I love New Orleans and we enjoyed our stay at Le Richelieu. It was in the perfect location. About a block and a half or so from Decatur and the French Market. We do visit bourbon sometimes (mainly pat-o's), but it is not the only place in the quarter. We would much prefer to spend our visits on the quaints streets of Royal, Chartes & Decatur. We thought the hotel couldn't have been in a better location for the area we wanted to tour. And the parking was free!! That is hard to come by....especially at the great value of this hotel. The service was also excellent and they made sure our stay was comfortable. Thank you Trip Advisor for another win!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, comfortable place”
Reviews.Author: MTI64
Reviews.Content: Le Richelieu is a very pleasant and quiet place to stay if you are looking to stay somewhere in the quarter away from the hustle and bustle. It is on the edge of the French Quarter so it is still within walking distance of all the attractions in the quarter although Canal St. is a bit far if you are interested in walking there. The rooms (at least the one I stayed in) and bathrooms are definitely dated, but they are clean, spacious, and comfortable. The pool area is lovely and there is a little cafe you can eat at with courtyard tables. The staff is very friendly, and willing to help out. This is a great place to stay if you are looking for something nice and comfortable without too many frils or amenities. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and incredible staff!”
Reviews.Author: Flavorchick
Reviews.Content: While the Le Richelieu's rooms are a bit dated, they are flawlessly clean and well-maintained. The staff was wonderful - friendly and helpful. The hotel is a couple of blocks from the Quarter, but very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel and location!”
Reviews.Author: TravelPrincess1982
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my sister for 5 nights at this hotel. It was very enjoyable. The pearks are: the hotels location is perfect. You are in a very attractive location, close to Frenchman St. which has great jazz clubs for tourists and locals, your close to the French Market, St.Louis Cathdral and Jacksons Square, the lakefront street car, and great restaurants and shops. We walked around the whole French Quarter and Uptown such as Magazine St and St.Charles, and when we got back to our hotel, it felt like home. Its got a very home-y feel to it, the staff "Richard" is the most kindest man ever! He will do anything for his guests. My sister and I were having some problems finding a calling card to call home, and he offered to use his cell, which we did, and were very greatful for! Thanks again Richard!! This hotel has a salt water pool which was nice after walking around in the crazy summer august New Orelans heat! The bartender and waiter at the hotel bar/restaurant were super dooper nice all the time. The hotel is clean and some have balconies which was nice. There is really nothing negative about this hotel. We had some loud neighbours one night and that was unpleasant, however, we turned up our air conditioner to block out the noise. The beds and pillows were soo comfortable, I slept like a baby. I fell in love with New Orleans, and if I ever go back, I will stay in the same hotel. Things to do in New Orleans: Eat breakfast one day at "Le Envie" just one block from the hotel Go to: "The Spotted Cat", "DBA" and "BMC" all Jazz clubs were you will enjoy some wicked jazz music and great crowd. Check out Oak St. and the restuarant "Jachi-mos" and order the crab and alligator cheesecake...its an appitizer and it is the BEST thing ive ever eaten. I cant believe how good that was! On Tuesdays "The Maple Leaf" jazz bar/club hosts a famous band, sorry the name escapes me now. Coopes Restaurant on Dacauter St and order the Jalepeno and craper poppers---s ooooo good and I kept getting the Crawfish and Tasso pasta in spicy alfredo sauce and its was yum yum! Le Envie is a cafe and they serve really good breakfast. We took the trolley along the lake Mississipi to Canal and walked around Magazine St. and St .Charles. We took the free farry to the other side of the river. What else can I tell you. Amazing food, people, music, and city. Have fun, be safe and let loose in New Orleans!!

Reviews.Title: “Hidden treasure in the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: fanstevie1
Reviews.Content: This hotel made my trip so much more enjoyable. Free safe parking, close within walking distance to everything and a very helpful and freindly staff. Irenes resturant is only blocks away and has the best food in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Le Richelieu is the best!”
Reviews.Author: CC0rum
Reviews.Content: We have stayed elsewhere in the Vieux Carre before, but none are equal to the experience at Le Richelieu. Salt water pool, excellent staff and the charm of a small independently owned hotel. We used to come to the bar just to see Herman and after visiting him we decided, on our last trip, to stay at the hotel. WHAT A TREAT! Going back next weekend and CANNOT WAIT!!! Love this place!

Reviews.Title: “Oldie but a goodie.”
Reviews.Author: louisjam
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel looking for a spot in the French quarter farther away from Canal Street, where I'd stayed before. This spot was perfect as it is close to the other end of Decatur St. by Frenchman St. where the crowds are a bit thinner, but eateries and drinkeries still abound. Older building, but very well maintained, which is a plus to me. You get a key for your room, that you return to the front desk each time you exit the hotel. AC in public areas and my room were great. This hotel seemed to have AC back when it was still a novelty, but it's still going strong and that's important to me. Small, plush bar stays open till midnight and small breakfast cafe stays open till 2 in the afternoon. Several locals seem to use it regularly for breakfast/brunch. My king bed room was huge with french windows that opened up to the pool. Pool was also old school. Solid construction and nine feet deep at one end. You can have meals served at poolside tables.

Reviews.Title: “The cutest place to stay at a great value right by the heart of New Orleans!”
Reviews.Author: kitkatkrish
Reviews.Content: The hotel is adorable both inside AND outside - the decorations, the furniture, the building, everything! You can stay in a quiet area of NO, while at the same time, have easy access to all the big stuff at an affordable rate! This is a MUST! We will stay here again next time we visit! Oh, and did I mention there is FREE parking?! This is HUGE in NO! My only complaint is a small one, and a common one with hotels, but the towels were too scratchy. Honestly, that is all I would complain about! We loved everything else!

Reviews.Title: “It's a charming and quaint getaway with a wonderful pool & courtyard!”
Reviews.Author: Podsrus2
Reviews.Content: The location is great! The pool and courtyard is wonderful and private...it's like being in your own little world. We enjoyed breakfast each day. The staff is most helpful. We met a lot of interesting people staying there. We loved having our vehicle in the hotel parking lot with a guard. We were happy to have a refrigerator in our room. The rooms were clean. The bed was not comfortable and I will bring my egg carton mattress top when I return. We are coming back next week with our daughter and grandchildren. I had stayed here 26 years ago when my daughter was 10. We stayed a few days before Christmas. It was the first time it had snowed in New Orleans in 100 years!

Reviews.Title: “needs sprucing up”
Reviews.Author: voyageur1058
Reviews.Content: Some badly needed sprucing up could make Le Richelieu a pleasant hotel: it is on a human scale, the reception staff is very helpful, the bedding is comfortable, but the carpets are worn, the bedspeads dark and dull, the general decor gloomy with plastic flowers everywhere, the lights in the bathrooms depressing and amenities are limited to a bare minimum. There is a swimming pool but no bathrobes available nor pool towels. "Continental" Breakfast is not included in the price of the room and it is probably the worst we have ever had: tea or coffee, a glass of juice, the first day one had to choose between a croissant or toast; the second day, for some unknown reason, one could have both for the same charge.

Reviews.Title: “Historic, friendly, clean value in Vieux Carre”
Reviews.Author: livingcolor
Reviews.Content: There are so many great things about Le Richelieu, it's hard to decide where to begin. On the residential side of the Quarter, this hotel has everything a traveler could want: super reasonable rates that include parking, friendly staff, a pool in a charming courtyard, great location and clean rooms. For travelers who like to immerse themselves in a city/culture, this is one great place to lay your head or cool off mid-afternoon. The only thing I considered out of line was the price of breakfast (continental $11.50). But there are so many coffee houses and bakeries within a block or two, it was no big deal. I booked through Expedia and at check-in, saw that fact highlighted several times on my reservation form and they did give us the room right next to the kitchen, but if they meant to punish us, it didn't work. We're all ear-plug wearers! It certainly could have been a coincidence, but I did wonder. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place but No Wi-Fi”
Reviews.Author: Bryan18
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay in this hotel. It is a stone's throw away from Bourbon Street, and has a saltwater pool for those who wish to cool down during a hot summer day! The room is clean and the staff is attentive. We even met the owner of the hotel on several occasions. The best thing about this hotel is the parking and it is totally free! We need to have a car to get around NOLA and visit some friends in Alabama, so parking is of vital importance to us. One slightly dissapointing thing about this hotel is the Wi-fi connection. We stayed on the second floor and could not get the laptop to work even though the staff claimed that there is Wi-fi available on our floor. Other guests have varying degrees in connecting to the network, and some could only connect in the lobby of the hotel... We have to go to a local cafe (2 minutes walk) to connect to the cafe's Wi-fi; so that was not a big deal. Other than that, this is a good hotel to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, but no frills!”
Reviews.Author: melindabmauney
Reviews.Content: We were looking for somewhere decent to lay our heads and save a buck or two! This met both of our standards. It is an old property, but has the charm and quaintness you'd expect of the French Quarter in NOLA! We loved it. It had a little eating place inside and an outdoor pool. The parking was a little difficult at night, but the staff worked with us our first night because we got in so late. It is a "guarded" parking lot. The guard was nowhere to be found when we got there! Again, front desk staff addressed this for us! We really liked it there....no complaints except for parking. Relatively inexpensive and within walking distance of Bourbon St., the Riverfront street car that can take you to Canal St. (or you can walk if you are more fit than I!). Not bad overall. I'd recommend it to most, except for those with children or those looking for 5-star accomodations..you won't get it there. You will get a clean, comfortable place to lay your head with some history and charm of New Orleans!

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel, Great Location, Impeccable Service”
Reviews.Author: Pomsr
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at The Le Richelieu, and it is now our hotel of choice in the French Quarter. Being at the corner of Chartres St. and Barracks St., it is in a more residential and quiet section of the Quarter. But it is still very close to great food and fun. We attend a French Quarter festival every year (actually three festivals in one: Cajun-Zydeco/Seafood/Creole Tomato), and in three out of the past four years, including this year, the Festival activities are centered around the Old Mint and the French Market. The Le Richelieu is perfectly situated any activity in this location. There are also great restaurants within a couple of blocks of the hotel I can particularly suggest Cafe Envie for breakfast and El Gato Negro for Mexican Food (wonderful, fresh ingredients and amazing Mojitos). Any old hotel in the Quarter is going to be a bit disheveled (that's part of the charm), but the Le Richelieu is cleaner and much better kept than any other I've experienced. The free, self-parking is also a MAJOR plus because most French Quarter hotels charge up to $35 to park, and you do not have immediate access to your car. But the best aspect of our stay was ,without a doubt, the friendly attentive service. Everyone was friendly. Everyone wanted to help. Everyone had time to visit and help no matter what the issue. The service was truly impeccable. We've tried other French Quarter hotels, but this one is definitely our new favorite. I can't imagine staying anywhere else for a quality French Quarter experience.

Reviews.Title: “This is our favorite hotel in NO!”
Reviews.Author: istvanberkeley
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here often and love the place. The free parking saves $35 per night. The staff are wonderful. The location cannot be beaten. Ask for a room with a balcony! It is a perfect place to sit and unwind in the evening. Sure, it is not the most up to date, but this place has real charm. Check the managers office to see all the famous people who have stayed too.

Reviews.Title: “Really fun place to stay”
Reviews.Author: whizweez
Reviews.Content: This is not the most glamorous hotel but has a lot going for it, especially the very friendly and knowledgeable staff. We stayed in a suite, which was spacious and comfortable. Nothing is new and techno friendly, but it was cute and funky. The TV's are old, but slowly being replaced, so says the owner, but in a way add to the charm. The bed's are comfortable, the bathrooms are adequate, and they have a cute swimming pool, a little cafe with a very good breakfast and parking in the French Quarter. The hotel is in the quieter end of the French Quarter, but within easy walking distance of most spots and there's a cab stand out front. Don't think you're going to the Ritz, but this was fun and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel personifies the heart and soul of New Orleans”
