Reviews.Author: cysam
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a true New Orleans French Quarter experience, this hotel fits the bill. Absolutely charming with the most delightful staff. Everyone there was helpful and friendly. Parking is available. Our room was old fashioned comfortable with the most wonderful king sized bed I have ever slept in. There is a bar on-site and a little bistro type restaurant that serves breakfast and lunch all day. The food was delicious and prices for both are very reasonable. We were with friends who typically stay in pricey,upscale hotels. The four of us agreed that we would definitely rate this hotel at the top of our list and would come back. If you are looking for a modern, technology enhanced, flat screen tv type of place, this is not it although they do offer free Wifi. If you're looking for a hotel that makes you feel like you're family and does everything they can to make your stay special, this is it. Truly a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Second Stay...probably last stay”
Reviews.Author: sighwest
Reviews.Content: It's just too blame hot in this hotel. A/C is not up to date enough to handle the outside heat. I don't like sweating in the hotel room. The room just wasn't comfortable this second time we stayed. The first time was back in January and it was a little warm in the room then. Still love the 1PM checkout though, and wonderful staff......and FREE Parking!! Bed was much more comfortable the second stay! Note: There was no placard in the elevator showing the last inspection date. What's up with that??

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place to Stay in French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Humphryg
Reviews.Content: The room was specious and clean but not super modern. The location was in the quiet portion of the French Quarter, away from the parties but close enough to walk everywhere, every front desk person was helpful and knowledgable regarding places to eat and other attractions. Enjoyed our visit. Would recommend the hotel. Best part...free parking. I basically parked the car when we got there and left it there for 2 days while we walked the French Quarter and toured the entire city.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, not so great hotel”
Reviews.Author: curlygirl91
Reviews.Content: First, the pros. Great location near Frenchman St and Jackson Square. Friendly staff. Free parking. Liked the balcony and the fridge. Pool seemed nice (never used it). Love the ceiling fan. However, the rooms were very dated and smelled musty. (When I got home, all of my clothes smelled musty) The decor desperately needs updating. What is the purpose of having a nonworking stove in the room? The plastic plants have to go. How about some new bedspreads and updating the bathroom and air conditioner? The TV was from 1984 (we checked). Granted, no one goes to New Orleans to spend all day in the room, but this was our 6th trip to NOLA and my least favorite hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Our Second stay”
Reviews.Author: Playswdogs
Reviews.Content: Our second stay was as good as the first. Great location, reasonably priced, free parking on site. This is a historic hotel, and that comes with a few quirks - but we were quite happy with our stay. We will be back on our next trip to NOLA.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely. Great Staff.”
Reviews.Author: IheartNO
Reviews.Content: After reading a few negative comments about this place I felt the need to comment. My partner and I visited NO in June, 2009. We had a lovely time. First, our flights were delayed and we did not check in until 12:30 at night. An elderly man named Connie was at reception and checked us in no problem. The room was clean and has a quiet, working air conditioner. Also, one of the best arts about the hotel and our room was the communal balcony. The balcony surrounds almost the entire building and is accessible through almost each room. *Make sure you request the balcony. We met nice people and shared drinks, stories and advice about the tours (swamp tour is a must). The hotel was so helpful, we left every single person a tip upon our departure. Because every person working there was literally that helpful. They booked our tours, and restaurant reservations and called cabs for us. The pool was also nice, however the most shallow point is just under 5 feet...so if bringing children you may want to consider a floating device. Next, about the decor...yes this place might not be your luxurious Hilton, or Radisson...but I did not find the wall to be paint chipped or with droopy wallpaper. It is an older hotel in which I find gives a place character. The location of the hotel was great and it was quiet...even with the communal balcony(I'm a light sleeper too). The rooms were cleaned daily. The TV worked great..not a HDTV so a bit dated yes...but reception was clear and honestly who goes to NO to watch TV. I have not stayed at other hotels in NO as I have only been the once, but my partner and I are planning our next visit next summer and would not stay anywhere else. Also, they have a safe at reception for valuables (if needed) but they do require you to leave your key at reception each time you leave. I actually like this because then you dont have to worry about losing or forgetting your key. Also, Bourbon street has cheap drinks but I found it to be quite trashy and only stayed on the street for 10 mins of our entire vacation. Where it IS at is Frenchman street. Where a nice Live Jazz bars are (no food) and pleasant people. Safe to walk at night. Also, NOLA the restaurant was pricey but worth it if you like fine cuisine. Best restaurant both my partner and I have ever eaten at. Hope this helps! Enjoy your time in New Orleans!

Reviews.Title: “French Quarter ambience in a quiet locale at a good price”
Reviews.Author: ardentadventurer
Reviews.Content: We traveled to New Orleans for a wedding in March and chose Le Richelieu based on Trip Advisor comments. We were not disappointed! Hotels in the Quarter tend to be very pricey, so this was a special find. We liked that it was a few blocks away from the heart of the busiest area, so the streets were quieter (especially in the evening). Yet it was an easy walk to the French Market, the riverfront, Canal Street and the Faubourg-Marigny district, full of inviting nightclubs and cafes. And there is a great coffee house, EnVie, half a block away. Our room overlooked the interior courtyard and pool. It was fine for our needs, though we would have liked two queen beds, rather than two doubles. The bathroom could use an overhaul -- it was pretty dated -- but functional and very clean. The free wi-fi in our room was very temperamental: at best, it was slow; at worst, it just didn't work for moments on end. The front desk staff was friendly and helpful, however, ready with maps and directions restaurant suggestions. A great added bonus is that this the ONLY hotel in the French Quarter that has free parking. This was another draw for us in choosing to stay here, since we drove to New Orleans on a road trip. I would have been reluctant to pay $20-25 a night for valet parking at another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience everytime”
Reviews.Author: lazarodp
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel several times. We love the quietness, away from the mob on Bourbon St. Walking distance to all the antique and art shops on Chartres and Royal streets. St. Louis Sq etc. The owner lives on the premises so it is well kept and the staff is very friendly. Free parking a nice bonus. The last time, we stayed in the Paul McCartney suite and the matress is a lot better than in some of the regular suites and standard rooms where we previously stayed. Worth the extra $'s.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable room quiet location near everything.”
Reviews.Author: jbsunlvr
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights over a weekend. The room was spacious, the bed was comfortable but the pillows were not to our liking. Free wifi and parking for the car which is nice as everywhere you could park a car seemed to charge. We did not eat or drink at the hotel so have no opinion as to that. The standard hotel amenities are provided. The bathroom could use some renovating. We were on the fourth floor and the view of the surrounding neighborhood was nice. It has a quirky system where you drop the key off at the front desk each time you leave. It added to the hotels unique appeal. It has a small pool in back but we did not see any one in it. We got a good price and it was a unique experience and great visit to New Orleans and I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Le Richelieu/French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: RussYoung
Reviews.Content: Old hotel with old New Orleans feel. Hotel was in good repair with free private courtyard parking which is a huge plus. Room had small balcony, basic cable and was clean. Small outdoor pool, small restaurant/bar. About 12 blocks from the heart of Bourban St. Room was reasonably priced. Would stay there again during the colder times of the year, the A/C was extremely inadequate for summer months.

Reviews.Title: “Grimy, shabby and poor value”
Reviews.Author: WorldloverSantaFe
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Le Richelieu for 4 nights in February, 2010 and I have to say that it's been a long time since I've stayed in a hotel that is as run down and grimy as this one. Generally, I prefer staying in locally owned hotels, but this one was very disappointing. It desparately needs some paint touch up or at least a good wash of woodwork; new carpeting in public areas and carpets cleaned in rooms, deep cleaning of bathroom tiles and blankets and bedspreads that aren't decades-old pilled polyester. I have to assume that the owner has been caught in a double-whammy of a the Katrina tragedy and the awful economy, but that doesn't excuse the layers of grime, peeling wallpaper and leftover hair in the bathroom, and the room prices were too high for the lack of quality. The staff are nice and helpful. That is a plus, but I have to say that everywhere we went in the city, people were friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Good place”
Reviews.Author: travelseeker
Reviews.Content: Stayed here because we drove and wanted the free parking. The room surpassed my cleanliness standard. The ceiling fan was dust free! Which, without the ceiling fan on, it did get stuffy in the room on the 4th floor (and that was with very cold temperatures the first week in Feb.). I liked the old school blue tiled bathroom. Turning in and collecting the key wasn't as big of a hassle as I thought it would be. It was actually nice to not have to worry about. Location was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Marjo210
Reviews.Content: Calm area near everything in the french quarter. Friendly and helpful staff. Convinient restorant and bar in the hotel. Bed was so confortable. Just perfect for people that wants nice vacations in New Orleans whitout the party scene.

Reviews.Title: “New Orleans Charm”
Reviews.Author: landesign
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to New Orleans and we booked Hotel Le Richelieu for 3 nights and stayed 5. We found the hotel very charming in an excellent location in a quiet part of the French Quarter. We walked everywhere - Bourbon Street, Frenchmen's Street (which we preferred), the French Quarter, even the WWII Museum. We had a suit and thought it was very elegant. Some of the decore is from the 50's and 60's, like the compelely turquois kitchen, but we thought it was charming. Huge bathroom, huge walk-in closet, and we didn't use the kitchen. Our room overlooked the lovely pool. The staff was very friendly and accomodating. The small bar was nice and we had breakfast there once and it was good and didn't think it was over priced for New Orleans. It was great having the free parking. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT hotel for a French Quarter get-away!”
Reviews.Author: DTFISHER55
Reviews.Content: Wonderful, charming, and quaint hotel. Paid the extra little bit to have a one bedroom suite with a balcony....totally worth it!!!!! You will not hear Bourbon St...yet you are able to walk there, Cafe Du Monde, really anywhere in the French Quarter. We absolutely loved the friendliness of the hotel staff. The hotel is old, but feels very Victorian....and absolutely perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Outdated and Needs Upgrading”
Reviews.Author: lynettez50
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 8 nights in a suite. We have been to this hotel several times over the last 18 years. The good news is it is located in a quiet neighborhood with free parking. The bad news is that nothing has improved or really changed since our first visit. The furniture is the exact same except showing even more scratches and dents over the years. The tv was so old school we couldn't believe it worked. (We're talking floor model in a wooden framed Magnavox!) The elevators which had a very stuffy smell sometimes hesitated between floors. Although we were staying in a suite w/ a kitchen there were NO utensils - not even a coffeepot or a microwave. (We went out to Walmart and actually bought our own microwave to use for the week.) The stove was blocked off so it couldn't be used. The original tiling decorated botht he kitchen and bath. (Don't get me started about the bath! The old shower had no pressure AND the knob actually fell off in my hand while I was turning it on.) When we were making our reservations, I called the hotel directly and they did match the best price I found on the web. Otherwise I could have paid 25 bucks more pernight for this really weird experience. My husband and I called the place "The Shining 2".

Reviews.Title: “Not much on amenities but big on service”
Reviews.Author: LazyLeo
Reviews.Content: If you are one of those people who like to spend time in your room, you're probably not going to enjoy this hotel. The TV only has 4 or 5 channels and is circa 1970 and the rooms aren't trendy or modern or pretty. However, the rooms are clean, the beds are comfy, they have a small bar/dining area onsite and the staff is wonderful AND they have free parking. It is also just far enough from Bourbon Street mayhem that you can get a good night's sleep without feeling like you're too far from the action. Now that I've found this place, I'll be back again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Dated”
Reviews.Author: artichoker
Reviews.Content: This hotel's decor is extremely dated. Pinkish beige bathroom with worn out tiles, 1965 bed spread, red carpet, big wooden armoir with a 1990 tube TV. The hotel is in a good location. The room had a surprising amount of storage space with two closets and a cabinet. Unless you find 70's fake wood charming you won't like this place.

Reviews.Title: “This is New Orleans!”
Reviews.Author: twotrav
Reviews.Content: We loved Le Richeliu! It is a lovely older hotel with large rooms that are clean and well maintained. It is located in a quiet neighborhood away from all the hustle and bustle but within easy walking distance of all the attractions. The price was very resonable and they offer free parking. This is hotel was a real gem!

Reviews.Title: “Le Richelieu is a great deal and a lot of fun”
Reviews.Author: rnjones
Reviews.Content: We would totally stay here again. I'm from Louisiana and have been to New Orleans numerous times and stayed at a wide variety of places. Even though Le Richelieu is by no means fancy, it is definitely quaint and charming. It had a very European feel to it. Our bed was extremely comfy as well. But the overall best thing about the hotel is the parking: you don't have to pay and the lot is right behind the hotel. You park yourself and don't have to bother with a valet. That makes it great if you have your car and are traveling out of the Quarter during your stay. So. . . if you are an "old house" person and like that sort of thing Le Richelieu is definitely for you. You won't see granite in the bathroom with a fancy tub and shower -- it is like staying with your grannie. We loved it - tons of atmosphere!

Reviews.Title: “A great small hotel”
Reviews.Author: MadisonMan
Reviews.Content: It's perfect. We had a clean, spacious, quiet , comfortable room with one queen bed. We drove right to it and parked in their self-park lot with no hassle. The hotel is in the quiet part of the French Quarter, safe yet convenient for seeing all the sights. Now we know why the McCartneys stayed here for several weeks even though they could afford more luxury.

Reviews.Title: “10 great days of pure, New Orleans hospitality while at Le Richelieu.”
Reviews.Author: Meg_Z_73
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 10 days in June 2009 (extremely hot!) for our wedding, and loved every minute of it! We used to live in New Orleans, so we had an idea of what we were looking for, but had never stayed in a hotel in the French Quarter before. It was right before Essence Fest, so the hotel was at capacity the entire time we were there, but it wasn't a problem. We had a great room (on the second floor, overlooking the pool/courtyard with a balcony!) with a comfortable king-sized bed. I broke part of my back 2 years ago, and thought the beds the most comfortable I have yet to find. If you're looking for a hotel with personality that is a bit older, more experienced, and very in tune with what people want/need when they travel to New Orleans, this is the hotel for you. If you're looking for brand new, top of the line modern furnishings, then this hotel is not for you. Oh, I think this is the only hotel in the French Quarter that offers free parking to hotel guests. And by free, I mean FREE. It's a self-serve lot (with a security guard to monitor and make sure you're actually staying at the hotel), so you don't have to tip, etc. And, it's on the quieter end of the FQ (by Esplanade), so it's EXTREMELY easy to get in/out of the French Quarter. A true gem!

Reviews.Title: “French Quarter/Parking FREE!”
Reviews.Author: lizardwitch
Reviews.Content: Booked thru Expedia + from hotel diagram, thought we would be on second flr..were on the 4th. Had read review and it said rms on 4th were small..true enough, BUT, for 2 people just fine. There's fridge in room, really comfy bed, nicely decorated/clean. Best part was the french type window that opened + you can gaze down Chartres or see the skyline..very Paris garret type room. Romantic, you feel like you are the only ones up that high because yr above adjacent balconies. Easy walking to cafes/French mkt..everywhere in the quarter. Staff very helpful, free parking which is a huge deal if yr driving to NOLA. Totally safe walking the streets, neighborhood "feel" to it all. Just use common sense. Recommend Acme Oyster House . Masperos has the best muffaletta not Central Groc on Decatur..sand w/fries only $8. and there must be a lb of meat on it..easy 2 person meal. Tujagues, too expensive and the menu is a set 5 courses..waiter seemed a bit condescending..guess that explains the tip he got from us!

Reviews.Title: “Still the best in the Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Michelle032
Reviews.Content: This find in the Quarter continues to delight after 7 visits over 10 years. It's old-school and a bit creaky, literally, though clean as a whistle. The plumbing isn't exactly le dernier cri, but I wouldn't trade it for any other. It's located in a quiet spot of the Quarter yet everything is walkable (and walking in the French Quarter is the way to savor it). The owner and staff are low-key yet eminently helpful and really seem to enjoy their jobs. There's a little bar off the lobby, a spot for breakfast (but head to the French bakery on Ursulines 2 blocks away for a real treat) and a small pool with patio seating. But the greatest amenity of all is free self-parking in the attached lot. This is the kind of hotel I imagine was once the norm and can't think of a better place to help you "go back in time" in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “You'll love the Richlieu”
Reviews.Author: B0urnem0uthTraveller
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from our third stay at the Richlieu. This hotel is in excellent location, within walking distance of everything in the French Quarter, but far enough away from Bourbon Street that you can get a good night's sleep. Nice Rooms (very New Orleans), friendly service, free parking, excellent rates. The breakfast is a bit pricey, but eveything else is such good value you can forgive that. But of course, you really want to go to Cafe du Monde for your beignets for breakfast anyway. Super hotel, very friendly staff. Ask for a room with a balcony, they do not charge extra and are so very New Orleans. Hotel is also just round the corner from the Palm Court Jazz Cafe where you must go for dinner and fantastic jazz. Go out the back door and you'll be there in 90 seconds. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for the most part.”
Reviews.Author: Desmond13
Reviews.Content: This hotel was nice - especially compared with some in the quarter. It was clean and cool and had hot water. The staff was friendly and helpful plus there was a mini-fridge. Here are some of the downsides in my mind: no in-room coffe pot and no complimentary breakfast. If you want coffee before you leave in the morning, prepare to pay. Also, it is off the beaten track. You aren't especially close to anything. If you're looking for a quiet nook, this is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Would not hesitate to stay again”
Reviews.Author: skippy929
Reviews.Content: Quaint older hotel. Super friendly staff. Bartender really knows how to make a drink. Will stay here again next time we are in New Orleans. FREE PARKING

Reviews.Title: “Best value and hotel in French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: soflabiztraveller
Reviews.Content: You can't go wrong with Le Richelieu. It's close to everything but far enough away so that you can get a good night's sleep. It's safe and it's easy to walk to and from the quarter. You're close to Jackson Square, Bourbon, Royal, etc. Yes it is an older hotel that probably could use an update and yes there is an "old house" smell going on when you walk inside, but that's all part of the charm. Also, keep in mind that those updates cost big bucks. There are three great things about Le Richelieu: (1) The prices are the lowest in the French Quarter for a full service hotel. (2) Free self parking--no other hotel offers free parking where you can get to your car whenever you like. (3) It's safe. Another good thing about the hotel is the small restaurant and bar--if you don't feel like going out. But, you're in New Orleans -- you should go out and enjoy yourself. Also, it was good to see that New Orleans is getting back on its feet. There's a long way to go, but that old spirit is back and, come hell or high water, they will survive.

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST IN THE QUARTER”
Reviews.Author: magicaliam
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here many times - Know New Orleans very well. New Orleans, orginally, was our home. We've never had a room we didn't like. Of all the choices for hotels - this is our 1st choice. Most of the staff has been employed here over 30 years and are like family. There is a feel of being home and no request is ever ignored. I can not imagine staying anywhere else! As for any comments negatives, I can not think of even 1....unless you want to be on Bourbon street (which I love to make the few block walk to) - but then you don't get the REAL New Orleans feel ...You get Disneyworld made-up to look like New Orleans. Believe me - THIS IS THE FINEST!

Reviews.Title: “perfect balance of charm and southern hospitality”
Reviews.Author: rfs1234
Reviews.Content: This hotel was charming. The pictures do not do it justice. The rooms are quaint, but spotless and they don't have the sterile feel of a chain hotel. The staff is wonderful - helpful, polite and just pleasant to be around. The pool is small, but quiet and lovely. It is in a perfect location - it is in walking distance to everything you want to walk to, but you can avoid the craziness of burbon street if it's not your thing. If it is, it's a 7 minute walk. We had an amazing room on the corner with two balconies, and were so happy with our stay there.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in the quarter”
Reviews.Author: LONN21
Reviews.Content: 2nd visit to new orleans, first at this hotel, staff were excellent, knowledgable and quite polite, rooms were excellent and the salt water pool was the perfect way to end a hectic day. you could not pick a better place to stay, close enough to everything, far enough away for some peace and quiet. if you see Mr. frank tell him i forgot to get that paul mccartney picture from him and could he please mail it to me

Reviews.Title: “Going to visit new Orleans, why not stay in it?”
Reviews.Author: gopsu8427
Reviews.Content: The Le Richelieu is an amazing place, top to bottom. Aside from the free parking, which is the hotel's biggest draw (they're the only one in the Quarter,) the hotel is European designed, old-looking and classy; and located only blocks from the most popular tourist attractions, such as Cafe du Monde, and the infamous Bourbon Street. This hotel is also very welcome to smokers, as the hallways and even lobby have antique ashtrays. Very knowledgeable and helpful staff, can answer any questions about the city. *Note* Not for anyone who can't entertain themselves. The room's are large but have only a small very old TV with about 20 channels. Get out and experience! If you don't know where to start, there's always Fiorella's on Decatur, in the Quarter. Best homemade (literally, expect to wait 20-30 mins for everything) fried chicken and gumbo, period.

Reviews.Title: “Juste - (Fr - Just right)”
Reviews.Author: larryklefevre
Reviews.Content: Friendly. Helpful. Relaxed. All this with the only free parking hotel in the area. On the edge of the quarter but close enough. Come stay for a nice visit with the owner setting at the bar. Not 2009 new but rooms look fresh. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, free parking”
Reviews.Author: FiveAlive
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in lots of hotels in New Orleans, and I found that this one was the best location and deal for me so far. It's on a quiet residential section of Chartres Street. It's within quick walking distance of Bourbon Street, if you want to go wild. Your even closer to the slightly more laid back bars on Decatur and Frenchmen Street. The front desk was great. Make sure to ask how to get to Verti Mart (just around the corner) to stock your fridge up with delicious sandwiches and drinks for the time you'll be spending in your hotel room recovering or hiding from the heat. Yes, the decor is bordering on hilariously old-fashioned. I think the TV was older than me. But, that's the norm in New Orleans. Most importantly, the staff is nice, and the room was very clean. (Those things can't be taken for granted at this price in N.O.) The price of the room, FREE parking, and location are unbeatable. Plus, there is a pool, room service, and free WiFi. The hotel's tiny bar was a fun place to start the night and talk to people.

Reviews.Title: “Waste of money”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravel329
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel because of the "free, secure parking" and also because we read it had won a few awards for being the best value for the money. I disagree! Although the staff was friendly, the rooms were gross. When we walked in, the toilet was running....and as we later found out, didn't flush too well. The room appeared dirty and very old. When I took a shower later that evening, I found myself standing ankle deep in water which I found disguisting! Like I said before, we stayed here because the front desk said the parking was free, secure and guarded at night. I am sure you can imagine my surprise when I walked by and saw the guard on duty sleeping in the guard booth. Spend the extra money and stay somewhere cleaner.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel-lots of charm”
Reviews.Author: Mickeym0use
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Le Richelieu for 5 days. We really enjoyed it. It has a lot of old world charm and personality. The lobby is very cool- something that looks like it could be in a movie. The pool was refreshing. The room was a very nice size. There was a refigerator in the room, as well. We got a balcony room which was great for picture taking. The hotel was in a perfect location for all things to do in the French Quarter. It was perfectly situated for Frenchmen Street, as well as Boubon Street ( in a nice quieter area). The staff was extremely accommating and friendly! It is an older hotel, but it definitely added to our wonderful New Orleans experience. We would definitely go back to Le Richelieu.

Reviews.Title: “Clean with New Orleans Charm”
Reviews.Author: pkleez
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for sleek new modern rooms this is not the place for you! If you want "old New Orleans" charm this is a great place to sty. The room was extremely clean. The lobby has a funcky smell (probably old smoke) but the room had no smell. We had a suite that was huge by todays hotel standards (room 317). There was a kitchen with all turquoise appliances (the stove is disconnected), a sitting room with a small balcony looking over the parking lot, a large bathroom (again with the turquoise), and a bedroom with a really comfy bed. The closet was huge! The cleaning crew were really nice. You have to leave your key at the desk everytime you leave the hotel but it was no problem. The only issue is it would get hot if you open the curtains. New Orleans in June is HOT! and the hotel is old so that was expected. With the ceiling fans running we were comfortable. The courtyard is small but adequate. The pool was nice. If you stay here go in the bar and get a planters punch. The bartender makes killer drinks to enjoy in the bar or in the pool. One big plus is the on site parking. The lot was guarded by security who checked on anyone in the lot. I know this because I watched from the balcony!

Reviews.Title: “Best Value, Location in the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Rheavon
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay in Le Richelieu - the first being in 2001 when I was a young girl travelling with her father. I decided to try it again with my boyfriend for our romantic vacation to New Orleans. We were not disappointed! Reservations and Check in: We reserved the hotel room online on the hotel's web site. Take advantage of their package deals. We got a sweet deal where we booked 3 nights and got the 4th free. We also got two free drink coupons for the bar, and two free breakfasts (one for each person). With this fourth night, it was the cheapest deal in the Quarter. Check in was prompt and we were given the key to our room. Their key system is old-fashioned and pretty European in the sense that you have to turn your key into the desk when you head out - I liked it. The Room: We were in a room right next to the elevators, but we wouldn't have even known it. Our room was a king room with a window facing the courtyard area (though the view was a wall, but we weren't there for the view). The bathroom and bedroom were both spacious and there was a bonus large walk-in closet! The walk-in had a fridge. The bathroom had a linen closet. Overall, it definitely exceeded our needs. However, I must warn you if you are one who demands the newest, hippest decor. The decor is definitely dated, but it added coziness to the room. Also, the TV had a very limited number of channels. However, the internet was complimentary and the parking is FREE! Service: The staff is absolutely fantastic. The housekeeping staff kept the room clean and even called us to see if we needed anything on the days we decided to sleep later. The desk staff were great and knowledgable and called us a cab when we needed them. They are very knowledgable about the area. The cafe staff were very friendly and we were totally comfortable when enjoying our delicious breakfast! Location: I like the location a lot because it is on the edge of the French Quarter, nice and removed from noisier parts of the Quarter (Bourbon, etc). However, it was only a few blocks (3-4) from just about everything. It is also very easy to get to as it is close to Esplanade (a 2-way street). Again, you can't beat the free on-site parking. Many other hotels in the Quarter charge $30 a night to park. You can't beat this hotel! Also, take a look inside your room's desk for postcards from the hotel. I found them while I was looking for a pen and they are so adorable I had to send one!

Reviews.Title: “Another enjoyable stay at Le Richelieu.”
Reviews.Author: Lawndog
Reviews.Content: This is our favorite hotel in NO. It's comfortable, quiet, convenient, super-clean, and has free parking. The rates are reasonable, the staff is friendly and helpful, the food is good, and the drinks are generous. What more could one want? If you're looking for luxury, look elsewhere. If it bothers you that the bathrooms are dated, that the faucet might drip a little, or that you have to leave your room key at the front desk, this isn't the place for you. However, if you're looking for charm and local color and don't mind a few quirks, by all means try Le Richelieu.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Jill A
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Le Richelieu for a long weekend with friends in May 2009. We are childless couples in our mid-thirties. While it's true that some updating could be done, the hotel has great charm which makes up for that. The location can't be beat- close enough to walk to everything within the French Quarter, the Riverwalk, Cafe Du Monde, Royal Street, Bourbon, as well as the jazz bars in the Frenchman Street area. Yet it was in a quiet and safe area so you could relax once you return to your room. Many people loved the rare on-site parking, although we didn't use it. We didn't eat at the on-site cafe, but it was busy every morning. The staff was professional and helpful. The room had it's own balcony and was clean and tidy. The A/C worked and there was a ceiling fan as well. The TV had very few channels but that did not bother us because we are there to vacation, not watch TV. The pool and courtyard area were clean and charming. The negative: bathroom was in dire need of rennovation/updating- the floors were sloping, walls crooked, and there were some mold spots on the ceiling, but otherwise clean enough and in working order. Would I reccomend this hotel to my most selective friends with the highest of standards? Probably not, but for the rest of us, this place was a great value, great location, clean, quiet, friendly, and charming. I'd certainly stay again, and I say go for it!

Reviews.Title: “Affordably booked through travelocity”
Reviews.Author: boocrews
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in this great hotel. Our room 211 was exceptionally clean. The mattress was in good condition and very comfortable. The furnishings were very nice and the ceiling fan was a welcome addition not normally found in a hotel. The bathroom has not been updated as stated in other reviews but it was a large full size bathroom. Not a toilet and a tub shoved in a closet sized hole. I, personally, prefer CLEAN over updated any day and this bathroom was clean. No mold in sight. Also, ample towels etc were provided along with extra blanket and pillows. Housekeeping was extremely friendly and greeted us every morning as we passed in the hall. Front desk staff was friendly (yes, turning in the key every time was a pain but safety first). WiFi was very spotty. If you're planning on working in your room.... rethink it. We did eventually get on, lost it the second night and reconnected the next night. We basically were using it to find points of interest etc. The main selling point for this hotel was the FREE parking. This is unheard of. Previous hotel charged $25 a night. That adds a considerable amonut to the bill over three nights. Le Richelieu has a private lot with SECURITY provided and they don't charge their guests for the parking space. They also kindly let you park if you arrive before check in time. We work hard to make a living and don't have money to blow. We definately recommend Le Richelieu. It's safe, clean, quiet and I did not feel like I had wasted my money. BTW, we also found the air conditioning rattled if turned up high. We solved the problem by turning the air to 4 or lower and running the ceiling fan at night. Worked well for us.

Reviews.Title: “Le Richelieu has tons of French Quarter charm!”
Reviews.Author: ramonaQ
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a four night girls trip at Le Richelieu and it was fantastic. I will start out by saying that I am from NYC and am picky and sometimes high maintenance :) but for my first trip to NOLA I didn't want to stay at a cookie cutter luxury hotel (apologies to the W and both Omnis), I really wanted to stay at a place with true character and history and Le Richelieu delivered. My friend and I stayed on the 4th floor (top floor) in room 410 with two double beds. It was small but truthfully W hotel rooms are the same size or maybe smaller, so it didnâ€™t bother us. The room was absolutely spotless the entire visit and we left housekeeping a nice tip as a result (not something I always do). Some of the other reviews are correct, though, the bathroom was straight up outdated and needed a complete overhaul, HOWEVER the bathroom, tub included, was immaculate. The beds were completely fine but if you're a pillow snob or require a special pillow, bring your own, they weren't great. The policy of dropping off your key every time you leave the hotel seemed weird to me until I found out that NOLA is the missing persons capital of the world and the key policy helps ensure your safety. Definitely a great thing for two girls traveling alone. The key return policy also led us to Le Richelieu's GREATEST asset: Becky at the front desk. I have traveled quite a bit and have never encountered a sweeter, more helpful and charming front desk person. Becky booked tours for us, checked in to make sure we were having fun, gave us restaurant recommendations and sometimes just cracked us up. She's a native and her adorable accent alone is the worth introducing yourself. We are planning on taking our guys back for a long weekend in the Fall and will definitely be staying at Le Richelieu again! On a foodie note, I have a few restaurant recommendations: Dinner at Herbsaint in the warehouse district was fantastic! Dinner at Bayona was like an A- but a great atmosphere, Napoleon House has a fantastic Pimm's Cup (their signature cocktail) and muffeletta sandwich, and Magnolia Grill is the PERFECT breakfast spot. CafÃ© Du Monde has long lines an dis the Magnolia Bakery equivalent of NYC, but worth stopping by once if you have time. Avoid: Commander's Palace unless you like seriously outdated "old people food"...in a word, it was gross. Make sure if you want gumbo you go to the Gumbo Shop and NOT the Old Coffee Pot down the street (we learned the hard way) and Stella is completely overpriced (dinner for two was over $200) and maybe a B at best. Maybe. Stuff to do: Frenchman Street (walking distance from Le Richelieu) will delight and amaze with the quality and variety of music clubs. Our walking tour through the garden district was beautiful, the caretaker's tour of Lafayette Cemetery was super informative and the Vampire tour (ask for Jonathan with the long hair from Haunted History Tours) was at night and will thoroughly entertain and probably freak you out a little bit! We tried to avoid tourist traps and did so quite easily and ended up 2 out of the 4 nights at Jean Lafitteâ€™s Blacksmith Bar sitting at the piano bar listening to great music by candlelight. Itâ€™s my new favorite bar ever :) Hope all this helps!

Reviews.Title: “Gross! It looks like Ron Jeremy slept here. This place is colonial crap-ola!”
Reviews.Author: jennc55
Reviews.Content: Beautiful lobby, great location, HORRIBLE rooms! They're clean but a little dated. The mattress is thin and slopes in the middle. The TV has comes complete with wood paneling. The walls are mirrored and the bathroom looks like something from your grandmother's house.

Reviews.Title: “We would stay again”
Reviews.Author: sulli_nc
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research before booking this hotel. I was a little wary because I had read some bad reviews but we would stay here again. Yes it's an old hotel to be sure so if you want a slick modern hotel this is not for you. They still use a real key...which is probably why you have to leave it at the desk each time you leave. The bed and pillows were very comfortable, the room was clean, and the bathroom was definitely dated but in good shape and very clean. The air conditioner in the room was a little on the noisy side but not any worse than any other hotel I've stayed at. I didn't use the pool but it looked nice, would have used it if it was hot that weekend. Very close to the French Market and walkable to everywhere in the Quarter. Try the coffee shop around the corner...Envie...great breakfast, pastries, and really good coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Le Richelieu shines with affordable luxury in a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: MarciaFrankenmuth
Reviews.Content: On my return trip to Le Richelieu, I was happy to see that it was much as I remembered from 20 years ago. I love the flickering gas lanterns, mounted on brick-colored courtyard walls which light the garden setting. You may lounge poolside in the sun or breakfast at cafe tables inside or out. Our 3rd floor room (306) with black-grilled private balcony afforded a views of the sunrise at rooftop vantage and to the east down Barracks street a view of the tables at the Cafe Envie (great latte, baked goods and breakfasts inside or at outdoor tables). To the west, the corner of Chartres and Barracks and quaint homes beyond the corner building which is adorned with another wrap-around grilled balcony. A few blocks to the west you have Royal, then Bourbon Street. To the east a few (2 or 3?) is Decatur. For the three of us; I in patent pumps and my teenage boys in sport shoes, walked everywhere (with no worry of where to park and a much more intimate view of everything along the way) and enjoyed every minute of it. One block from hotel to Ursuline, make a right and in the next block you are at Le Croissant D'Or, the perfect spot for breakfast (open at 6:30 am!) with home-baked quiche, breakfast croissants (sausage or ham and cheese) brioche, croissants of course and because we were there just after Mardi Gras, they had the famous King Cakes (maybe they always do), all which may be enjoyed with cafe au lait, or any of the regular beverage choices. Excellent and very reasonable!

Reviews.Title: “Great find”
Reviews.Author: Dallascleantraveler
Reviews.Content: Loved the "feel" of this older hotel and the quiet location. We did not have a car but I understand the parking is included. The AC did not work in the room but it was cold so was not a problem on this trip. Will book again but will ask about the AC. Great breakfast and lunch room on site.

Reviews.Title: “Used to be our favorit place to stay -now it's awful”
Reviews.Author: GA_traveler58
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed the the Richelieu during Mardi Gras week. It has always been our favorite place to stay in the French Quarter until this time. Evidently it is under new management because neither the grounds nor the rooms are as well kept and the service is AWFUL. The first day we checked in and went to bed early, around 9:00 p.m. because we were tired from traveling. The heat and the air conditioning did not work - the antique system just blew air and the room was stifling so we opened our small window (we were on the fourth floor). At 10:30 that evening our phone rang. We were so fast asleep we didn't answer, then it started ringing again. It was the downstairs desk and the boy said, "Your window is open." I told him that I knew it was open since we were in the room and we had opened it. We went back to sleep. In about 30 minutes someone started beating on our door and my husband stumbled sleepily to the door. It was the security guard telling us our window was open - we told him we had opened it to get some fresh air. It was misting rain outside but it wasn't raining into the room. The guard said we had to shut the window due to security reasons and because it was raining! I called the front desk to complain and was told that the owner had gone outside and seen our open window and was afraid it would rain in and ruin the carpet. I told her that the air conditioning didn't work and she said she would send someone up in the morning to fix it. It took us hours to get back to sleep after the interruptions. I stopped by the front desk the following monring to ask when they were coming to fix the air conditioning. The lady at the front desk told me that the owner had it set so only the fan would blow and there was no way t o fix it. I was shocked at the attitude of the staff and especially the owner - really the staff was only following his directions. After over 20 years of staying at the Richelieu and even attending my best friends wedding which was held there, we will never go back and neither will my friend who also stayed there at the same time

Reviews.Title: “Good location but room leaves much to be desired.”
Reviews.Author: AJ215
Reviews.Content: We visited New Orleans right before Mardi Gras, and stayed at Le Richelieu for 3 nights. It's about a 5 minute walk from the center of the French Quarter, in a nice and quiet little spot--a great location. However, our room was pretty small and definitely showed signs of wear and tear. It was clean, so that was a plus. The staff was friendly and helpful, but I did not like the fact that we had to leave our room keys at the front desk every time we left. I don't have any big problems with the hotel but I think that there are probably hotels that are comparable in price and in better condition than Le Richelieu.

Reviews.Title: “We LOVE Le Richelieu”
Reviews.Author: TulsaRoo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I got married in Jackson Square on Memorial Day weekend. I had stayed at Le Richelieu before and loved it. We reserved a block of rooms for our wedding guests- about 15 rooms. From the moment we arrived on Thursday until we left on Monday, the staff couldn't have been more accomodating to us and our guests. The wedding party enjoyed the bar, restaurant, and pool all weekend. The hotel was just out of the way enough for everyone to relax when needed... and yet a short walk to any Quarter attraction or restaurant. We and our guests will always remember this as one of the best weekends we ever had in New Orleans... and will definately be back.

Reviews.Title: “French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: sandgrown_9
Reviews.Content: We tried to book directly but had to book a minimum of 3 nights so booked 2 nights through Expedia. The location of this hotel is excellent just far enough from Bourbon Street to be quiet at night though within easy walking distance and the walk back at night did not feel threatening. This is a very quaint and traditional French Quarter hotel so don't expect 5 star luxury but rooms were very comfortable and clean and the staff very helpful. Breakfast was extra but there are plenty of places around if you would prefer to eat out. In fact everything was more than expected so we booked a third night!

Reviews.Title: “Not My Kind Of Place”
Reviews.Author: dianedennis55
Reviews.Content: After seeing several positive reviews on this hotel, we tried it for 2 nights during our 5 days in New Orleans. We stayed at Royal Sonesta and Hotel Monteleone a night each and also Le Richelieu (wanted to drive to Biloxi for a day and therefore got a rental and because of free parking at this hotel, thought it would be perfect opportunity to see what everyone raves about here). I was not impressed. It was out of the way from the French Quarter which was fine, because we saw a few hot spots on Frenchman Street we might have missed otherwise. We also ate at Irene's (A MUST!) which is nearby. But the hotel is just too old and outdated for my tastes. Hotel Monteleone and Royal Sonesta are also older places and the rates were even lower, but had a much classier feel. The bathroom was yucky and never updated. We couldn't even figure out if there was air conditioning in the room--we thought not--so put on the ceiling fan. They also give you a big hotel key and you're supposed to give to front desk every time you leave the hotel. Fine, but when you return, you often times have to wait in line to get a key to go back to your room. Very inconvenient. We left sunglasses on the breakfast table but mistake, discovered this, went back down to retrieve--someone said "Oh yes, I do remember someone saying something about them earlier" but neither the waiter nor bartender could locate them. The parking is very convenient so if you want to drive around and get a good rate and aren't as picky as I am, maybe this would be a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, But Nearby the Quarter”
Reviews.Author: mau610
Reviews.Content: My brother and sister-in-law joined my wife and me on a visit to NOLA and the French Quarter. After reading the hotel reviews, we chose "Le Richelieu". The hotel is in the "Quarter", but far enough away from the Bourbon St. activities to allow privacy and quiet. Although an old hotel, it is well maintained. One day our bathtub stopper was not working, but the next day it was repaired. The bathtub knob broke off another day, but it was quickly replaced. The maintenace man is also the bartender. The staff is attentive and responsive. The temperature was 80 degrees a couple of days here. Our air conditioner would not cool the room adequately, but was not properly repaired throughout our 5 night stay. If you like the ambiance of a turn of the century (20th) hotel, you will find this hotel an enjoyable stay. Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: davidthevagabond
Reviews.Content: My wife and I loved LeRichelieu. We have finally found the hotel in New Orleans for repeat visits. Rooms quiet, large and comfortable, friendly and helpful staff, great location. Best of all, the rates are very reasonable. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend Le Richelieu”
Reviews.Author: Shawnfeb_7
Reviews.Content: We can't say enough about how wonderful our stay was. The on site free parking was the real drawing card for us as well as the price of the room. The room was very nice, clean and fresh in every way. We had a little trouble getting accessing the Internet on my husband's laptop but the desk staff was very quick to aid us. The hotel is located in a very quiet location in the French Quarter which suited us perfectly.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Le Richelieu”
Reviews.Author: FlyersKitty
Reviews.Content: I had always wanted to stay at Le Richelieu, but it was usually booked for my visits. Fortunately, they had rooms available this time. I booked 2 rooms, a single queen and double double for the very excellent prices of $130/nt and $140/nt, respectively. When we arrived and were given the room keys, we found we had been assigned rooms connected by a kitchen/lving room suite. So essentially, we were upgraded to a full suite for $270/nt. The hotel is quaint and invokes memories of an older, classier New Orleans. Its location, toward the back of the Quarter near Esplanade, maintains this ambiance as its out of the way of the Bourbon street tourists. Yes, the furnishing are out of date, as many other reviewers noted. My television was circa 1970. But that is part of the charm in my opinion. I live a state-of-the-art life; a throwback weekend was actually very fun. The hotel is also run in an old-fashioned manner. For example, the bartender, Renny, is also the maintenance man. Speaking of Renny, he has been at Le Richelieu for almost twenty years and made our visit memorable. In addition to making a mean drink, fixing our bathroom faucet, and giving advice on city locales, when I indicated I wanted to purchase pralines, he told me he could sell me homemade pralines from his daughter. The following morning, a bag of pralines was waiting for me at the front desk - much bigger than and better priced than the pralines in the Quarter candy shoppes. The ONLY negative was that our rooms were freezing. The AC units were on overdrive and even when I turned it off (following somewhat elaborate front desk instructions b/c these units also were circa 1970), the cold air never really dissipated. Good thing I had purchased a Tulane sweatshirt! All in all, a wonderful weekend at Le Richelieu with my father and brother. My father and I are somewhat snooty about where we stay and dine, but without a doubt, we will stay at Le Richelieu again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Dulcie-K
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Richlieu for 4 nights - not only is it very convenient for the French Quarter, it is also really near the bars where the locals go. The staff were, with one exception, very helpful. We had to move rooms as we stayed an extra night and they were most apologetic and gave us a room with a balcony. Having downtown free parking was a brilliant extra.

Reviews.Title: “Great place and great price!”
Reviews.Author: BamaLadyBug
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to book the Le Richelieu because of all the positive reviews on TA. We were able to check in early and the staff was so welcoming. We loved our room and private balcony. The hotel is located so close to everything that we just walked and took the streetcars everywhere. We did have a drink in the small bar and it was very cozy and once again the staff was great. The pool looked great but unfortunately we didn't bring our swimsuits.They also have a cab stand in front.We will be back very very soon. Already miss New Orleans and all the yummy food!

Reviews.Title: “Made our trip!”
Reviews.Author: kzaei
Reviews.Content: We loved this old hotel and the location. It was ideal. We visited with our four kids and got connecting rooms which turned out to give us an apt. suite with two bedrooms and an great livingroom (and even a kitchen area with a full size fridge). For the price and location, it can not be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, but felt uneasy being alone in this part of the Quarter.”
Reviews.Author: floridabuckeye
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just spent 4 nights at Le Richelieu based on all the positive reviews that we had seen on TripAdvisor. Overall, we had a great stay and were very pleased with the staff at the hotel, the rooms, the free parking, and the free internet. Due to the recent hurricanes, New Orleans was pretty quiet while we were there (Sept 2008). This was nice in terms of sight seeing, but due to less people being out on the streets in the French Quarter, I did not feel safe walking around the area near the hotel by myself. If my husband was with me I felt ok, but the nights we stayed at the hotel I did not go for my normal morning run as usual because I did not want to be alone on the streets near the hotel. There were just enough strange people on the streets that it made me nervous to be out there by myself.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Customer Service!”
Reviews.Author: ugalaw
Reviews.Content: My friend and I were scheduled to go to New Orleans this weekend. With the possibility of a hurricane hitting the area, we decided against it at the very lat minute. We called to cancel our reservation and expected to pay at least one night of the stay and possibly the whole thing. Much to our surprise, the woman at the hotel canceled our reservation with no penalty! She said that they have been through this before and that they would not charge us for the late cancellation because of the possibility of a hurricane. Although I did not get a chance to stay here, their customer service is just amazing. So many other hotels would have told us that we were out of luck and had to pay because of canceling so late. I will definitely stay here when I do finally make it to New Orleans!

Reviews.Title: “Must Stay in the Quarter- Safe and Elegant”
Reviews.Author: museumscollector
Reviews.Content: After researching hotels for our multiple day trip (weekend through weekday), I found Le Richelieu in the French Quarter was suitable for our needs- close proximity to sites, guarded FREE parking, pool, and positive reviews. Upon checking in and walking around, we were NOT disappointed! The staff was accomodating, even letting us check in an hour early, and recommended a good late-night restaurant for a Sunday night. The building is several hundred years old, with excellent furnishings, and is affordable for all prices ranges. More of a bed and breakfast feel, with a great swimming pool! Cafe and lounge on site, with free ice machine, and vending machines. Many celebrities have visited here, including Paul McCartney and Jimmy Buffett. THANK you Le Richelieu, and the owner and staff we even KNOW BY NAME, Frank and Jim!!! We WILL be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value”
Reviews.Author: Titanole
Reviews.Content: Okay, so Le Richelieu is an older place. Heck, it has been around for a hundred years or so. But the fact that it isn't a pristine new cookie-cutter chain hotel is one of its advantages. It is in a brilliant location if you don't mind walking. Being in the Quarter but on the less busy end of it makes it a quiet place to stay but not far from the action. My room was not dated at all and was always clean. Free in-room wi-fi and free parking are a plus. This is definitely a hidden gem, one that I would recommend to anyone visiting New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Its New Orleans...somebody was drunk??”
Reviews.Author: Stimpson
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel for the money. I paid around 90 $ thru the hotel on-line. The hotel is in an excellent location in the french quarter. Its is one of the few hotels in the quarter that has its own parking lot and it is free. There was also a security guard on duty throughout. You shouldn't need your car due to its proximity to most attractions in the quarter. The area is safe at all hours, the breakfast was awesome I have only good things to say about my stay. I don't think there is free wireless but i could be wrong I tapped into someone's though. For those who complain about loud revellers, creepy guys on the balcony, drunks or whatever....you are in the FRENCH QUARTER- its part of the experience, go to a bed and brekfast in minnesota or something.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: cattooth
Reviews.Content: This is an older hotel with older rooms. Do not expect a coffee pot in your room. The room was very, very clean. The airconditioning left us a little warm but the great ceiling fan kept us comfortable. The location is great and the self parking right behind the hotel with unlimited in and out is wonderful. The two nights we stayed there was no hot water. We had to take cold showers and that was an inconvience. We stayed a Sat & Sun night and were not told on check in that there was no hot water. They were working on it but could not get a part that was needed until Monday. It wasn't that bad and they offered to find us another hotel but we chose to stick it out. The small cafe is great for breakfast or a light lunch and the service is great. The front desk staff was very friendly too.

Reviews.Title: “Don't understand the popularity here...”
Reviews.Author: Ibeeneverywher
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel based on the reviews written here, and like the reviewer from Pennsylvania, I was very disappointed. To start, here are the positives: great location; very accommodating staff, for the most part; and OK value when you include free parking. BUT the negatives for me were pretty strong: very musty smell in the room was awful, the noisy air conditioning that kept me awake most nights in spite of inebriation! Even if you turn off the air conditioning in your own room, you can easily hear it from the room next door. Also, everyone talks about the cleanliness, but I didn't find this to be a particularly fresh and clean hotel. Also, I had a very negative experience upon arriving in my room in that is not necessarily the hotel's fault--when checking out the second floor balcony, which is a shared balcony, I was approached by a man wasted on some substance who literally chased me back into my room and stood leering outside the balcony door. It was terrifying! I would not recommend this hotel for single women who would want to access the balcony. Also, I would not recommend this hotel to anyone who is sensitive to cigarette smoke, as there are no specifically nonsmoking rooms. Perhaps this hotel is a good deal for smokers, many of whom I found enjoying the pool during the day. As for value, I thought it was a reasonable deal, but then I saw the room of my friend who was in NO for the same conference--she paid $79 per night by shopping online through Orbitz or some similar site and had a charming, very very clean room with a central courtyard pool and lots of character, in an even better location. All this to say, I will not stay here again and do not understand the high popularity ranking this hotel has received on this site.

Reviews.Title: “Our second stay and we still love it!”
Reviews.Author: Cas S
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a perfect location in the French quarter-just far enough away form the noise of Bourbon Street but only a few minutes walk from all of the action. We have stayed pre and post Katrina and have noticed no difference in this hotel and pretty much I have to say in the French Quarter. The biggest differences were the restaurants and bars we had liked had closed down and new business replaced them. The Hotel has a pool, room serve and the rooms are of a wonderful size and really well appointed. Try and get a balcony room as this really adds an extra dimension. Great value and the staff are really friendly-would totally recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location But Not Impressed”
Reviews.Author: gdubsPhiladelphia_PA
Reviews.Content: Just returned from four days in NOLA having stayed at the Le Richelieu. I read the Trip Advisor reviews and was looking forward to a quaint hotel with accomodating staff. I must say that I was not impressed. Yes, the location is great. Close enough to everything in the Quarter and just far enough to offer a quiet retreat from the fun and noise of Bourbon Street. The rooms are clean but in need of serious updating. A prior poster hit the nail on the head when they wrote: "A simple quiz to judge how much you might, or might not, like Le Richelieu: You walk into a turquoise bathroom (even the toilet is turquoise), and see that, while being clean and very well-maintained, the main fixtures appear to be nearly 40 years old. Do you think (A) "Wow, how cool!" or (B) "How dated and awful!" If your answer is B, then Le Richelieu might not be your ideal hotel. " Consider me in the "B" category. My room had a musty smell and was just outdated. The tv for example had to be 30 years old. Also, I could't believe that the hotel still uses actual keys for the rooms. Nothing wrong with that but the key is attached to a gigantic piece of plastic making it hard to carry around when sightseeing. It was more like a key you'd get when using a gas station restroom! Another minor issue, no lobby pc for printing out airline boarding passes. The front counter tried to accomodate but was unable to print my pass. I didn't find the staff very accomodating either. They seemed annoyed when I asked them to (attempt to) print a boarding pass. It just seems the hotel needs some upgrading to bring it into the 21st century. Over Memorial Day weekend I was in NOLA and stayed at the Hotel Monteleone. Now there's a great hotel that has successfully maintained a historic look and feel while keeping up with modern conveniences. So, for Le Richelieu - positives: clean rooms and great location; negatives: outdated all around, staff could be more accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “Love Loved it!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: cyawillie
Reviews.Content: Le Richelieu-New Orleans,La LOVED LOVED IT!!!!!! My husband was a little nervous about NOLA because of the reported crime rate. I have to say that our stay in the French Quarter was lovely. The hotel was GREAT. The rooms were nice and clean. The court yard was so nice I could have just stayed there in the evenings and been perfectly happy. The Staff was so helpful,even looking up places on the net and printing out detailed maps for us. This is a wonderful location also. It is at the end of the Quarter,and in a residental area, so it was rather quite,which was nice after being on Bourbon St. Our room had a small balcony which faced the street, it was fun to people watch in the early morning. The other Great perk was a free garded parking lot! The small bar exited out into the courtyard which was nice,the bar tender was really nice, he makes the Best Brandy Milk Punch! The Quarter was clean and I fely really safe. I was impressed that on every street there was a a policeman and a trash truck collecting trash at all hours. I highly recomend going to NOLA. They need the tourist to come back and be supportive. We felt the apprecaition from every business. The food ahhhh,well I could write a book FANTASTIC! No Bad meals in NOLA! We had a great time and only encounterd 2 panhandlers! Not Bad!!!

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Seagull1
Reviews.Content: The welcome that we received every time we returned to reception was almost embarrassing in it's friendliness. There wasn't anything too small that the staff couldn't help you with. For some unknown reason our room was upgraded to a suite which in turn was one of the nicest rooms I have stayed in all the years of travelling and staying in many hotels throughout Europe. Position for us was perfect. Let's face it, everywhere in the French Quarter isn't far away but the Le Richelieu is nicely positioned in the corner near everywhere but quiet. The Bar and restaurant were more than adequate for breakfast and a drink in the evening. Didn't use the pool as it was too cold in March but this also looked big enough for a dip after a tiring day out. Oh and I nearly forgot the free car park which is definitely worth remembering. All in all a hotel to recommend.

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent French Quarter value”
Reviews.Author: Dtx
Reviews.Content: A simple quiz to judge how much you might, or might not, like Le Richelieu: You walk into a turquoise bathroom (even the toilet is turquoise), and see that, while being clean and very well-maintained, the main fixtures appear to be nearly 40 years old. Do you think (A) "Wow, how cool!" or (B) "How dated and awful!" If your answer is B, then Le Richelieu might not be your ideal hotel. If your answer is A, well, then it's definitely worth checking out. While our bathroom was retro-cool turquoise, we did get a peek at another one that appeared to have been recently updated, so they're not all time capsules. But we loved ours anyway. Our room on the 4th floor was clean, roomy and had a shockingly large walk-in closet, complete with iron and ironing board, which would make it a great room for an extended stay. Also, while at least one recent review complained of being able to hear activities in an adjacent room, our room seemed quite well sound-proofed. We never heard anything from neighboring rooms, and even people in the hallway sounded a bit muffled. We could, however, hear a folks out on balconies on the floors below us (the 4th floor lacks such balconies) on a couple of occasions when they got a bit boisterous. Maybe the person who had the noise problem was in a different wing of the hotel. Street noise also wasn't much of an issue. The hotel is located in a quiet, largely residential corner of the French Quarter. This location makes for a nicer experience in many ways, but might not be convenient for everyone. It is quite close to Decatur St. and the Frenchmen St. scene over in the Faubourg Marigny. But it's a little bit of a walk to Jackson Square, more of a walk to the more raucous part of Bourbon St., and a real hike to and from Canal St. But you can hop on the nearby Riverfront Streetcar line to ride over toward Canal St. One thing I would note is that, even though we were there in mid-April, our top-floor room got a bit warm in the late afternoon, and we didn't have any real control over temperatures in the room, but we did have a window that actually opened. Especially with that window, the heat wasn't a problem for us, but I might have mild qualms about it getting too hot on the 4th floor if I were staying here during the summer. The 2nd floor might be a better choice in really hot weather. Overall, we really liked the hotel, its location, and most notably, its decent rates and free parking.

Reviews.Title: “Paul and Linda McCartney stayed here in the 70s!”
Reviews.Author: PensaCandy
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff ... free parking ... nice courtyard and all in the French Quarter. Paul and Linda McCartney stayed here in the 70s which was the selling point for us (that and the parking) and we were surprised at how nice the hotel was for the low price and the staff is barnone the friendliest and most accomodating you will meet anywhere. I highly reccomend this hotel for the price, the staff, the history and the fact that's it's so centrally located.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite NOLA hotel - and it's a steal”
Reviews.Author: Mizsnooks
Reviews.Content: This is such a cool, romantic, serene hotel with huge rooms, huge closets, and bathrooms that seem to be from the late forties. I was attending a convention at the Hilton Riverside, and it was easy to take the riverside streetcar right up there. Nice to have a cabstand outside, too. It's a bit of a time machine - a quality I love. At one point I was thinking about living there... There's a great-looking old tiled coffee place/bakery on Ursulines, just a couple of blocks away - though the coffee isn't great but then it rarely is in NO. The Croissant d"Or. I'm planning to return with my family this fall for a celebration. Great place to stay for a wedding, too. I just turned the noisy air conditioning off - the controls don't actually work. If your room backs up to the elevator bank, the air conditioner in the hall can drive you crazy, Just turn it off too.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic old world charm”
Reviews.Author: BlueMuse
Reviews.Content: Very good value and such a warm southern welcome! Le Richelieu is in a very good location within the French Quarter, very safe and close to the nicer end of Bourbon Street. There certainly wasnt a problem walking back to the hotel at night. The rooms have a certain 1970s charm - despite being totally renovated after Katrina. The hotel hasn't seemed to change at all and this gives it real character. The staff were fantastic and breakfast on the terrace was a lovely way to start the day.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to Stay in the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: ashuppe
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Le Richelieu for 4 nights at the end of March. After much research online and after looking at reviews we booked a room here for our stay. We were extremely pleased with our stay. There were several good things about this hotel. First the price is one that allows you to still have money to spend in NO. The staff is exceptionally friendly. Our room had a small fridge that was useful in keeping water cold for the warm temps they were having that week. Although I could see in the summer that the temparature in the room may be a problem we were comfortable at night and there was a ceiling fan for warmer temparatures. We had a 2nd floor king room. Although it did not lead out onto the balcony it had a large window that we were able to keep open at night. We really enjoyed the location, which we found out was only a couple blocks from Brad and Angelina's home. It was a 10 to 15 minute walk into the main part of the French Quarter and we felt it was a safe walk at any hour. We enjoyed the walk as it allowed us to see more of the area. The next time we are in the French Quarter we will definitely be staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: ph0t0grapher
Reviews.Content: We stayed here three nights in late March, and enjoyed it so much we came back the next weekend for a couple more nights. We picked this hotel for the free self-parking and the fact that it was located in a quiet section of the french quarter. The only concern I would have is the central ventilation system. You can't control the temperature of the air in your room. Our room was on the verge of being too warm at night. During the cooler months this hotel would be my first pick for a french quarter hotel. The hotel has much charm, and the staff is great!

Reviews.Title: “Memorable”
Reviews.Author: jharg23
Reviews.Content: What first attracted us to this hotel was the free parking in the Quarter with an on lot attendent, but we ended up falling in love with many more aspects of Le Richelieu. Great safe location, walked home many a night in the AM hours and never felt threaten by our surroundings. The room had exposed brick, we had a wonderful private balcony on the 3rd floor, we slept with the doors open because the weather was wonderful, in the 70s-80s. All the employees were very cordial and helpful. They have a cab attendent that waits out front to offer rides if necessary. Within walking distance of everything: Bourbon, Royal, French Market, Jackson Square, etc... all under 10 minutes. Would recommend anyone to stay there and when we make it back to the NO will definitely make reservations with Le Richelieu.

Reviews.Title: “The Real New Orleans Experience!!”
Reviews.Author: Penneylane5100
Reviews.Content: FREE PARKING in rear of hotel with security guards!!! Try to find that in the French Qtr! Average is 28-35 $$ per day elsewhere. From New orleans and hadn't been back there for years. This was the perfect Nola experience for my husband. He had never visited this wonderful historic city. 2 blocks to Bourbon St and a short walking distance to all the sites. New Orleans city blocks are very short unlike most large cities. Old hotel and full of charm. If you want 4-5 star, stay elsewhere. This hotel is for people who want the real New Orleans experience. Great staff and the rooms are like stepping back into the 1800's. You feel as if you may meet the vampires Louis or Lestat in the hallways. Beautiful courtyard with a wonderful pool, poolside bar and resturant. And very quiet for the area. You must experience this great old hotel unless you're a sissy...LOL We loved it and will always book this hotel on return visits. Wouldn't dream of staying in a newer hotel. That wouldn't be NOLA!!! Note:If you want a courtyard or street view, request at time of booking. Not all rooms have either. That's always a problem with Nola hotels. Honestly, you don't need either as you'll always be on the go. Just so many neat things to see and do.

Reviews.Title: “Odd!”
Reviews.Author: barrychick
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights earlier this month. We loved that it's a small, friendly hotel and found the reception very interesting to look at.(compared with the clinical look of all the generic, chain hotels that we hate). The room was ok: it could definately do with a coat of paint and new bedding, the bathroom could do with an upgrade too, however, both the room and bathroom were clean. The location is fantastic: right next to everything but in the middle of nothing so very convenient and on a quiet street. Be warned: our room rate did not include breakfast and the pool is very small and not heated. What we hated: you can hear everything: all the people coming home drunk and we even had the 'pleasure' of hearing the couple next door getting 'at it'!! We also hated the fact that the bar where you take breakfast in the morning, is right behind the reception so every time you walk through it stinks of cigarette and cigar smoke. Eating breakfast in that room is both pleasure and pain: the staff are fantastic, the food is great but the smell is totally disgusting. In conclusion: it was both enjoyable and not enjoyable!

Reviews.Title: “A great small inn”
Reviews.Author: LCQ
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews, My husband and I booked the Le Richelieu because they had secured parking. The parking was secure. The surprise, the Inn was a true hidden gem! Comfortable, clean, a friendly helpful staff, the restaurant served a great breakfast the best value I've seen in a long while! The Le Richelieu may be dated but our stay reminded us of a time lost . A step back sometimes can be a good thing! The Q's from Virginia

Reviews.Title: “Quiet French Quarter Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: carlathemom
Reviews.Content: What a quaint little place. This place is not updated but that is part of the charm. The beds are comfortable, the rooms are clean, the location is quiet and the staff is friendly. When you leave the hotel, you turn in your key at the front desk and pick it up when you return. Initially I thought that would be a bother but after a few times, I really liked it. The staff got to know you and vice versa. It just added a personal touch to it all. I really have no complaints about this place and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A Place to Consider”
Reviews.Author: gb905
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because of the superior ratings it has received on Tripadvisor. Overall, the place met our needs. On the plus side, most of the staff is very helpful. We arrived early in the morning and our room wasn't ready so we stored our bags in the manager's office. This is not a big hotel and I can imagine people either thinking it's charming or a bit run-down. It has a small outdoor pool that is not heated. Our room was on the first floor and looked out on the pool area. Be prepared to pay for the morning newspaper and coffee ($2.50 with free refills). Also, the rooms do NOT have individual heat control. The entire hotel is heated to one temperature. Our room had an overhead fan and as well as a fan that we mistook for the heating element. The room was a tad warm during the night. The television is a very old, small model that had less than 20 stations and no movie options. The room was adequate - not huge but we didn't feel too crowded. The hotel is on the far side of Chartres Street, a bit away from everything so it was quieter. It's closer to the French Market than the busy center of the French Quarter. I figured the hotel had to have something going for it since Paul McCartney stayed there (and based upon the pictures in the manager's office so did Barry Manilow). I found it met our needs but I don't think this is the place for you if you're looking for something closer to Bourbon Street or a fancy location.

Reviews.Title: “Better hotel choices in New Orleans, no doubt....”
Reviews.Author: AAGeorgiapeach
Reviews.Content: February 19, 2008 My husband and I just returned from a trip to New Orleans. After hours of researching hotels and reading numerous reviews, we booked a room directly with Le Richelieu. This was a very special trip for me as I was celebrating my birthday. I requested a room with a balcony. What we got was room #324 that had a view of a roof! It was located directly above the kitchen. When we opened the window for fresh air (the room was quite stuffy and warm) we could hear the kitchen staff talking and laughing.
