To make matters worse the window would not fully close, there was a large gap between the two sides. The air conditioner, even on high, put out very little cool air. The towels and sheets were rough and threadbare. The television set seemed to be from the '70s and was sitting on top of a dresser. The hotel is not remotely close to much of what you go to New Orleans to see. The best thing I can mention about this hotel is a young man named Jim who worked at the reception desk. He was most helpful and informative. My husband and I travel extensively and try to be careful about our choice of lodgings. This was our fourth trip to New Orleans, and there will be more in the future. We will not be staying at this hotel again, nor would we recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: xiaoshuixian
Reviews.Content: Just back from a long weekend trip to New Orleans with my BF. Read all the reviews before we go and decided to try Le Richelieu out. We are pleased with our decision. :) 1, Location: A few blocks away from the famous Bourbon Street in the French Quarter. Easy walking distance to all the shopping- clubbing-dining fun, but away from all the noise. 2, Condition: Very elegant-looking, carefully maintained, but not one of those glamorous fancy hotels. So you might feel it "smells" old, but I don't think it would be a real problem, as you can take it as one of the "special" things to live in such a house with history. After all, this hotel was kept in a very clean way. 3, Room: Mid-size room with a Queen bed. Nothing fancy, and nothing to complain. One thing worth mentioning is the door (or should I call window) opening toward the big balcony. That certainly added comfort when we chatted in the morning breeze. 4, Service: Room is cleaned everyday on time, and clean towels, complimentary simple toiletry are provided. The staff in the lobby are really helpful. They answer every question we have, assisting us in booking tours, choosing restaurants, shopping around... and they even gave free bottled water to us upon our late arrival (oh, forgot to say there is no coffee machine in the room, so you have to buy enough water/coffee to stock in the room). All in all, this is an enjoyable place for a weekend get-away memory.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice!”
Reviews.Author: moosemizzou
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to stay at this hotel based on the postings of others. We were not disappointed. The hotel is ideally located in a quiet section of the French Quarter and the staff very accommodating. The rate was reasonable and the room comfortable. Those that enjoy a hotel with charm and character and the atmosphere of a B and B, will like the Le Richelieu. Those wanting a lot of amenities (fitness room, full-service restaurant (the one at the hotel is open from 7 - 2) business center, etc.) will not.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: NaKoa
Reviews.Content: Went to the Sugar Bowl and wanted to stay someplace with some New Orleans "ambience." After scouring Trip Advisor and other travel websites, Le Richelieu came up time and again as a good alternative. I was pleasantly surprised that such an old building, (built in 1845) was so well maintained. The rooms are high ceilinged, but with ceiling fans, central air/heating, new carpeting, plumbing, TV's etc. (If you're looking for spotless chrome and ceramic fixtures, go downtown to the Marriott) The twin french doors lead out to the second floor lanai (do they call them that in Nawlins..?) that wraps around half of the building. I even saw my first jazz band come sashaying down Chartres Street, not 5 minutes after checking in, from the same lanai. Impressive. On the eastern edge of the French Quarter, you're far enough away from the bars and noisy night life, but still only a few blocks from the same bars, restaurants and sights (couple of blocks from the River Walk, French Market, etc.). You can take the trolley ($1.25 exact change), which just started running following Katrina, the 1/2 mile to downtown and the "big" hotels and Harrah's Casino. Or, just walk the River Walk to the Aquarium, shops and restaurants along the way. There's a small bar and restaurant in the hotel that serves breakfast and lunch and faces the tiny pool in the center of the building. Nothing special here, so walk the 1/2 block to a couple of nice restaurants (Daisy Duke's for one) that serves beignets and coffee to those not so inclined to fight the crowds at Cafe du Monde. Everyone at the hotel is friendly and helpful from the front desk to the maids. Everyone seems to be a long-time employee who treats you with care and pride. Overall, a very nice hotel that immerses you in the French Quarter experience.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay very much”
Reviews.Author: rudyjane
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Le Rich for 3 nights. There were 3 of us in the room, but there was plenty of room. The bathroom is large and the water pressure was great. Most importantly, it was clean. I had read some threads concerning the fact that Le Rich didn't not have separate smoking and non-smoking rooms, but that was not an issue for us. We noticed no smoke smell at all. We had a room that overlooked Barracks Street and had a common balcony that covered the entire side on the second floor. We didn't eat in the restuarant, only coffee 2 mornings...the wait staff was a bit curt both mornings, but they were the only ones I can say that about. The desk personnel were very pleasant and helpful. The area is very quiet, but a very short walk to Jackson Square, restaurants and Bourbon Street. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone heading to NOLA who wants a good, clean, well-priced, safe hotel to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet location, nice accomodations, great price”
Reviews.Author: Susonka
Reviews.Content: This is a great little hotel. We had a king size bed and private balcony for a great price. We had emailed the hotel to ask about a rate, and got a great deal. The hotel lobby is really pretty as well as the area around the pool. Our room also was a good size with a comfortable, king size bed. The bathroom was also big. Our room and bathroom were clean. The location of this hotel is nice because it is on a quiet street but still in the French Quarter so it is close to everything. In general, the hotel is a little dated, but we thought that this made the hotel unique. Also, it seemed like this was one of the only hotels that had free parking which is a big plus in the French Quarter. We didn't drive so we can't comment too much. The parking lot looked safe/secure. The front desk staff were very friendly and answered all of our questions and gave good advice. We did have an issue when we checked out. Our room was quoted at one price when we had made our reservation, but we were charged a higher rate when we checked out. Also, we were charged for our entire stay when we had already paid for one night. The ladies at the front desk were very nice and a manager came out and did fix our bill. Oh, if you do get a quote from this hotel, bring this quote in writing just in case you have a similar issue with the nightly rate. I had our confirmation letter with me, so when I showed this, our bill was fixed to reflect the rate we were quoted.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TrumanLouisiana
Reviews.Content: Great Location for French Quarter. A little dated on the inside -- could use a new shower head and some duvets. But otherwise -- very clean and affordable. Would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky and Quaint”
Reviews.Author: Heidi29229
Reviews.Content: This is one great hotel! Just stayed there and loved the atmosphere and authenticity of the place - great location, free parking and wonderful hotel employees! I'd go back in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: LosAngelesJanfran
Reviews.Content: We couldn't have been happier with our choice. We had 4 nights in a shared balcony, smoking room with kitchen on the 2nd floor overlooking Chartres. Every staff member (desk clerks, maids, wait staff) was friendly and helpful; there's a taxi stand right outside; a bar and cafe on premises; quiet neighborhood; charming decor. It is a longer walk to the action, but so much to enjoy along the way. They made you feel like family, given that the owner lives on the premises and most of his staff has been with him for years. Can't recommend it highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in the quiet part of the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Traveler5548
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Le Richelieu for 5 nights in a lovely room on the 3rd floor with a balcony over-looking Barrick street. There are many pluses for staying at this property: free parking, free internet, reasonably priced rooms for the Quarter, reasonably priced breakfast in the dining area off the pool, very helpful staff who personally knew me by the second day (they use the European system of turning in your key to the front desk when you leave the hotel). And most exciting to our daughter was a "preceived" Brad Pitt sighting. Bradjolina live around the corner and one of the days, someone she said looked like Brad Pitt roared up on a motercycle and went into their home. We didn't see any security around the home to indicate they were there, but it made for a great story. The location is quiet, yet a 5 minute walk to all the action. The best of all worlds.

Reviews.Title: “Returning to A Friend”
Reviews.Author: MNCondoDude
Reviews.Content: I was at Le Richelieu In the French Quarter from November 12, to the 17th. This was my second stay at the hotel and my fourth visit to New Orleans. It was good to see the hotel was open. I was one of a party of four, we shared two rooms. My room was on the fourth floor and we could look towards the downtown. The room was quiet, clean and the rate on it was a fair one. Service was good at the front desk, the bar service was also fine. It was easy to walk to things within the French quarter and cabs were always outside it seemed. For people with cars, their parking area is a real plus. You can walk to the French Market about three blocks away and catch the River front cable car. The only down point was ourtoilet ran, but we lived with that and really did not ask for them to fix it until our last day. The heating system at the hotel works! This is a great location, with a nice staff and good rates - try it if you want to be away from Bourbon Street and the Canal street area.

Reviews.Title: “Le Richelieu Perfect !”
Reviews.Author: LMA1952
Reviews.Content: Perfect place to stay on the edge of the FRENCH QUARTER. Close to everything, and if you want to ride there is a taxi stand outside the front door. Felt Safe, Rooms Clean, Bathroom squeeky clean. Very nice pool and patio area and wonderful poolside cafe for a comfortable breakfast. Bar is great, friendly staff. Front desk staff especially Courtney and Olivia went over and above to be helpful with recommendations, directions etc. Most accomadating ! Just far enough away from the noise and action of Bourbon and Decatur to be quiet so you can get a good nights sleep. Reminds me of a European Hotel. Would recommend to others. Lisa A NJ

Reviews.Title: “Just right for our needs”
Reviews.Author: OhIsis
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at Le Richelieu after it was recommended to us. It was very quaint. The location was a nice, quiet neighborhood close to all the beautiful architecture and great dining locations. We got a great deal on our room. I can't recommend this hotel highly enough. Next time we're in the French Quarter, we'll definitely stay here. We only stayed in the city for one night but we were able to take in the French Quarter walking tour, as well as dining at many of the local restaurants. It's such a beautiful city. It is worth going there just to see what a European looking city is like in the U.S. The tourism is definitely needed, so we felt good about helping out in our own small way.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the pool, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: jgk_7
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the Richelieu. The hotel is located in a very quiet neighbourhood but very close to the major attractions (St Louis cathedral is a 10 minutes walk) The staff was very friendly and always ready to help. The room was big and clean. The heated pool in the patio was beautiful. The snack bar overlooking the pool was very pleasant. The parking is next to the hotel and free, which is definitely something to take into account when you compare Le Richelieu with other hotels. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for a reasonable price. Would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: Shelmarie
Reviews.Content: We were "forced" to stay here because we were meeting my father in New Orleans, who drove and refused to pay extra to park. This hotel was the only hotel which offered free parking and was close to all the action. My husband and I prefer to stay at highly-rated B&B's because hotels are just so damn cookie-cutter, boring and predictable. On the other hand, my dad is extremely budget-conscious. He refuses to stay at B&Bs, tending to be perfectly happy to stay at a Best Western --- the cheaper, the better! So, you see, we had to traverse a wide gap in taste. My husband recommended we stay at Le Richelieu because it provided free parking (thus pleasing Dad), and I very reluctantly agreed. It turned out that Le Richelieu satisfied all of us perfectly. It was a standard hotel, so it pleased my dad, but it had its own peculiar New Orleans charm and character, so it ended up pleasing me and my husband, too. The lobby has an elegant 1950's/1960's New Orleans ambience. (The elevator reminded us of something one would have used in 1960 -- in a good way, not a bad way.) We had rooms which opened up to a long New Orleans balcony/gallery overlooking a quiet street. The rooms were standard hotel fare -- aged, but very clean and comfortable. Cable TV. Quiet rooms. The hotel's front desk was both helpful and friendly. There was a charming small bar/lounge area and an inviting pool downstairs, too, though we didn't use either. My father had a problem getting all the channels on his TV set and with his toilet. He immediately reported the problems to the front desk, and when we returned to the hotel later in the day, both problems were fixed. Attentive, prompt service. Le Richelieu is within walking distance to the activities of New Orleans, but it's far enough away so that it is QUIET. No loud partying! In fact, we explored a nearly NOLA fringe neighborhood we would have overlooked entirely if we had stayed elsewhere, and we were charmed by it. (Note: Try to eat at Adolpho's, a restaraunt near Le Richelieu. One of the best meals we had in NOLA, and also far less expensive than those we enjoyed at Brennan's and Anaud's.) We will happily stay at Le Richelieu again. Highly recommended, especially for those seeking a reasonably-priced hotel in New Orleans with free parking. By the way, here are some things we enjoyed about New Orleans and would highly recommend to others: The Hurricane Katrinia Tour provided by Greyline Tours, Lloyd Sensat's walking tour of The Garden District (Historic Walking Tours), The Presbytere, Mother's Restaurant, Brennan's (friendly staff and good food), Adolpho's Restaurant --- and just walking the streets of NOLA. I loved the cafe lattes and beignets and people-watching at Cafe du Monde, though it was strange to see Vietnamese waiters everywhere..... We don't drink but it was still great fun to walk down rowdy Bourbon Street at night --- and we were that much happier to return to the peace and quiet of Le Richelieu later on! There are some things we felt were over-rated by Frommer's, We could have skipped this: Arnaud's (great food, but very loud and its house band is permitted to move from table to table, encouraging diners to buy their CD), Felix Oyster (across from ACME), Johnny's Po Boys, the ghost tour recommended by Frommers (Historic Walking Tours?). The swamp tour was fine, but only if you feel the need to explore a swamp/marsh once in your lifetime. We only touched the surface of NOLA in 4 days and look forward to returning soon! The highlight of New Orleans is just walking the streets of New Orleans and taking in its charm. Le Richelieu is the perfect base camp for doing just that. Thumbs up.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel for the Money - Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: TheAlthardts
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 1 night, August 24th 2007. Stayed in room 401. First of all; very nicely decorated, very clean, very quiet and room to boot. The only negative I have to say is that the bathroom is outdated but it is clean. Cleaniness is THE most important to me. Beautiful view outside the window. Only a few blocks from Burbon Street and even less to Jackson Square and the river front. Close enough to everything to walk yet far enough that you don't have the noise. Loved this hotel. Booked it online on the hotels website and paid right at $100 which included tax and parking. I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great French Quarter Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Traveler2112
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel on a quite street in the french quarter. The room was very nice on the fourth floor with a balcony and view of street. There are plenty of places to eat nearby as well as one in the hotel itself. It was an easy two block walk to bourbon street and is located in a safe area. The french quarter is back up and running since the hurricane and people were friendly and glad to have us there. One of the good things about this hotel is the parking. It is included in the room fee and has 24 hour security. There is also an overflow parking area across the street that the gaurd partrols as well so you can drive around all you want and always have a place to park when you come back. It is located very close to the farmers market which is nice. There is a small fridge in the room for drinks and snacks. We liked this hotel and would stay in it again. Great deal for the price!!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific”
Reviews.Author: ShaCL
Reviews.Content: We had never been to New Orleans before and picked it for a big birthday (one that ends in a 0). Our flight from Atlanta was delayed so we didn't arrive till nearly midnight. A huge, friendly, man on the desk checked our names against his list then lead us down the hallway on the same floor. The room was enormous, it was an entire apartment. There was a large bedroom with ceiling paddle (which thrilled me, it made me think of Gone With The Wind); a large sitting room with settees, TV, table and chairs, a big kitchen - the only appliance of which is connected is the massive American fridge - and a large bathroom too. I was very pleased. Next day, unpacking, there had been a disaster in our luggage. A carton of talcum powder had emptied over everything. I called reception and they sent the housekeeper along, who took away the worst-damaged clothes and had them cleaned, same day. I'd also informed the hotel beforehand about The Birthday. On day two, they had baked a cake! It was in the room when we got back, all decorated with the name, spelled correctly. I was very touched. The hotel interior has wonderful old chequered floors, dark woods, a small pool, a small restaurant, and a busy but very efficient breakfast area. The waiters were absolutely delightful, and I wanted to hug them but controlled myself. We took a guided tour of New Orleans on the first day, and in December had the tour guide all to ourselves in the mini-bus. It was a great tour and the above-ground cemetaries are astonishing. The next day we did an all-day Plantations Tour with a different company. It was ok. Be warned - they don't tell you in advance on the Plantations Tour (which is sold by reception) that there is no meal break and it's a long day out. This hotel is within easy walking distance of Bourbon Street and all the nightlife there, so it's in a quiet area. This city has or used to have a high crime rate but we never felt uneasy or threatened once. I'd recommend Mr. B's Bistro in the French Quarter for the most delicious catfish and jambalaya.

Reviews.Title: “Le Richelieu Lovely Boutique Hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: lesliedru
Reviews.Content: I chose Le Richelieu almost with my eyes shut using reviews from Frommers, TripAdvisor and one or two other websites - I just wanted a vacation. Le Richelieu is just on the edge of the quarter - it's a small, clean, friendly and beautifully designed French style hotel, an oasis in the midst of the noise and hustle of the French Quarter. The room was done in beautiful tapestry, clean and elegant in design. A very helpful staff assisted with last minute trip planning. It was wonderful, charming and warm. A lovely place to spend a week!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: 7870faubourg
Reviews.Content: I always admired the exterior of this hotel and the interior turned out to be just as charming. The bedspread and curtains were a little old-fashioned for my taste, but the third-floor room was a good size, very clean, lots more storage space than I needed for four days' worth of clothes. And even tho I had a rock-bottom summer rate thru Priceline Europe (booked thru Tripadvisor's search engine) they gave me a room with a lovely little balcony. There was no place to sit out there, but it was marvelous to step out and survey the roofs of the French Quarter, and I could keep the doors open and get lots of fresh air. The little courtyard pool was lovely, and the staff was very nice. I had dropped my cell phone in the hall as I was checking out, and when I ran back upstairs to look for it, one of the housekeepers told me "Oh, my mama found it, she's down the hall." I thought it was nice they had a mother-daughter team -- although that might be one reason the housekeepers were a little loud out in the hallway in the morning! I didn't mind because I lived in New Orleans up til Katrina and for me, it was lovely hearing the cadences of those voices. The one thing I'd complain about is that I'd had to park my car in their lot across the street after coming back late from a club, which wasn't a problem, the attendant was keeping an eye on the street. But they called me twice on Sunday morning -- once from the desk, once from the parking lot -- asking did I want to move my car now. Well, no, I want to sleep. There were still other cars there around noon. Obviously the people coming home latest are going to want to sleep in the longest, so they should maybe tell people if there's a reason they want the car moved back to the main lot. I would've been happy to leave my keys with one of the attendants, who were very nice and provided a sense of security. All in all, the location could hardly be better -- in the quiet part of the Quarter and close to the Marigny for nightlife and coffee (also had a great bagel w/ lox as well at Cafe Rose Nicaud on Frenchmen).

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: NCMagnolia
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a stay in New Orleans where I spent 2 nights at the Le Richelieu. I knew about the hotel from when I lived in New Orleans a few years ago and I'd always wanted to stay there. It is, as others have said, on older hotel with all the ambience of one. It was clean and the price was right too. The weather outside was swealtering, but the room was kept at a very nice temperature. The front desk staff and others were very courteous and helpful. I will definitely stay here again and soon I hope.

Reviews.Title: “Just can't beat the Le Richlieu in NOLA”
Reviews.Author: willangela
Reviews.Content: We arrived on 7/5 and stayed through 7/9 and we can't say enough about the Le Richlieu Hotel. It's an elegant old world style hotel (about 120 years old) and it's magnificient. The hotel staff from the front desk staff to bellman, housekeeping and security were outstanding. We visited NOLA for two reasons vacation and to support this lovely city in their rebuilding efforts. It's sad to see so many families displaced but yet they're so strong. Upon our arrival, we were checked into room 214 (standard king room but posh nontheless!), there was a leak from the floor above on the window sill. The moment the bellman realized the problem, they switched our room to room 227 (The Paul McCartney Suite!!!) It was magnificient. The room as huge and the balcony overlooked the front of the hotel. We had the full length of the balcony! The room had a kitchen with fridge and stove. The furnishings were exquisite although mid 80's style but elegant just the same. I developed a medical problem which of course had nothing to do with the hotel but they did everything they could to help me find a chiropractor ... nothing was open at 4:30pm on Saturday. So I had to go to the hospital. They gave my husband perfect directions and if you have to go to the hospital while in NOLA, go to the Touro Infirmary. Dr. R. Anand was wonderful and I was in and out in 1.5 hours. Now that's a record by anybody's standard. With the injury, we had to stay over another day. The hotel moved us to another room which believe it or not was better than the Paul McCartney suite. It was room 414 and let me tell ya ... you have room to spread out. The room has a kitchen (no microwave) but that didn't phase me at all ... living room, dining area with round table and four chairs, 3 closets (one closet was bigger than my home closet), old world style bathroom and the bed was heavenly!! We were so impressed with this hotel and when we come back next year, it will be our hotel of choice. It was a lovely stay and we hated to see the time end. All of the reviews on this site helped us make our decision and everybody was dead on!! If your worried about boutique hotel vs. chain, don't. This hotel will not disappoint you. They remember your name, which room you're in, when you ask for change for the street car or taxi, they remember to give you quarters ... it's $1.25 for the street car. The taxis have a set rate for travel so you don't have to worry about that. I can't say anything bad about this hotel ... it's a great hotel. I will post pictures as soon as I figure it out :) It just doesn't get better than the Le Richlieu hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Charming”
Reviews.Author: rubyinparadise
Reviews.Content: I had always admired this hotel during past trips as we would walk down Chartres on our way to the Marigny where all our favorite clubs are. So I decided to book it for our most recent trip. We were not disappointed. This hotel is very charming - you really feel like you are in New Orleans. It has a nice pool and bar. We didn't partake of breakfast or lunch, but the coffee was good. The staff was great, room was clean, bed was comfortable. I appreciated the free/secured parking, and it was refreshing to use an actual KEY to open your door. All of these aspects combined with an affordable rate makes me think we have found our N.O. hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Liked the Richelieq”
Reviews.Author: okguy2937
Reviews.Content: I stayed recently in New Orleans for a xmas escape from the madness. The Hotel is located on my favorite French Quarter Street; Chartes. The location is impeccable for walking around. The rooms and public areas remind you of something out of the Sinatra era; I mean this in a nice way. The bellman run around in classic uniform and the bar is busy with older patrons smoking and drinking like an old Bogart movie; play it again Sam!! The housekeeping and front desk are the strong points of this property. The frunishings in the rooms, and public areas, are rather dated but in first class condition. The rooms are spotless. I half expected to meet Dean Martin or Sammy Davis in a tuxedo coming in from a night on the town because the personality of the place is of that era, classic though. The price is excelent and if your parents are alive and you want to sort of go to a place that returns them to their element in youth this Hotel is just right; you will enjoy it too. Check it out

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, but need some updating”
Reviews.Author: CherylCT
Reviews.Content: We just returned from LeRichelieu and were in town for the French Quarter Fest. We loved the location of the hotel as it was a little bit enough off of the beaten path for it to be quiet and peaceful, but close enough to just walk to wherever you wanted to go. The staff was very friendly, welcoming and helpful. We ate breakfast there one morning and the food was good but the menu limited. Our room itself was OK. The beds were too small (full size) for 2 people and the bathroom needed serious updating. The room was very clean, however. We had wished the pool was heated as we would have liked to take a dip but the water was freezing. Free parking was definitely a plus.

Reviews.Title: “La Richelieu was a good choice.”
Reviews.Author: MichiganVoyageur
Reviews.Content: La Richeleau is a nice, clean hotel in an older building located in the French Quarter. It is very close to the French Market and a trolley stop, but it is hike to get to the center of activity. This hotel is in the 1200 block and most activities are in the 400, 500 and 600 blocks. My husband and I walked daily to Bourbon St., Canal St, and sometimes even all the way to Harrah's Casino which is just outside the French Quarter on the opposite side. (Good lunch buffet) The location is nice and quiet. Hotel has a small restaurant and bar, good food at the going rate. Nice little courtyard and pool. Staff is very nice and helpful. Secure self parking with a guard in the lot, very convenient. "Envie" is a little coffee shop on a nearby corner and is a good place to eat or get coffee or a drink. Tourist shops and small bars close to the hotel on Decatur, but you can avoid some "undesireables" by walking on Chartres instead. Nice little pool. Recommend you try The Gumbo Shop, Petunias, Marketplace Cafe and the Old Coffee Pot for meals. We booked directly with the hotel, and got a good discount on the room. Recommend a City/Cemetary small bus tour for anyone unfamiliar with the city. If you are taking a Swamp Tour, be sure to do it on a sunny day. Unlikely to see much wildlife on a cloudy day.

Reviews.Title: “Classy”
Reviews.Author: RNAlbany
Reviews.Content: Le Richelieu is a wonderful place to stay. It is a very classy hotel in the French quarter. The room was very clean and the decor was classy (though some might say a bit outdated). If you are a purist or into tradition, this is your place. The restaurant was great (Breakfast (yummy GRITS!) and Lunch only). The location is excellent for those who don't have a car. If you do have a car, the parking is FREE! Guests must leave their keys at the desk (open 24 hrs). This makes you feel welcome and forces you to interact with the employees. As a result, we made many discoveries based on their recommendation. John, in particular, was a true consierge. I highly recommend this hotel and chose it based upon the other high reviews posted here.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet hotel, excellent location, great price!”
Reviews.Author: Bill P
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Le Richelieu for 3 nights. Got a quiet stay at a great location at a terrific price. It was clean and the room was good size for a French Quarter hotel. The hotel staff was incredibly nice and courteous. We did have one problem, staff needs to be more careful to check their information before passing it on to guests. The staff gave a dinner recommendation at a restaurant that had been closed since Katrina. We called and the desk indicated they would make a reservation for us. When we checked for directions before leaving for the restaurant the staff on duty at the time told us that restaurant was closed. Another time the staff directed us to a restaurant for breakfast that did not open until Noon. Those issues aside, the stay was a good one. Le Richelieu is in a perfect location for visiting the French Quarter. The Quarter is in good shape and the businesses are all very appreciative of their customers. Restaurants are outstanding, as always. Give New Orleans a try and consider Le Richelieu, just double check any recommendations they give you.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint and Quiet”
Reviews.Author: faithd58
Reviews.Content: My aunt and I traveled to New Orleans for the weekend. What a great little boutique hotel! The staff were pleasant. The location was great..close enough to everything, yet in a quiet location. New Orleans is a city where you need to walk around to see and enjoy everything. This hotel was close to the French Market, the Riverwalk Cable Car/Train, and a block or two from Bourbon Street. Although we ate at other venues in New Orleans, we had breakfast here and it was excellent. The service was wonderful. Bar drinks, although somewhat pricey were weighted with the appropriate amount of liquor. The waiter was friendly and accomodating. He even helped me to get breakfast from another restaurant at 2 am as the hotel's kitchen closes down after midnight. The front desk was very nostalgic (old time room keys which you left at the desk when leaving). The midnight shift clerk was friendly and helpful (I think her name was Annie) and she provided us with local information when we requested it. The courtyard, parking and rooms were all impeccably clean. The beds were comfortable. My only complaint was that I felt that the room was a little musty smelling for whatever the reason. We had a wonderful time at the Le Richelieu and will return when we come back to New Orleans. It was an extremely pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice”
Reviews.Author: JillMarie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Le Richelieu in 1997 and had a pleasant experience. We have also stayed at other hotels in the quarter on other trips. When we decided to drive to New Orleans recently, the Richelieu was an obvious choice because of their free and secure parking. The only problem we had was upon check-in when we were given our room and it had no windows. The gentleman at the front desk promply found us a new room with a balcony and two windows. The front desk staff was also helpful when we planned drives to plantation and swamp tours. I was a bit apprehensive about taking a trip to New Orleans at this time because of hurricane Katrina. My fears were unfounded. The french quarter is as wonderful as ever. Some restaurants have changed their hours. There were actually fewer pan handlers and street performers as in the past. Other parts of the city and surrounding area were clearly still devistated from the hurricane. Le Richelieu has a great location and the parking situation there is exceptional. Some of the fixtures and furnishings in the hotel are old and some would say outdated. However, the french quarter for that matter is "old" and it's history is what makes it so unique.

Reviews.Title: “Made the Trip”
Reviews.Author: PalmsandSun
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to New Orleans was made even better by this hotel. The room was so nicely done and very clean. Staff were top notch - polite and helpful. We had lots of touristy questions and they were eager to show off their city. They helped us arrange tours outside the city as well. The location of this hotel is great. Easy walk through French Quarter. Cafe Beignet was great for breakfast or lunch. K Pauls had fabulous dinner. Its good to see tourism is coming back here. You would never guess there was hurricane damage when you are in the FQ or Garden District. Charming hotel. Charming city.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: sfuji1
Reviews.Content: I also chose this hotel based upon the reviews here and was surprised that this hotel is near the bottom as far as favorite choices while others showing unfavorable experiences appear towards the top of the list. The rooms were rather large, our closet opened up to a mini kitchen, fridge, sink and oven! The room and the mini kitchen area was very clean and most likely hardly ever used. The french door opens up to a wonderful shared balcony and best of all, parking was free smack dab in the french quarter. The office staff was very very helpful and recommended clubs that reflected the music of the real New Orleans. (Snug Harbor) Everything is within walking distance and the hotel/area at night is very quiet. We walked all around and outside of the French Quarter well past midnight (two women) and felt very safe. The bathroom was small, but very clean. Did not eat at the restaurant there, nor use the pool due to lack of time. My only tip is to check several websites before calling the hotel directly. I was given an AAA discounted rate of 100.00/night while other websites were offering 80.00/night. The hotel has a 48 hour cancellation policy. I've stayed at several hotels in the French Quarter and would list this as one of my favorites.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location; nice place”
Reviews.Author: helloaud
Reviews.Content: Based on reviews on this site, we chose Le Richelieu. It was perfect for us (30's couple who came to play AND rest). The location is far enough off Bourbon that it was quiet, but close to everything, including the Frenchman clubs. Having the pool was great in August. The free parking was a great value - we didn't drive for 4 days. Our room was very cool and quiet (my sister stayed somewhere else for about $35 cheaper and her room was at 80 degrees the entire time and very loud). Granted, you could hear people come home a little tipsy on Saturday night...but it's New Orleans! The bed was comfy and the room in reasonably good repair. It had a fridge. The toilet did run and we reported it several times. As Texans, it pained us to see the water wasted. After a little while, we realized water is not so much a premium there! The front desk staff was very helpful. We only had coffee and croissants at the restaurant. They were pretty busy and I found the staff rather curt. All in all - a great experience. I suspect we will return.

Reviews.Title: “Le Richelieu Delight”
Reviews.Author: doc rich
Reviews.Content: Stayed in New Orleans for 3 nights during our driving trip through Tennessee, Mississippi and Louisiana. We chose Le Richelieu mainly because it had parking but were very pleased to find a delightful old style hotel full of character & charm. The staff were friendly & helpful with advice on restaurants & tours. The room was clean and comfortable with plenty of character, we knew we were staying in the French Quarter. The location was excellent in a quiet street a short walk from the bars, restaurants and other attractions of the French Quarter and within easy reach of the river tram line if you didnâ€™t fancy the walk to Canal Street. This is a real French Quarter hotel in a quiet location with free parking, what more could you want?

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at Le Richelieu”
Reviews.Author: gayleg
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a convention in New Orleans. My stay at Le Richelieu was first-rate. The recently redecorated room was very comfortable, the staff at the hotel were accommodating and helpful in every way, the restaurant food was good and the rate was reasonable. The hotel is located in the quiet end of the French Quarter and is well-located for very good restaurants. The Riverfront streetcar stop is close by and the French Market is two short blocks away. I highly recommend this hotel. New Orleans was a pleasure to visit--restaurants, clubs and shops are open and the charm of the city is still very much there.

Reviews.Title: “View from two college students on budget”
Reviews.Author: mbtran321
Reviews.Content: - Stayed from Fri July 29 to Sun July 31. Made last minute reservations 2 days prior to coming. We came from houston(5-6 hrs) and had requested a great view. It was on 2nd floor in the corner viewing barracks & Chatres. Great room and loved it. It was $119 a night that weekend. Restrooms, tubs, sinks, bath, bed, carpet, closet were clean and smelled great. Making reservations be sure to ask what comes in room and if what views there are to make it better room for you. - Parking was great becuase it includes free parking in the back, small but you park your own car and it fits and great. Visitors can park as long as you ask and tell the people at the parking booth. - You can leave your key with the front desk when you leave to go around town so you dont have to lug the key with a large block with it. - Front desk is 24 hrs open - They have a pool area, and a lounge area , although i did not try out the pool or lounge. Everytime i walk by the lounge had people eating talking etc and pool side was clean and great. - Location is great too. Anywhere in FQ i beleive is good becuase you can walk the entire length of FQ in 15-25 min. Walking is main way but this hotel always has 2-3 taxis lined up in front of the hotel for guests if needed. Most take cash only or credit card if $10 or higher. Varies from cabby to cabby. - Crime and safety - Stayed out from 10 am - 3 am everynight (fr/sat) and walked from hotel up to bourbon/burgandy to canal to dakutar. As long as you take the main streets i think its safe. People still walk around that time. use your common sense and you should be ok. - Maid service for our stay came at 10 am each morning but we did not need anything and she was very polite and kind. - room is good size and you get cable tv (several channels) - The room if u have a balcony with your room there is one door by bed that is covered by drapery that you can open up to the balcony. 2nd floor all balcony are connected. 3rd floor i beleive has their own seperate if they even get a balcony. - You get small fridge, towlels, ice bucket with several cups, iron board, hair dryer, tv, phone, a/c, fan, 3 dressers. - We had a street 2nd floor room facing 2 streets, but at nights/days very little noise can be heard or not at all. neighboring rooms could not be heard as well. It rained and we could barley tell/hear it rain till we looked outside.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Le Richlieu for 6 days in early June and don't a have a negative thing to say about the experience. The rooms were large and spotless. The room had always been cleaned when we returned. The walk-in closet was fantastic and the bathrooms are great w/all the counter space and drawers. The staff is friendly and helpful w/o being overbearing. I won't stay anywhere else. Great location, close enough to walk but away from the noise of Bourbon St. We felt safe walking back to our room from Boubon and Frenchmen St. Talk to the satf, they have excellent recommendations for tours, restaurants and music (some which are better because they are off the beaten path).

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ness3
Reviews.Content: My husband and I arrived at the Richelieu on July 16...what a pleasant surprise. The hotel is clean, the staff is very friendly, and the free parking can't be beat! We stayed in room 119 overlooking the swimming pool and it was a nice size King room with walk-in closets, 30" refrigerator, and a large bathroom with ample counter space. The room had high ceilings and a couple of chairs too. After staying at the Monteleone in the past, this room was gigantic! It smelled clean and yes, there was a water spot on the ceiling, but nothing to make you want to move rooms. Only "downfalls"....we had a beer at the small bar one afternoon and wasn't overly impressed with the beer choices, but hey, there are plenty of places to go in the FQ! Coffee in the morning was $2 a cup - seemed a little steep for having to walk to the restaurant to get it, but then again, no big deal! We would certainly return. We stayed out late some nights and felt safe walking to the hotel at night - we just ambled back to the hotel on Chartres and didn't have a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, lovely atmosphere, ok location”
Reviews.Author: Nigella_23
Reviews.Content: Me and two of my friends went to the Essence Fest this year and stayed at La Richelieu. The hotel is about a 6 block walk to Bourbon and a trolley ride to The Riverwalk. The walk to Bourbon can be a little intense in heels ladies so it is just as easy to hop in a cab. The hotel is close to Jackson Square and the French Market though which was nice. There is a trolly station a block behind the hotel which can get you to the Riverwalk in no time. All in all, it is a great hotel! There were so many people in town for the festival it was nice to stay in a hotel not smack dab in the middle of everything. We partied hard, but also relaxed poolside and enjoyed the hospitatility and charm of the hotel. The staff was very friendly and the breakfast, oh my goodness, the breakfast was delicious. Essence Fest was off the hook so we will be returning next year, but might stay closer to Bourbon next time. If we can't get a hotel a little closer, then we have no problem booking our stay with La Richelieu again. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to stay in th Quarter”
Reviews.Author: scubadiver5
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for four nights from 31st may to 4th June 05, extending our booking for the extra night, mainly due to how impressed we were with the hotel. The hotel is situated at the quiet end of the French Quarter and we found it within convenient walking distance for all the sites, bars, restaurants etc. Our room was overlooking the small courtyard and pool and was plenty big enough for the huge bed, and furniture and came complete with a seperate walk in closet for clothes, which we found very useful. I had read reviews about the hotel being "worn around the edges" and "run down" - to be honest, apart from the ancient TV ( which still had a remote and worked perfectly) the hotel was absolutely spotless and the furniture fitted in perfectly with the age of the building and the style of the FQ ( it was certainly not worn) A special word must go to the staff - never in my my life have I come across such a friendly and helpful staff - they continually gave us useful tips and suggestions for things to do and were always willing to chat - not something you often find in hotels these days. Another big plus for the hotel is the fact that it offers free secure off road parking - a huge luxury in the Quarter. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to New Orleans and would certainly use it again myself

Reviews.Title: “Noisey due to constrution”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When we 1st arrived the staff was very nice and coutesty, greeted us with a warm welcome. The hotel is a older one, however it was very clean and descent. It's a little further off the end of the french quarter. Not right in the heart of it. It actually was a good location because when you were ready to call it a night then you wouldn't hear all the hoopla. It's right by the flea market . We did have a problem on the 2nd night they were painting or doing some kind of construction which was very very very noisey to the point that we could not sleep . It was very annoying. We called front desk to complain about the noisy and they said that it should stop in about 20min well 20min turned into allday. When we checked out of the hotel we spoke to the manager about the noise and she was not so sympathetic. We were saying what happen to the people that we so courtesy when we check-in the other day. So that put a bad taste in our mouth about the hotel. When we go back in july for essence festival we will stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Le Richelieu can't be beat”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A clean, comfortable quiet room in the Quarter, friendly and attentive service, parking included, and all at less than $100/night. No reason to look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Le Richelieu stay on 5/21-22”
Reviews.Author: AlabamaYankee
Reviews.Content: First trip ton NOLA and stayed over the weekend of 5/21-22. Even though the hotel is old, the room (#403) was clean, well kept and provided all the basic amenities (TV, refrig., iron, etc...). If you like firm beds this is the place! :-) The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. It is in the "quiet side" of the french quarter, which was really nice, but a bit far to walk to the other side of the french quarter if you are not wearing confortable shoes. Plus, the majority of guest are not in town to party so there were not any late night commotions. Was very happy with my experience and would have no problem recommending this hotel to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Le Richelelieu was wonderful!!!”
Reviews.Author: dedesmom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Le Richelieu, in the quiet part of the French Quarter and absolutely loved it! Our rooms faced Chartres St., which had some interesting homes...and in the early morning, watching the sunrise from our balcony was very beautiful. I was happy to have a ceiling fan along with the AC. Our room and the lobby had a lot of old elegant charm. We loved having a full size fridge and counter...we picked up fresh strawberries from the French Market (3 blocks away) every day. Pam and Linda, who worked at the front desk, were sooo helpful and friendly! Our rooms were always cleaned and ready for us whenever we came back. We don't have any negative things to say about this place at all. It was truly a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Grear hotel/value”
Reviews.Author: roccgt
Reviews.Content: This is one of the larger hotels in the french/old quarter. Like most hotels in the 1/4, it is old, but is well maintained and clean. It is well located, near the French Market, and somewhat away from all the noise, etc. The big advantage with this hotel is the FREE parking lot adjacent to the hotel. Most 1/4 hotels charge about $20 per night for "valet" parking. I will definitely stay here again, assuming a good rate (paid $105/nite plus tax, for mid- may 2005, last minute, through hotel by phone). Oddity: This is the first hotel I have ever stayed where the people at the desk ask us to leave our room key at the front desk each time we left.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful-would return and recommend”
Reviews.Author: ciaradoris
Reviews.Content: I think I read every review on this hotel. My experience was "excellent". I had room #119 which faced the pool and the window opened. From the moment I arrived at LeRichelieu I was 100% happy. The lobby was filled with art work and the reception personnel were extremely helpful. I didn't get a balcony room but had a comfortable king size bed. The room was pleasantly decorated with one wall of mirrors, and art on the walls. The closet was a walk-in and the bathroom was oversized. The room was spotless. There were heavy curtains that pulled closed for the evening and the room was very quiet. There was AC, a ceiling fan and a TV (no cable)--but by the time I got in every night I was exhausted from walking-so didn't watch TV anyway. There is a lovely pool area (well taken care of). Another "plus" for LeRichelieu was their restaurant. You could have breakfast inside or outside by the pool (what a nice touch). There was also a full sized bar. The location was perfect "away from the maddening crowd" and we stayed for 4 nights. What was interesting was the age group of people in the hotel. I would have to say that the average age was 45+. I would imagine that if you were on the first floor and did not face the pool that the room might be dark and dingy because you can't open the windows as they are right on the sidewalk. Just make sure to request an inside room. I had such a wonderful time in New Orleans and everyone was so hospitable. Oh, by the way, I booked this on hotels.com and even with that booking got a great room. If you go, stay at the LeRichelieu and you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay at Le Richelieu”
Reviews.Author: Ladyfrommiami
Reviews.Content: After reading all about this hotel on Tripadvisor and other places, we booked a room here for 3 nights. Asked for a quiet room facing the courtyard. Was told that it wouldn't be a problem since all double/doubles face the courtyard. Well, I was shown the room when we arrived. It was on the ground floor right on a street. We were told that this was the ONLY room available. Very small. The closet door opened into the bed. (seems that they block out rooms and don't allow for any changes) Fortunately, we were able to get a room at the Dauphine Orleans where we had a very enjoyable time.

Reviews.Title: “A Bit Seedy”
Reviews.Author: vtdukes
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Le Richelieu the first of March. We had stayed there before and found it unique and charming. I'm afraid that since then there has been absolutely nothing done to the place so that now it seems seedy and depressing. It comes with no amenities--not even coffee. I don't know when I have stayed in a room that didn't have a coffeepot. I asked for one--they sent me up a pot right away but I was told it didn't come with coffee. I went to the lobby for a cup and they charged me $2. All the employees seemed old and tired and somewhat rude. Our air conditioner did not work so we had to sleep with the door to the balcony open. It was rather loud at night. The price of the room is somewhat of a bargain but next time I will pay a little more for a lot nicer room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Le Richelieu from 3/5/05 - 3/9/05 while visiting New Orleans. It was a nice hotel, showed it's age, but that's how the French Quarter is. It was very close to all the tourist attractions (Bourbon St, French Market, Jackson Square). It was also ona residential street which made for a relaxing, quiet stay. Another couple we traveled with actually moved to Le Richelieu since their hotel was across from a jazz club that was loud until 5am. The front desk staff was very helpful. Price was a little steep, even on the discount sites, but I'd probably stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice hotel in quiet section of FQ”
Reviews.Author: RunnerGirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at LeRicheleau on 3/6 and 3/7. It is a very quaint hotel with a charming courtyard. The staff was very nice and the hotel very clean. It is in a quiet area of the French Quarter but walking distance to about anything we needed. French Market, Jackson Square, Streetcars, Bourbon Street. We really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Persephone20
Reviews.Content: Great location - in the French Quarter but not too close to Bourbon Street etc. Visited with children and had interconnecting rooms overlooking the courtyard and pool - ideal. Light meals also good value. Decor a bit tired. Very handy fo breakfast at the Croissant D'or which is unmissable.

Reviews.Title: “Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: All the medium posts I agree with--it is outdated but they are very helpful and it's very well located while still quiet. The beds and bedding are good, and that's important.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & comfortable stay; Very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: SommerWind
Reviews.Content: We had a really pleasant stay here in the quieter, residential section of the French Quarter. The rooms are basic but clean and comfortable. The sink faucet did operate a little strangely, but other than that, everything was fine. Room service is inexpensive and the food was good. The French Market is two blocks away as is the streetcar stop, which can take you to the shops at Riverwalk and various stops in between. It's only $1.25 and the cars come regularly. Cafe DuMonde and Jackson Square are also just a few blocks away -- as is Bourbon Street. Cabs are plenty and inexpensive if you don't feel like walking. A note of interest: on the same block as the hotel is the St. Ursuline Convent -- which is allegedly haunted. Found out about it on Lord Chaz's walking tour. If you're interested in the city's haunted history, don't miss it. He was fantastic! Overall, we were happy with our stay at LeRichelieu. The staff, as others have noted, are friendly and extremely helpful. They took the time to give us recommendations and tips to make our stay even better. For the personal attention, good value, and clean atmosphere, I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet yet Central”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was a good find in the French Quarter. Unlike the hotels on and around Bourbon Street - it was quiet and relaxing, yet it was just a two block walk to the French Market and the Riverside Trolley. It has a nice central courtyard with a pool and a small bar. Parking is available on site. On the downside, the rooms look circa 1960 in the roadside motel tradition. They were clean though, so I cannot complain. I slept well every night and enjoyed my stay very much.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I spent 5 days at Le Richelieu for a tradeshow this week and found it absolutely charming. The exterior and lobby are stunning. The bar/cafe is reasonably priced and the food good, especially the biscuits. The view of the courtyard and pool while dining is great. The staff is top notch. I spend 50+ nights a year in hotels and have not found a more helpful front desk staff. The rooms show some age, but as the owner of an old home I love the tile bath. Yes, the TV is older than me, but with Bourbon Street so close and Cafe Du Monde just minutes away, I honestly never turned it on. Everything in my room was clean and the daily service kept it spotless. The pillows were especially nice and I am quite picky about my pillows. In all, a terrific stay. If you are looking for a great experience at a good value, I highly recommend Le Richelieu.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic 25th wedding anniversary”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Le Richelieu over Labor Day and had a wonderful time. We were celebrating our 25th wedding anniversary and wanted to go back to the hotel we had visited 18 years ago for our 2nd honeymoon. We were not disappointed. It seemed in better shape this time than in 1986. For us the Richelieu is like an oasis of peace and good manners in the rowdy party that the French Quarter can be. It is easy walking distance to the heart of the quarter (Bourbon Street, the shops on Royal, Jackson Square, the French Market and the River) even at midnight. It is on a quiet residential street so you can get away from the throngs on Bourbon Street. We took a taxi once to a retaurant near the convention center, but we walked home after spending some time along the way. Keep in mind that this is a hotel in a historic district. with strict rules about development. The hotel opened in 1969, but the buildings date to the 1840s so don't expect everything to be brand new. That isn't the point. If you want to stay in a hotel where you can actually tell that you are in New Orleans, not by the noise or partying, but by the graciousness of the staff and the richness of the decor, stay here. I recommend it to my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Place to Stay in the French Quarter!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you want to experience New Orleans charm, then Le Richelieu is the place to stay. It is not your typical hotel chain. It exudes charm and is tastefully decorated. The hotel staff was exceptionally helpful, the rooms were clean, and the A/C worked just fine for relief from the hot and humid August days. You can walk to the French Market, Bourbon Street, and other spots in no time.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: JohannR
Reviews.Content: If you would like to stay in the French quarter, choose this one. The hotel is conveniently located on the boarder of French quarter, with easy access from all directions (interstate, us highways) and free on-site parking, still the French quarter itself is easily accessible, with all sights in walking distance. The hotel itself is charming, with nicely decorated rooms, a romantic courtyard with swimming pool and a good restaurant, e.g. for having breakfast there. All that at very reasonable rates. Definitely a recommendation for tourists.

Reviews.Title: “We Weren't Disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: kahb1
Reviews.Content: After researching many hotels, my husband and I decided on Le Richelieu for our vacation in sweltering June 04. Reservationist was friendly and the rate was reaasonable - we paid about $110 per night including taxes. The hotel was easy to find, and is the only hotel in the French Quarter with a large free on-site parking lot, which was a huge plus. The building was attractive and appeared well-maintained. The cosy courtyard has a smallish pool, but plenty of tables to eat outside or enjoy a Sazerac cocktail. The interior is decorated in the classic old New Orleans style - comfortably worn with interesting historical pictures and documents lining the walls. At check in, my requested balcony room was not available - but we did get a non-smoking room with refrigerator. We stayed in room 115, with a lovely view overlooking the parking lot. The room was large and actually had at one time been an apartment, as there was a kitchenette with a sink and non-functioning stove along with the fridge. The front desk delivered a coffeemaker and sugar, etc. immediately upon request. The bathroom was adequate with a standard sink, toilet, and shower set-up. The air-conditioning worked fantastic, but could be switched off if desired. The windows opened which was nice to listen to the rain. The hotel requires you to drop off the key whenever you leave. I am familiar with this as it is done in England this way, but I have read other reviews where guests thought it was inconvenient. We thought it was cool - no need to carry your key and gave you a chance to chat with the folks at the front desk. There is a cute small bar on-site. They do serve food which looked good, but we never had a chance to eat there. If you want to stay at a hotel that captures the essence of New Orleans, this is it. If you are wanting a modern hotel and like everything to be new, keep looking. We loved our stay and wouldn't hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Old World Charm; more like Old Outdated Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The outside of the hotel is was beautiful it was two block from bourbon street the very end of bourbon street in which we had to walk in 3 or 4 blocks to get to the bars, but that wasn't anything maior we got to walk off the food and booze, but inside the guestrooms it was very outdated the TV channels did not work the whole 5 days we stayed the blankets on the bed were filthy, the bathrooms definitely needs to be upgraded; mold on the shower heads and around the tub, I travel A LOT so I have comparisons and believe me the Le Richilieu is the worst hotel I have ever been in I will not be staying there ever again and this is my second time in New Orleans, the first time we stayed at the Dauphine Orleans, that was a nicer hotel and I believe they gave the dauphine less stars than Le Richilieu

Reviews.Title: “Gross”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I traveled with my 5 friends and we stayed in Le Richelieu over the 4th of July weekend. This is our second trip to New Orleans. We stayed last time in the Dauphine. It was splendid hotel. First let me say the staff at the Richelieu was generally nice and helpful. Check in was painless and we were given 2 rooms next to each other. The meals we ate in the hotel restaurant were fine. The Richelieu needs major renovation. One, the Elevator is a death trap. If you press the floor before everyone is in the elevator the doors slams on you. One friend got crunched in the doors. Two, half of the t.v. channels didn't work (possibly because the t.v. is older than I am). Three, the wall paper in the bathroom has specks of black mold behind it and the tiles were slightly moldy. They should really re-caulk. The rugs need major shampooing. My friend would not sleep with her bed spread on the bed because there was a snotty boaga on it. I checked my bed spread and found a skid mark (very brown and very suspicious). At least the sheets were clean I just wanted to point out I know for a fact that they do not clean the bed spreads in between guest. Very nasty and I won't be going back. I don't mind it not being luxurious but the dirty bed spreads did it for me! Gross!

Reviews.Title: “needs renovation!”
Reviews.Author: phillysis
Reviews.Content: I was booked at this hotel for 4 nights from July 1, 2004 thru July 5,2004 for the Essence Music Festival. I previously stayed at this hotel in 1998 for the same reason and was pleased. This time around, however, the stay was just ok. The room I was in, room 305, had a perpetual musty odor. No matter how much perfume I sprayed or even after opening the the french door, it still smelled musty. I dont know if it is because of New Orleans heat, humidity or rain or because of the old air conditioner, but that musty smell aggravated my hay fever. The room was clean, but the bed skirt had "mysterious" stains and I NEVER slept in the bed, only ON it. The rate was affordable $150.00 per night with tax and the location is a good one... close enough to Bourbon street but without the noise. It is two blocks from the farmers market and the french market. The hallways are rather dark and dingy. The "antiques" is really just old furniture. The whole place needs refurbishing. I'll book far enough in advance to be able to stay at a more modern hotel. Also, one of the most irritating rules of the hotel is that you must give your room key to the front desk whenever you leave the hotel and ask for it when you come back. They only ask for your name upon your return and dont ask for id...so I'm not surprised that a guest has something stolen from their room. I've never heard of a hotel asking for a guest's room key. Although, I'll stay somewhere else, this hotel served its purpose...a place to lay my head and get a shower.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: morgan
Reviews.Content: It was our first visit to New Orleans in sept 2002 It's an experience we'll never forget. The staff at the hotel were really warm, friendly and so helpful with great ideas of places to visit. The rooms were clean and the food was great. We have no complaint about this hotel, it's set in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: carmenb333
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful little gem in the French Quarter! We were in New Orleans May 4-9, 2004 and it was one of the most enjoyable visits I've had there. Le Richelieu was quiet and so very charming! The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful with whatever we needed. The room was spotless and much to our liking. I would definitly recommend this place to anyone anytime!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great atmosphere in the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Le_Dap
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here with friends in a two bed suite over Jazz Fest. We enjoyed the atmosphere of Le Richelieu enormously and liked both the helpful staff and the spacious accommodation. The 'kitchen' was a slight disappointment as there were no plates, cutlery or utensils and the cooker was permanently disconnected. For us, the location was ideal, being in a quieter part of the French Quarter but within easy walking distance of the 'action' on Bourbon Street. The proximity of the Palm Court Jazz Cafe and Coops' lively bar is a bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel warm friendly New Orleans Style”
Reviews.Author: mshollywood
Reviews.Content: As a Travel Agent, I look for places for my clients to stay and enjoy the experiences of the destinations they choose. This hotel is a small friendly feeling of the local New Orleans Style. The staff is friendly, the mood is intimate. The courtyard is private and there is free secure parking. It's not unlikely to see locals visiting the small resturant/bar and the feeling of upscale surrounds you. It may not have the gift shops, the variety of resturants, fitness centers, or hair salons, but if your wanting that sort of vacation, then the marriott type hotel is for you. Personally, when I go on vacation or a quick get-a-way, I have my hair and nails done, the massage, and facial, before I leave home. I don't like to waste my time doing the things I can have done in my own town. As for shops, New Orleans, is full of resturants, gift shops, antique shops and just about anything else you are looking for. The staff will guide you thru finding the best and safest route to get to those places and give you lists of resturants you can choose from. If you don't stay at this hotel, you will never have the opportunity to experience a Great Hotel! If it's good enough for the "stars" to visit then I think it's good enough for me and my clients!

Reviews.Title: “Airport Privy or Hotel Room? April 2004”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am not sure what is worse. A hotel that caters only to the chain smoker or the toilet mint deodorant used to try to mask the smell for non-smokers. Truly skeeved out. The entire floor, room, linens, drapes, everything smelled like an airport privy. Add the wafting cigarette smoke from multiple rooms and voila, a dive hotel is born. You can get much more for your $$ in New Orleans - we chose the place for the free parking and location. While the location and indeed the staff were nice - (and they were) the place has got to clean up its act. But they will have to start with tearing out the carpeting given that the stink is so strong. Not sure about the other floors or suites - but our experience was a bad one. We smelled both the smoke and toilet mint off our clothes several hours after we had checked out.

Reviews.Title: “Laid Back”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I love the historic French quarter. The hotel has a different feel than most hotel in New Orleans. It is in the more quiet part and not commercialized. No hype, just a good hotel that is not overpriced. Couldn't be more happy with the stay and would recommend this place to everyone. Not kid friendly though.

Reviews.Title: “Pearl necklace was stolen!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I don't think I've ever written a negative review before, but I think it's important for people to know that my pearl necklace was stolen from my room when I stayed at Le Richelieu. Although it probably wasn't worth more than a couple hundred dollars, it had a lot of sentimental value. In retrospect, it was probably negligent of me to leave it in my suitcase in my room, however, I thought the hotel was reputable and safe. When I told the management that it was missing, they said all their employees were very trustworthy, and they were actually a bit rude. They seemed to imply I had somehow lost it. This was about 3 years ago, so hopefully things have improved since then! While this is a beautiful hotel in a great location, I would be very careful about keeping valuables under lock and key!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Staff, and a Perfect 25th!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked the anniversary suite nearly a year in advance to celebrate our 25th anniversary, and we weren't disappointed. A bottle of champagne awaited us, and the room - with its pair of French doors overlooking the quiet end of the French quarter - made a welcoming and comfortable headquarters for touring. The front-desk staff were especially courteous and professional, even setting us up with their favorite waiter for an unforgettable night at Antoine's that included a personal guided tour of the entire premises. To top it all off, even during peak season the rates are competitive with a king room anywhere near the business district or Bourbon street. We can't wait to return to New Orleans, and will definitely book the Richelieu when we do.

Reviews.Title: “A very disappointing return to this hotel, never again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: In 2002, I and another couple had stayed here, and were quite pleased with the large rooms, the friendly staff, the free parking, and the nice location away from the wilder part of the Quarter. Therefore, without qualms I booked a two room suite for December 2003 for my honeymoon. What a mistake! Here are a few highlights: The tables were never cleaned in the rooms, and showed glass water marks throughout our stay; the bathmat was removed after use and not replaced; when room service was used, the waiter dropped a danish on the floor and then put it on the plate and gave it back to us (maybe he did us a favor, as the rest of the food was pretty much inedible); one of the two beds was very uncomfortable and lumpy; the water pressure in the shower was low; the elevator would close on you very quickly and not bounce away like most do if they catch you (and my poor husband with a cast was hit by those doors so many times!); the plastic flowers in the room looked like they hadn't been dusted since the place was built; and, wouldn't you think with us spending over a thousand dollars for a few nights, someone could have said "Congratulations" on the wedding? Instead we didn't even get a smile! And believe me, we aren't whiners and complainers, and this is the only negative review on a hotel I have ever written, but it is still bothering me over a month later, that we threw away more money than some top hotels were asking, to have such an unpleasant stay when things should have been so memorable (in a good way!). What was once retro and charming has become overpriced and threadbare. We'll be staying elsewhere our next visit - despite this hotel, New Orleans is a magical city!

Reviews.Title: “Hated the cocktails”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hello...concierge!!! What about the promised complimentary cocktails (of which were watered down and not up to Southern Standards, even by Georgia standards!!). Oh, and don't even think about trying to sneak extra people into a room...remember what happened to Paul McCartney.

Reviews.Title: “A fine place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Allen727286
Reviews.Content: La Richelieu was adequate and serviceable. Having visited the Quarter last year and stayed at one end, we wanted to stay at the other end of the Quarter. The location near the French Market in a quiet area was great. The parking was very convenient and made accessibility to the car a real plus. The room was fine. It was consistent with other hotels at this level. The front desk was nice and welcoming. If you want a good room and location without expecting the hotel to add much or detracting from your stay, La Richelieu works well.

HotelInfo.Name: Le Richelieu in the French Quarter
HotelInfo.Address: 1234 Chartres St., New Orleans, LA 70116
